title: 22 Tricks that Make it Look Like You Hired an Interior Designer
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: Do you want a perfectly furnished home that looks like you hired aninterior designerto decorate it? Then there are 22 really useful tricks that will help you make your home even more stylish and tasteful—without any professional help.
The most important thing whenfurnishinga room is to have enough space between the individual pieces of furniture. This is the only way to use a room practically and comfortably.
Seating furniture in different colours brings life into the room. To avoid a busy overall look, make sure that the pieces are in the same style and material.
With a statement armchair that stands out from the crowd, you can set accents in even the simplest of environments.
Side tables are also a great way to add that special something to yourliving room.
A uniform wow look is created when you paint not only the walls but also the ceiling in a colour other than white.
A room appears particularly harmonious when it follows a sophisticated colour palette whose individual elements are perfectly coordinated.
It can also be done without any colour: the trendy all-white look is currently on everyone's lips and is super easy to implement.
Just as pure white on white is natural, neutral colours and materials can make the room appear particularly relaxed and calm.
Size doesn't matter? Unfortunately, that doesn't apply to choosing a carpet. It should not be too small, but of course not too big either.
Gold-framed family photos may look good on Grandma's mantelpiece, but we prefer something a little more modern and fresh and go for cooler alternatives.
If you place your lights in the bathroom to the side of the mirror instead of above it, you can enjoy softer, friendlier light.
In a picture gallery, all the frames should always fit well together.
Even with a single picture in XXL format, you can make a real statement at home.
Wood is and remains the number one material in interior design. However, make sure that individual types of wood and designs do not clash.
With at least three different light sources, you can create an atmospheric setting in any room.
A colourfully painted apartment door is a cool eye-catcher for the hallway.
Strong patterns are certainly allowed and even desired, as long as you don't overdo it.
With chic scented candles, you can kill two birds with one stone and appeal to several senses at once: They look elegant and exude an irresistible scent.
There are decorative accessories that only really come into their own when used in groups. Vases are one of them.
If you want to give works of art on the wall the ideal stage, you should hang them at eye level.
But hanging them up is not a must. The modern way of decorating walls is that you can simply lean pictures casually.
With high-quality fabrics and textiles, you can round off your interior in a homely manner and ensure just the right amount of cosiness.

title: 15 Mirrors in The Hallway—Between Decoration and Practical Helper
author: Mel—homify
article_paragraphs: Mirrors in thehallwayare a tricky thing. On the one hand, they can be stylish decorative elements that significantly shape the look of your entrance area. On the other hand, they also have a practical function. Before you leave the house, you quickly check whether your coat fits, your hair is done and whether a scarf makes sense or not.
Where exactly does the mirror fit best in your hallway? And which shapes are suitable for which styles? In the following idea book, we have put together a few modern looks for you.
Hallways come in all sizes and shapes, but they are often neglected in terms of design compared to other rooms.
To create a welcoming atmosphere, it is worth looking extensively for the right mirror. On the long sides of a hallway, a mirror visually enlarges the room.
We recommend:10 Amazing Ideas to Get that Gorgeous Entrance to Your Home.
Without going into too much detail aboutFeng Shuiat this point, it should be said that Far Eastern teachings certainly have an opinion on mirrors.

You should avoid mirrors on the wall opposite the front door. As soon as a visitor comes to your home, their reflection,their karma,will be reflected. For this reason, according toFeng Shui,guests do not feel welcome.
The size is a question of taste. It certainly makes sense to choose a hallway mirror that gives you enough information about your appearance.
Large mirrors are therefore not only impressive but also practical. Smaller models, on the other hand, are more flexible in terms of design and can be used more as a decorative element.

You should hang your mirror so that your face is aligned with the middle of the mirror. With longer models, this rule of thumb can be treated more flexibly, although mirrors that hang too low can quickly look squat.
A wooden frame gives the cool elegance of the mirror surface a balancing touch. Natural charm combines with timelessness.
Frames are made from different materials. Resin, plastic compounds, stainless steel, cast iron and more all have different feels and looks.
The main aim is to support the desiredinterior designstyle. In general, plastic frames are not recommended unless they are made of recycled material.
Classic frames give the mirror a special elegance and make it the focal point in every hallway, regardless of its size.
Antique gold frames can be recognized by the fact that they are covered in gold leaf. This makes the surface a little uneven and the colouring less uniform.
If you have a certain retro chic style in your home, you can combine it wonderfully with a matching hallway mirror. You can find second-hand pieces as well as purchase high-quality new productions.
Which type of retro you choose is of course entirely up to you. The brave ones even dare to mix different styles.
Frameless mirrors are not just for the bathroom. These mirror models are usually so understated that they almost seem cold.
You can combine them with impressive wall colours and pieces of furniture. The more the size of the mirror matches its surroundings, the more harmonious the overall ensemble will be.
Modern mirrors come in all sorts of shapes, materials and colours. They help you to create a harmonious design even in a neglected hallway.
So plan it right from the start, whether you are building a new house or renovating it.
Round mirrors appear in various living spaces. Their organic shape reflects a desire for closeness to nature and security.
There are no sharp corners or edges here. Cosy hallways are in fashion, because here too the living area is more than just a walk-through room.
The Scandi style is only sparingly suited to design with mirrors. This is mainly because proximity to nature is important and it is more about working with natural fibers and wood.
When mirrors are used, they follow a clear decorative language, small bows to the elemental powerof waterand its manifold reflections.
Illuminated mirrors in the hallway are a great thing. Ultimately, it's worth taking a closer look at this point.
Such models are still unusual, but that shouldn't stop you from installing an illuminated mirror. Check beforehand whether there is already a power connection for the wall lighting.

Mirroring a built-in closet in the entrance area kills two birds with one stone. Jackets, coats and shoes disappear after you arrive and you can check your face for any inconsistencies at the same time.
A straightforward solution for the hallway that impresses with its elegance and is, therefore, suitable for almost any interior design style.
Integrating wardrobes skilfully into a home style is not always easy. However, some models look like built-in wardrobes, even if they are not built-in wardrobes.
A large mirror connected to it makes the transition to the wall disappear. With this type of variant, it is simply a question of correct placement and installation.
A mirror does not always have to be visible. Especially if you are planning to integrate a wardrobe into the hallway, an internal mirror can be a good option.
Since this is only possible with swing doors, this option is particularly suitable for larger hallways in which the mirror is not intended to be used to visually expand the area.

title: All-purpose Weapon Cola: 10 Ingenious Tricks That you Absolutely have to Try Out for Yourself!
author: Nina Neukowski
article_paragraphs: Cola is the number 1 soft drink in the world and is considered to be an extremely popular thirst quencher. But there are many other things that you can use the brown soft drink for. That may sound unbelievable, but it is possible and incredibly practical. The cola hacks that we want to show you today may sound quite unusual, but if you try them out, the results are amazing. Whether in thegarden,on the balcony or terrace, in the kitchen, in the bathroom, in the garage or even in the beauty area—a simple soft drink can enrich your everyday life enormously. Today we present you our top ten of the best cola hacks. So, off to the fridge!

Do you have a can of Coke left over from your cosy barbecue? Great! Pour it into the toilet bowl. No, we don't want to act like health advocates here and you don't want to flush it straight away—quite the opposite. The soft drink is meant to act as a toilet cleaner and is therefore left to work overnight. The next morning, any deposits, stubborn limescale and dirt will have been dissolved by the citric acid contained in the drink without any annoying scrubbing.

The soft drink can also be a practical helper in the kitchen. Using cola can save you time-consuming scrubbing and brushing, as the drink is ideal for cleaning burnt-on food in uncoated pots and pans.

To do this, simply pour some cola into the pot so that the crusted bottom is covered and leave it to work for a while, ideally overnight. The next morning, the dirt can be easily removed with a dishwashing sponge. Another, quicker option is to boil the soft drink in a dirty pan or burnt pot for a few minutes.

If you're not paying attention for a moment, it's already happened: a stain, and on your new shirt at that. No stain remover to hand? Here, too, you can safely reach for a Coke. The soft drink is excellent for removing annoying grease, blood or even felt-tip pen stains from clothing.

Simply apply some cola, leave it to work for a while and put it in the washing machine with the dirty clothes. After that, the stain will be gone. But be careful: you should not use dark-coloured soda on light or white fibres.

Dull, calcified tiles make even the most beautifulbathroomlook dull. Here, reaching for a bottle of Coke can help. The soft drink is very suitable as a tile cleaner. To make the tiles shine, add a quarter litre of sugar-free Coke to the cleaning water, wipe and the dull tiles on the walls and floors will shine in their old glory again.
For stubborn stains, you can also pour the cola directly onto the affected tiles and then rinse with plenty of water.
A pool should be cleaned regularly to ensure a pleasant bathing experience and also for hygienic reasons. But cleaning a pool also means a lot of work and is usually a rather annoying chore.

But the popular soft drink is supposed to help here too, and the pool will be sparkling clean again with cola. It is recommended to add two litres of cola directly to the pool water. Due to the acids it contains, the soft drink in the water is supposed to act as a practical rust remover and nothing stands in the way of bathing pleasure. However, if you are unsure about this tip, you should contact our pool professionals directly.
Iffurniturehas paint stains as a result of renovation work, rubbing the furniture with a cloth soaked in cola and then rinsing with water will ensure that these are removed immediately.

The brown soft drink can also be used cleverly in the beauty sector to remove colour. A hair conditioner with sugar-free cola removes hair dye from the hair if you have used the wrong colour. A permanently dyed hair colour can be lightened by a few shades with a soft drink. To do this, pour a bottle of cola onto your hair in the shower, let it work for a few minutes and then wash the hair out with a standard shampoo.

Cola can also be used in the garden as a cheap and effective pest control without using any toxic pesticides. To do this, pour a little cola into a small bowl. Insects such as beetles, snails or flies are attracted to the sweet soda, fall into the drink and are destroyed by the phosphoric and carbonic acid it contains.

A cheap and effective wasp trap can also be made easily with a little cola. To do this, cut off the top third of an empty plastic bottle, just below the neck. This piece is then put upside down in the bottle and stuck firmly with adhesive tape. The bottom is now filled with sugary cola, as this attracts the wasps. If the annoying little creatures climb through the narrow opening, there is no turning back for them and the insect problem is solved.

Another trick to remove unwanted insects from the car window without much effort is to soak a cloth in cola and wipe it quickly over the window. However, you should be careful not to touch the car paint to avoid paint damage.

Cola not only removes unwanted stains from clothing but also acts as an extremely effective neutralizer of stubborn odours. The soft drink is particularly effective at neutralizing gasoline, fish, and even animal odours. To remove odours from clothing, simply add a quarter litre of sugar-free cola to the washing machine during the normal wash cycle.

Rusty objects can be cleaned again with cola. The phosphoric acid effectively dissolves the existing rust. Smaller objects can be left in the drink for a while to remove the rust. Otherwise, the soft drink is simply poured onto a cloth and the rust is polished away.

Rusty screws or nuts can also be loosened with cola. Simply turn the screw or nut a little, then repeatedly moisten it with cola and allow it to take effect. The screw or nut should now be easier to loosen.

Fresh flowers in pretty vases are a wonderful eye-catcher in the house. But water alone is not enough to keep the flowers fresh for long. To make them last longer, it is recommended to put a little cola in the vase. The sugar contained in the soft drink keeps the flowers fresh, colourful and lively for longer.
This also applies to flowers on the balcony, terrace and in the garden. By adding cola to flowers such as azaleas or gardenias, the flowers can be fertilized safely and inexpensively.

title: 8 Inspiring front porch decoration ideas
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: Just as the living room and foyer are the face of a home and give guests an idea about home owner's status, the façade and front porch enhance its curb appeal. Even if the porch is small with a slim verandah and few steps leading up to the door it can be the perfect place to greet guests or even relax on evenings and just watch the people on the road. As the porch is a home's face to the outside world special attention has to be paid to create a presentable area with appropriate furniture, decorative plants and other details. Here are some ideas given by ourdecoratorsthat you can use to give a charming aura to this space and enjoy winter sunshine as long as it lasts.

This beautiful stone path leads the way to steps that bring guests onto the lovely open and elevated porch. The elevated pathway is the most common way to upgrade home entrance and give it an edge over other homes in the neighborhood.

Thoughtful mix of different textures and colors add character to this porch. This open space is aptly decorated with wooden furniture and natural fabrics to bring country style charm to the porch of thishousethat is partly covered by a short roof.

This arched roof with traditional terracotta tiles creates the ideal atmosphere to bring out rustic bamboo or wicker furniture and rustic ceiling light fixtures. The greenery along the porch's outer edge and steps leading up to it make this an ideal place to spend evenings talking with family.

Have a prefabricated house and are wondering if a porch can be accommodated, then explore this industrial style idea that has used two platforms to create an open porch. The slightly raised platform surrounded by pillars may be a little different from regular porches but provides the ideal setting with covered roof and comfortable setting for a relaxed evening. The plain table and chairs add to the industrial style of this simple porch.

There is no restriction on the type of ideal furniture for porches as the region can also become an ideal platform for showing off off vintage furniture that one owns. If you have classical style chintz or natural fabric covered antique furniture pieces lying around in the garage then showcase them on your porch. Get them repaired from acarpenterthat knows how to restore old furniture and urge him to make an antique worn out table with distressed wood the serving station for your porch.
If you lack space to decorate the front porch then give it a stylish edge with metal railing like this that will mark the boundary and also make it look distinct.

In this porch that is partly screened to enjoy outdoors during summer, the furniture and lighting are selected to suit weather across the year. The low roof keeps out the harsh midday sunlight and also creates a cozy atmosphere for lounging. Light color palette, stone flooring, wood furniture and stucco style design is the ideal porch layout that is displayed here.

When there are no restrictions of space and budget, then sky is the limit for porch decoration which is displayed here. The porch here has fountains, greenery, stone columns and other decorative items that give it a spectacular look from roof to floor.
Looking for some ideas to decorate your outdoor space? Do explore theseideas to make your patio look good.

title: Living in a Loft: 8 Really Cool Industrial Ideas
author: Denise Schopen
article_paragraphs: A loft is a storage or industrial space that has been converted into an apartment, hence the name, which in English simply describes an attic orstorage room.

In the 1940s, the first empty warehouses in New York City and London were converted into living spaces, with the building structure barely being changed. The apartments often covered the entire floor area. Furniture was simply placed inside. This is how the typical open apartments with large floor areas and high ceilings were created.

Modern lofts are no longer improvised apartments. They are created through extensive renovations of old industrial halls. Some new apartments andhouseswith an open design are also offered as lofts. Elements such as exposed concrete, unplastered brickwork exposed pipes, etc. are typical here.

Typical for the look of a loft are the high concrete walls and the spacious area of the apartment. Large window fronts, reminiscent of the original use of a loft or warehouse, are also characteristic. Todecoratethe apartment beautifully, white and brown furniture, some of which have a retro look, was used. A rather inconspicuous ceiling light provides the right light and ambience.

A historic cotton mill from the 19th century was extensively renovated for this residential loft. The open and flexible floor plan was nevertheless retained to underline the character of the loft. A screed grid was installed in the ceiling area to enable the installation of lights, projectors and more.

The existing screed in the floor was sanded and impregnated with a colourless finish, and any defects were repaired. The conversion is rounded off with the rightfurnishings.Modern furniture in cognac and turquoise and a red carpet brings a cosy warmth to the cool loft.

Entire houses can also be built and furnished in the style of a loft. Clinker walls, together with concrete and load-bearing beams and ceiling structures, create an industrial look. The modern furnishings and the stove attached to the ceiling make for an eye-catcher and a cosy atmosphere.

This friendly loft was designed on two floors. The clinker wall and the rustic gallery in industrial design match the white walls and the fine parquet floor perfectly. The furnishings are in grey and brown colours. The lighting and the choice of pictures are subtle.

A white loft is also a beautiful and trendy design idea. White and grey tones create a homely atmosphere in this living example. Concrete elements underline the cool look of this living loft even more.

An old workshop shines in new splendour. In this loft apartment, great importance was placed on an old-school implementation of the loft idea. Cosy comfort together with ultra-modern kitchen and electrical appliances not only harmonize, they also provide a first-class living experience. The Schmidt kitchen was installed according to the customer's wishes.

In this modern loft, light and steel elements are at the heart of the design. On the top floor of the loft, two galleries are connected by a long suspended walkway. Above the walkway is a glass roof that opens up the view of the sky.

This comfortably designed loft features a lot of wood combined with clinker bricks and metal elements. The warm atmosphere is further enhanced by the use of targeted lighting. Large windows with wooden frames and modern furniture such as the red bar stools complete the look of this special loft.

title: Panduan Lengkap untuk Dagangan di Malaysia
author: Maria Ferrant Homify
article_paragraphs: Dalam dunia kewangan moden, perdagangan dalam talian telah menjadi salah satu cara yang popular untuk melabur dan menjana pendapatan. Dari produk perdagangan hingga kepada platform yang digunakan, pemahaman yang mendalam tentang elemen-elemen ini adalah penting untuk kejayaan dalam bidang ini. Salah satu istilah yang sering digunakan dalam perdagangan adalahswap-free, yang merujuk kepada akaun perdagangan tanpa pertukaran faedah, sering digunakan oleh pedagang Muslim yang mahu mematuhi prinsip-prinsip Syariah.

Produk perdagangan merangkumi pelbagai instrumen kewangan yang boleh diperdagangkan di pasaran. Antara yang paling popular termasuk saham, mata wang asing (forex), komoditi, indeks, dan mata wang kripto. Setiap jenis produk ini mempunyai ciri-ciri dan risiko yang tersendiri.

Platform perdagangan adalah alat yang digunakan oleh pedagang untuk membuat transaksi, menganalisis pasaran, dan menguruskan portfolio mereka. Platform yang baik akan menawarkan antara muka yang mesra pengguna, alat analisis yang canggih, dan keselamatan yang kukuh. Beberapa platform yang popular termasuk MetaTrader 4 (MT4), MetaTrader 5 (MT5), dan cTrader.
Apa Itu Dagangan Swap-Free?

Dagangan swap-free dirancang khusus untuk pedagang yang tidak mahu dikenakan caj swap atau faedah semalaman pada posisi terbuka. Ini adalah sesuai bagi pedagang Muslim yang ingin berdagang menurut hukum Syariah yang melarang pembayaran dan penerimaan faedah. Broker swap-free seperti yang ditawarkan di Mtrading Malaysia menyediakan akaun tanpa faedah ini, membolehkan pedagang memegang posisi semalaman tanpa dikenakan caj faedah.

Seorang broker bertindak sebagai perantara antara pedagang dan pasaran kewangan, menyediakan platform untuk membeli dan menjual sekuriti seperti saham, bon, komoditi, dan derivatif. Di Malaysia, broker mempunyai peranan penting dalam memberikan penyelidikan dan analisis yang membantu pedagang membuat keputusan yang berinformasi. Apabila memilih broker, penting untuk mempertimbangkan aspek seperti pematuhan peraturan oleh Suruhanjaya Sekuriti Malaysia, struktur yuran, jenis platform dagangan, dan tahap sokongan pelanggan yang disediakan.
Pasaran Perdagangan
Pasaran perdagangan merangkumi pelbagai jenis pasaran di mana produk kewangan boleh dibeli dan dijual. Ini termasuk pasaran saham, pasaran forex, pasaran komoditi, dan pasaran mata wang kripto.
Kesimpulan

Perdagangan dalam talian menawarkan pelbagai peluang untuk menjana keuntungan, tetapi ia juga datang dengan risiko yang perlu diuruskan dengan bijak. Memahami produk perdagangan, memilih platform yang sesuai, mengenal pasti pasaran yang betul, dan bekerja dengan broker yang boleh dipercayai adalah langkah-langkah penting untuk kejayaan dalam perdagangan. Dengan adanya akaun swap-free, pedagang Muslim di Malaysia boleh berdagang dengan yakin tanpa melanggar prinsip-prinsip Syariah. Sentiasa pastikan anda melakukan penyelidikan yang mendalam dan memilih broker serta platform yang paling sesuai dengan keperluan dan strategi perdagangan anda.

title: 3 x Inspiration For An Ingenious Basement Conversion
author: Mandy Markwordt—homify
article_paragraphs: How happy we are when we have a basement where we can store food, unused furniture, car tyres and much more stuff. If you look into the basement again after a few months, you are overcome with horror—when did the room become a storage room full of rubbish?
To avoid exactly this and to show you the potential ofbasement rooms,we have selected three surprising basement transformations, each of which is surprising in its way.

Today we're going down to the basement. Designing and remodelling a basement is always a very exciting challenge, even forinterior designers.Depending on the individual customer's wishes, there are many design options. Today we have selected three particularly impressivebefore and after projects,each of which involves a basement conversion. It doesn't always have to be a storage room: you can set up the basement however you personally like best and how it fits in with your own life. So take a look at ourbasement renovation before and afterprojects below and let yourself be inspired. Maybe you'll find a few great basement ideas that you'd like to implement in your own home.
Do you want to renovate your kitchen? Then you should read thisidea bookthat shows you how our interior designers were able to transform these kitchens!
Here we see a cellar that many of us know: relatively small, with a rather unsightly floor and not particularly well designed. The only bright spot is the relatively large window for a cellar.
In the next picture, you will be amazed at how big this room is.

There is room for a sink, a shower and a bathtub in the basement. Natural stone plays the main role here and makes the bathroom appear particularly exclusive. A three-dimensional arrangement of the natural stones makes the wall next to the bathtub a fascinating eye-catcher. The unusual wall design is highlighted with ceiling spotlights. But the natural stone doesn't end there on the wall! Both the tub itself and the washbasin are made of natural stone or are covered with it. The brown ceramic tiles also had to make way for large, anthracite-coloured natural stone tiles.
We recommend:5 Bathroom Renovations That Will Leave You In Awe!

If you lie in the tub, you have this view. Here we can also see where the shower is hidden. It is not surprising that it was also designed entirely with natural materials. But a surprising contrast was allowed: opposite the washbasin, we find tubular steel shelves in the trendy industrial style.

Having a swimming pool in your home is undoubtedly a luxury that not everyone can afford. But even a simple swimming pool loses its appeal at some point. That's why the owners of this property decided to have their basement converted into a true wellness temple.
While we see a picture of the gutting phase here, the next picture shows the amazing result of the basement conversion…

Here you find everything you need for perfect relaxation at home. Starting with the designer sauna, which impresses with its dark walnut interior. It is still bright inside thanks to a floor-to-ceiling glass front and a light strip above the seating and lying area. Also noteworthy is the original lighting of the backrest, the colour tones of which can be adjusted on request.
A horizontal shower, which we can see on the left in the picture, is causing a stir. As the name suggests, you shower lying down while six water jets come out of the shower area above.

This basement wouldn't be a wellness temple if a sauna and an unusual shower were all it had. A steam bath was also installed and this too has a very modern and transparent design. The converted room also has a large washbasin and anormalshower, which is no less impressive.

Impatience is not always a bad thing. For example, the owner of this house decided at short notice to simply redesign his basement himself. In just six weeks, with a budget of around €87, he managed to give the room a completely new look.
And the surprise worked! Nobody would have expected such a transformation. What has emerged here is a genuineman cave.

Wooden panelling on the walls, guns, animal trophies and a (fake) fireplace make the cellar a unique retreat with a haunting atmosphere. To ensure that you would survive a zombie apocalypse, canned goods are a must.

A lot of work and attention to detail went into this basement conversion. The shelf on the right, for example, was made from old wooden boxes. The highlight, however, is thewindow: this is simply a photograph that is backlit with light. This trick can even be used to simulate different times of day.

title: 8 Cool Pools for Every Garden and Every Budget
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: The dream of yourpool- who doesn't dream of it? If you've decided to finally make it a reality, you've come to the right place, because we've put together a colourful bouquet of pool inspiration for you—from luxurious infinity variants to small, more cost-effective alternatives that can be implemented in any garden. Have fun!

Having your pool in thegardenis a wonderful thing. If you have been dreaming of having your swimming pool in the garden for a long time, you should read through our ideas book. We will introduce you to a few different pools for every budget so that your dream of having your refreshing pool can soon become a reality. We will show you many great swimming pools for the garden—whether it is a covered pool or one without a roof. Let our creative garden ideas with a pool convince you! Would you like to upgrade your garden and terrace with a swimming pool? It's really easy with our cool swimming pools for the garden!
While we're on the subject of garden design, you should read this book of ideas:13 Ideas for the Unused Corner in the Garden.

If you don't want to spend a fortune on a swimming pool in your garden but still want to enjoy a stylish, durable and refreshing swimming pool, this wooden version is the perfect choice. The pool made of high-quality pinewood is delivered as a ready-made set and is very easy to assemble yourself.

Next up is a real dream pool with an overflow effect. Such infinity pools, which seem to merge with the surroundings, are currently the hottest trend when it comes to luxurious swimming pools. The feeling of letting your gaze wander over the sea, the mountains or the roofs of the city from the invisible edge of the pool is indescribable—and a real hit for your garden.

In this country, garden owners often decide against having a swimming pool because the German weather is often not good and limits the expensive bathing pleasure to just a few days a year. Our tip: With the right roof, you can extend the bathing season and use your pool whatever the weather.

Another pool trend that is taking more gardens and hearts by storm is natural pools that completely avoid chlorine and other chemicals and instead rely on a natural ambience and purely biological water purification. Such a pool consists of a bathing area and a treatment area. In the latter, plants help to purify the water by absorbing nutrients through their roots and releasing oxygen. The result: crystal-clear water all year round—and all without chemicals.

Not everyone has space on their property for a large pool in which you can do sports and swim a few laps. The solution is swimming channels and small pools in which a counter-current system is installed. This means there are no limits to the great swimming pleasure even in the smallest of spaces.

Whirlpools are an ideal alternative to swimming pools forsmall gardensor terraces. They take up hardly any space, can be set up in no time at all and offer plenty of luxury and a spa feeling for all those who just want to relax in the water.

This mobile pool also scores with unbeatable advantages: It can be set up in no time, fits into every budget and every garden and can be flexibly set up and dismantled as desired. The dream of having your pool can be realized in such an easy and uncomplicated way!

We're closing this book of ideas with another pool idea for anyone who has limited space and a limited budget. Such a plunge pool is neither overly expensive to buy nor difficult to maintain. It can be built on even the smallest plot of land and can be used all year round thanks to the latest technology. What more could you want?!

title: Buying a Semi-detached House: These are The Advantages and Disadvantages
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: Similar toterraced houses,semi-detached houses are often considered to be stuffy by many. But we should all slowly say goodbye to this cliché because terraced houses and semi-detached houses have some advantages. In today's article, we will look at both the advantages and disadvantages and show you some exciting semi-detached house projects from ourexperts.And after that, no one will laugh at the concept of a semi-detached house anymore. Let's get started!

When we talk about a semi-detached house, we mean half of a house, where both halves have separate entrances and are each occupied by a separate party. As a rule, the external appearance of semi-detached houses is uniform, but there are also differences, especially in modern architecture, as our first photo shows. Here, both houses were treated as a single unit in terms of design but still have their details. So if you want to build or buy a semi-detached house, you shouldn't be put off by the apparent monotony, because when it comes to the division of the rooms and the general design, you can usually go your way and set yourself apart from your neighbour.

If you want to build a semi-detached house, you have to consider a few aspects in terms of construction technology that are not the case with a single-family house. The main focus is on the shared side wall of the two halves of the house, which must be equipped with particularly good sound insulation. Another important point is the orientation of the two semi-detached houses on the plot so that one of them is not in the shadow of the other. The planning of the window areas and lines of sight should also be carefully considered and tailored to the special nature of the semi-detached house.

The biggest advantage of a semi-detached house is the financial aspect. The price of the land is shared, as are the planning costs for the construction, as well as administrative and notary costs and taxes. In addition, less land is needed to build a semi-detached house than to build a single-family home, as there are no minimum distances. And: The divider wall between the two halves of thehousealso saves energy costs, as there is no heat loss to the outside. According to experts, you can save up to 25 per cent when building a semi-detached house compared to building a single-family home.

The disadvantage of living in a semi-detached house is the immediate proximity to the neighbours. When building or buying, and also later in the case of renovation and repair work, agreements are unavoidable and not all individual ideas can always be implemented. Due to the inevitable close contact points, there are also more potential neighbourly disputes than with a detached single-family home, which is why it is advisable to take a closer look at your future neighbours if you are planning to buy or build a semi-detached house.

If you weigh up the advantages and disadvantages of a semi-detached house, everyone has to decide for themselves whether this living concept is suitable for their own family or not. You should ask yourself a few questions in advance before you go ahead and buy. For example, you should ask yourself how tolerant you are and how you cope with being close to other people and the possible restrictions. Families often decide to build a semi-detached house together with grandma and grandpa, other relatives or friends. Conclusion: If you describe yourself as an easy-going and sociable person who doesn't shy away from close quarters, a semi-detached house is a cheaper alternative to a detached single-family home.

Most semi-detached houses have the same floor plan—the only difference being that one is built as a mirror image of the other. Here we see the ground floor plan of a semi-detached house in the classic style. The entrances are opposite each other, a spacious living room was planned on one side of the hallway, and the kitchen and dining area on the other. Both houses also have a toilet and a storage room on the ground floor, while they share the technical room that is accessible from the outside.

Here we see proof that semi-detached houses do not have to be stuffy, uniform and boring. In this project, a plot of land was divided as part of densification measures and the old single-family house was replaced by a modern semi-detached house. The woodenfacadeand alternating roof pitches and window arrangements give this a very special touch and therefore appear anything but boring and uniform.

This project proves that you can implement your ideas and concepts in a semi-detached house. Here, the right-hand semi-detached house was given a carport on the side and the white plaster facade was combined with partial wooden cladding, which gives the whole thing a modern and varied touch.

If the semi-detached house becomes too small, it can often be easily extended with extensions. In this case, two pent-roof extensions of different heights were added to the existing building. The main extension now houses a new living room on the ground floor and a bedroom on the upper floor. There is also a single-storey extension with a new entrance area.
Here, a traditional semi-detached house was given a modern extension, creating more living space for the residents with a contemporary ambience and direct access to thegarden.

This complex of five semi-detached houses is dedicated to the topics of ecology and sustainability. When selecting the materials and building materials used, emphasis was placed on circular economy and locality, and they were installed in their raw form, largely untreated.

Here, too, several modern semi-detached houses were planned and built with energy efficiency and sustainability in mind. These are low-energy houses with energy efficiency class KfW 55, which were built using highly insulated timber frame construction.

Semi-detached houses have been around for many decades. In this project, our experts converted a semi-detached house from the 1950s and renovated it to be more energy-efficient. This means that residents can not only enjoy more space and living comfort, but energy consumption has also been significantly reduced through roof insulation, mineral facade insulation and basement ceiling insulation.

Here we see once again how individual living in a semi-detached house can be. The size and arrangement of the windows, the colour of the facade, the garden design and many other things can usually be decided by yourself if you decide to build a semi-detached house.

This semi-detached house was built on a hillside and uses the slope of the property to spread the entrance and living areas over three levels, which can be experienced from anywhere via a spacious, open staircase.

title: 9 Simple Ideas to Beautify Your Home Without Renovation
author: Anne Krusche—HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: We love to beautify our home again and again with great attention to detail. Whether it's a beautiful garden where you can enjoy the summer in a wonderful ambience, abathroomwith wellness charm or a stylishliving roomthat invites you to relax and linger: over time our tastes change or thefurnishingsare simply no longer modern. So it's exactly the right time for a makeover. Many of us think that an expensive renovation is needed to give the house a little update. We'll prove you wrong—with these decoration ideas from ourinterior designers,you can give your four walls a completely new look, without any renovation!

Instead of calling in an expert to install new windows for you, invest in beautifullightingthat will give your rooms a bright and inviting ambience. A beautiful pendant light, wall lamps or recessed spotlights are the perfect choice to give your home more brightness and a feel-good atmosphere.

Every room has a floor, but we often don't take advantage of the design options. When you think about how much space the floor takes up, it makes sense to invest in a floor covering that turns our rooms into a highlight. Whether wood, stone or individual tiles—there are numerous variations available, depending on what suits your interior design style best.
You'll be surprised how much of a difference replacing doors can make. With practical sliding doors, for example, you can expand your rooms so that they appear much larger and more spacious.
Here you will find breathtakingly beautifulsliding doorsthat will enrich any room!

Curtains or blinds give every room a homely atmosphere. Colourful designs, for example, are an ideal choice for giving classic interiors a touch of freshness. Make sure that the curtains let in a little light—this will make your living spaces appear wonderfully bright and inviting.
Don't underestimate the power of a few beautifully placed plants and flowers. And we don't just mean the visual effect. They also help to purify the air and give your rooms a pleasant, fresh scent.
Are you bored with the design of your kitchen backsplash? Before you plan a complex renovation, try a new colour! It's the easiest way to give your kitchen a fresh look.

You don't have to go for elaborate wall coverings to give your rooms a new eye-catcher. How about stylish wallpaper instead? Some countless colours and patterns can give your home a whole new look. A simple and inexpensive way to redecorate your interior!

Of course, we also want a stylish atmosphere for the outdoor area. But instead of changing the whole garden or renovating the balcony, you can also achieve a great effect with small things. How about a wonderful wooden floor, like in this example, to create a small wellness oasis for relaxation and well-being?

Even if you don't want to install new flooring or wallpaper in your home right away, start with small details and change the carpet, for example. With the right design, it can completely change your rooms and create a completely new living experience. Try it out!

title: 6 Ways to Expand Your Living Space Without Building On
author: Sabrina Werner
article_paragraphs: With property prices constantly rising, living space becomes particularly scarce when the family grows. Having enough space without going over the top is a real challenge for many. But you don't have to look for a new apartment straight away if you suddenly need more space. There are an incredible number of great options that you can use to expand your four rooms without having to build an extension. Whether it's a mini house, a caravan or a ten-square-metre student apartment—they all show how functional, stylish and space-saving living can be. Among the following six ideas, you're sure to find some that will help you get the most out of your home!

Attics often don't seem to be the most attractive place in thehouse.They often exude fear and terror and seem spooky and mysterious rather than cosy. However, with a little skill, for example with the help of one of ourinterior design experts,they can become a cosy place in the house. The attic can, for example, become a small guest room, a library or even the long-awaited walk-in closet. Some attics are even huge and offer the structural possibilities to transform them into a real loft!

Garages are far too often overlooked as an option when it comes to creating additional space. But the garage has a lot of potential. There is usually room for two cars in them, even if you only own one or the second is always parked outside anyway. In any case, the garage is a great place for all the equipment that takes up a lot of space in the house. This includes fitness equipment as well as the hobby workshop. In the garage, you can drill and hammer without disturbing anyone. You can hang up the punching bag without having to worry about unsightly holes in the ceiling. Sometimes garages are even built so robustly and heat-insulated that they can be converted into an additional room. They are also an ideal place to set up a small studio. There is enough space for the sewing machine, large lengths of fabric and a mannequin that you can let off steam on as you please.

Unused basements are a complete waste of space. Instead of letting old junk rust away, you can gain a lot of space by converting the basement. Here, for example, the basement has been turned into a real wellness oasis. A sophisticated lighting concept, clear shapes and a few light-coloured pieces of furniture make the rooms appear larger and create a relaxed atmosphere. Instead of storing old clothes in the basement, piling up accessories for long-forgotten hobbies or storing broken furniture there, the basement should be dusted off. Many activities that take up space in the other rooms or cause unrest can be outsourced to the basement. It can become a huge play area for the children, giving them more space in the children's room, a music room or a multimedia temple.
You'll also like this idea book:3 x Inspiration for an Ingenious Basement Conversion!

Walls that remain unused are a complete waste of space. A tip that works in almost every room is to use the wall space. Shelves that reach from floor to ceiling in the hallway, living room, bedroom or children's room create an incredible amount of storage space. They can even replace the wall or be used as a room divider. In many families, the children share a children's room or the bedroom or living room must also serve as a home office. In such cases, shelves as room dividers can almost visually create an additional room. But shelves are not the only way to use the wall space. Hooks in the bathroom or kitchen offer additional space for all kinds of utensils, boards that run through the entire room and above the doors can accommodate book collections and a bench on the wall offers additional seating in the hallway or kitchen.

Another place that is often overlooked when looking for more space is thestairs.Even though it sounds a bit like Harry Potter's room under the stairs, it can become a cosy little living space. One option is to create storage space under the stairs. This can be done with the help of simple shelves that are screwed to the wall, or with sophisticated drawer and cabinet systems that are made to measure. It is also possible to set up a small bar or even a small workstation here. A comfortable armchair and a small side table—as in the example here—turn the space under the stairs into a great reading corner for enjoyment and relaxation.

An apartment without a balcony, a house without a terrace—for many people, that's out of the question. It's all the more surprising to see how often this space remains unused. When you notice that the balcony furniture is only taken out once a year, it's time for changes. A covered sofa corner on the terrace invites you to sit outside even in a little drizzle, if a heater provides pleasant warmth, and a small sun lounger on the balcony may be used more often than the chic but uncomfortable balcony chairs. A great alternative for barbecue fans who aren't allowed to light charcoal on their balcony is small electric grills. They can be quickly fired up even after work and create a barbecue atmosphere without much preparation being necessary.

title: 7 Ingenious Outdoor Showers That Fit into Every Garden
author: Mandy Markwordt—homify
article_paragraphs: No room for a pool, but you still don't want to miss out on some refreshment in the summer? Then you should take a closer look at these garden showers andbathroom accessories.The models are not only trendy and extremely practical, but also space-saving and therefore particularly suitable for smallgardens- and sometimes even for bathrooms.
So take a look and see which of the seven outdoor showers is right for you.

We'll show you how you can ensure more refreshment in thegardeneven if you have little space available. Garden showers can be a great space-saving alternative to a pool. Whether in combination with an old millstone like in this example or a modern design—choose your favourite outdoor shower! We'll show you one or two outdoor shower cabins that will make your shower in the garden a special highlight. This way, your shower garden and terrace will become something very special. It's best to read our tips for a shower in the garden right away. We're excited to see which outdoor shower you choose.
Be sure to check out these expert tips for garden shower design and be inspired!

Showering with privacy protection? Well, if that isn't an ideal combination! While you refresh yourself under the cool water, the elegant, hand-made wickerwork made of high-quality synthetic fibre on the sides and back offers stylish protection. Another practical extra is the swivelling shower head made of shatter-proof plastic and an additional, height-adjustable hand shower.
Stainless steel is perfect for outdoor use because it is not only practical but also extremely aesthetic. Stainless steel showers are therefore a fantastic eye-catcher in the garden.

The shower shown here stretches 2.2 metres towards the sky and impresses with a self-cleaning shower head at a height of 2 metres. The model, made in Italy, is corrosion-resistant and guarantees a first-class shower experience.

This shower promises a very special fun factor for young and old! Instead of standing under a classic showerhead, you stand under the trunk of an elephant. And the best thing is: when the water is turned on, you will likely get warm water. The surface of the so-calledAerophantcan absorb the heat and thus generate warm water in its 50-litre tank in a short time.

The fittings, base and shower head of this delicate outdoor shower are made of the highest quality stainless steel. The so-calledAISI 316is known for being extremely hard, durable and completely rust-free. The shower owes its shine and lasting radiance to an elaborate hand polish that gives it the final touch.

Depending on your preference, the shower can be equipped with a cold water connection or—for premixed water—with a single-lever mixer to regulate the water temperature. An additional hand shower is also possible.

An outdoor rainforest shower, if that isn't a fantastic feeling! With this modern outdoor shower you get exactly that, plus a flexible hand shower for those who like to be in control. With its massive look, this shower becomes a real sculpture in the garden, but thanks to its minimalist design it still blends harmoniously into the surroundings.

This garden shower is unusual because the water does not come from above but from below! How it works: A garden hose is connected to the base plate, you stand on the plate and the water shoots upwards from 22 nozzles. The height of the water fountains varies between two and four metres, depending on the water pressure. With its dimensions of 70 x 55 cm, the floor shower is ideal for refreshment insmall gardens.

The materialAISI 316is also used to manufacture this double shower. Incidentally, this stainless steel is also used to manufacture surgical instruments because it is particularly hygienic. In shipbuilding, this stainless steel is valued for its enormous corrosion resistance, which is why this outdoor shower even comes with a ten-year guarantee. This refers to the fact that there will be no corrosion on the shower column. With a height of 2.30 metres, people of all ages and sizes can easily refresh themselves underneath.

title: Washing Machine and Dryer: 15 Furnishing Tips for the Laundry Room
author: Mel—homify
article_paragraphs: Finding a suitable place for a washing machine and dryer in your apartment or house is not always easy. Are you moving into a new home and looking for new ways to set up your laundry area? In small apartments, space is so limited that the bulky washing machines and dryers have to be integrated into the bathroom or kitchen.

Maybe you have enough space to set up alaundry roomor utility room in the basement. In any case, it's worth looking at built-in and free-standing base cabinets, washing machine shelves or dryer cabinets. In the following idea book, thanks to our brilliantprofessionals,I've put together 15 tips and ideas for you to choose from.

The appropriate location for the washing machine and dryer depends primarily on the existing connections. Power connection, water connection and sewage connection must be in the immediate vicinity and easily accessible.

In principle, these connections can of course be planned and installed as desired in a new building project. In most cases, such connection combinations can be found in the bathroom, kitchen and basement. These rooms therefore offer the ideal conditions for accommodating a washing machine and dryer.
I recommend:Design Hacks to Maximize Space in Small Bathrooms.
A wall cupboard in the bathroom offers sufficient storage space for utensils and sometimes enough room for the washing machine.
Once this cabinet is installed in the wall, it is easy to subtly integrate it into thebathroom design.
When the folding doors of the closet are closed, there is no indication of the washing and storage space behind them.
A wonderful solution to create a washing facility within your house or living space without it being too prominent in the overall ensemble.

If there is enough space to set up a utility room, it should ideally accommodate all the necessary utensils, not just a washing machine and dryer. Vacuum cleaners, mops and cleaning products also have their place here. I also recommend adding a few laundry helpers to the laundry room:
Whether as part of a laundry room or within the apartment, the washing machine and dryer can also be installed one above the other in a built-in closet.
The standardized dimensions of the machines are in most cases compatible with the tall cabinets specially designed for this purpose. Simple models are available from around €280.

A utility room doesn't have to be painted white. There are no limits to the colour scheme here either. You can create an ambience that is inviting. This has the surprising side effect that you will enjoy spending time in the laundry room.

You should also ensure that there is enough light and air. It is important that there is a natural supply of air and that natural light comes in. If you ventilate regularly, you will prevent moisture damage and the formation of mould.
The washing machine is integrated into a bathroom base cabinet. This means it disappears into the bathroom's ambience. Even if there is little space, try to integrate a work surface into the room.

In the case of a small bathroom, this space can be used for two purposes. If you organize the space, it also offers space for pre-sorting or folding laundry. A washing machine base cabinet is offered in both bathroom and kitchen areas as part of the overall installation. As a stand-alone base cabinet, inexpensive models are available from €100.
Custom-made built-in cupboards provide the perfect storage space to house the washing machine alongside other utensils.

In addition to washer-dryer combinations, unexpected items are also stored together with the machines. In this bathroom, for example, the same cupboard can provide space for towels and bath towels, or cleaning products and a vacuum cleaner.
A utility cupboard can also fit well in the entrance area or hallway, provided there is enough space.

Whether you can install a washing machine or dryer in this location and hide it in the utility cupboard depends on whether there is a water connection, sewage connection and an electricity connection here.
There is a lot hidden behind the elegant front of this tailor-made kitchen. There is also space for a washing machine, which is both a surprising and elegant solution.

Especially for apartments located on higher floors, such as maisonettes or penthouses, which do not offer direct access to a basement and possible laundry room, accommodating the laundry area within the living area is a charming alternative.
Unusual apartments require unusual solutions, including when it comes to the laundry room. For example, a washing machine and dryer cabinet can also be installed in an attic apartment.
The tall cupboard is installed right next to the terrace access. Hidden behind panels and exposed to good air circulation, the washing machine, dryer and even dishwasher also find a place here.
Some landlords require proof that the washing machine has been installed by a professional upon moving in.

The reason for this is often that this is the only way the tenant's personal liability insurance will be covered in the event of damage. I recommend that you clarify these terms with your landlord in advance.
Setting up a laundry room next to the storage shelf in the garage is also a good option.
However, the conditions here must also be checked in advance. A garage with a window is ideal so that good air circulation can be guaranteed.
It is recommended to install a sink or utility sink near the washing machine. In addition to the worktop, this is another useful component of a well-organized laundry room.

Admittedly, washing machines are not necessarily the most elegant of companions. And yet they are one of the necessary features of a modern home. Their bulky and, in some cases, not particularly design-oriented appearance should not stop you from making your home as comfortable as possible with them.

Especially if the washing machine and dryer are integrated into open or closed cabinets to find space in the kitchen or bathroom, it is worth matching them to their surroundings. A vase of flowers placed on the worktop above works wonders.

title: Before and After: 1960s House is Completely Renovated
author: Lisa—homify
article_paragraphs: Let's go to Würzburg's Steinbachtal, where asingle-family housewith a granny flat built in 1964 was waiting to be converted and renovated. The new owners wanted to adapt it to their needs. Together with ourprofessionalsfromStefan Lang I Architecture and Energy,they courageously took on this project and transformed the building into an Efficiency House 70. Thanks to full thermal insulation, triple-glazed windows and a wood pellet heating system, the 224 m² living space can be heated efficiently after the conversion.
Stay tuned for an amazingrenovation project!

This is how the existing building lookedbeforethe renovation work. The street view shows a small, ageing house with a double garage directly adjacent. The dark-covered gable roof made the building appear rather squat, and overall everything looked a bit old-fashioned.

What a change! After the work was completed, the house had a Bauhaus character: the facade is now sleek and cubic, and the old gable roof was removed and replaced with a contemporary flat roof. A restrained colour scheme of light grey and beige was also chosen. The entrance area was moved and covered with a roof that seamlessly merges into the garages. This makes everything look as if it were made from a single piece.

If we look at the house from the side, its true size becomes apparent. This is by no means a small bungalow, as one might think at first glance. The location on the slope of the property meant that two floors could be built. From the side, we can also see the new, large window fronts, which let in a lot of light and provide a view of the outdoors.

The perspective from the rear reveals several terrace levels and a balcony across the entire width of the house. Here, the owners can enjoy their open space with a view of the beautiful garden and find a suitable spot at any time of day or year.

A lot of wood was used on theterrace.Both the floor and the bench are made from beautiful natural materials. A real eye-catcher, however, is the privacy screen from the neighbours, which consists of stacked logs.

title: With these 11 Tricks your Small Apartment will Look Bigger
author: Janin Istenits
article_paragraphs: A small apartment doesn't necessarily have to look small—if you know exactly how to make the most of the space available! Thanks to our professionalinterior designers and decorators,we have put together some tips for you that will help you make your apartment look bigger.
Natural light, bright furniture and mirrors – 11 ingenious ideas with which you can give your apartment a few more square metres in no time at all!

The most important thing is that there is enough natural light in your home, as this automatically makes theroomappear larger. The light floods the room during sunny hours and also creates a pleasant ambience—no matter how small the room is.
You'll find more articles about lightinghere.

To give the room depth and structure, you should use clever contrasts. In thisliving room, you can see a successful symbiosis of light flooring and dark walls. The combination of white and black easily enlarges the room, stretches it and creates an open atmosphere.

When choosingfurniturefor your home, you should also make sure that it fits perfectly into the space. There is simply no point in squeezing a gigantic sofa into a tiny living room. Instead, try to find appropriate furnishings that do not overwhelm the room and still give you room to breathe.

An important trick is mirrors, which simply make the room feel larger and more inviting. In certain places, they can stretch the entire room and also provide a special detail. It is clever to install mirrors in a smallbathroomor hallway—the reflection gives the room a few more square metres.
While we're on the subject of mirrors, you could also consider using this trick in the bedroom. Mirrored doors in the wardrobe could easily make the room appear larger.

Sometimes the space in small apartments has to be used with other ideas. For example, if you have an open kitchen area that not only leads into the dining area but also the living room, you should get a room divider. Of course, this doesn't necessarily have to be a solid wall. Instead, opt for a bright and modern room divider like the one in the picture—this not only ensures privacy in the kitchen and living room but can also be used as a shelf.

People living in small apartments often suffer from a lack of space. There aren't enough cupboards and dressers in the rooms, so you have to think outside the box and use the space you have available. You can find storage space under the stairs, for example, or in bare corners and closed doors or windows. Take a look at your apartment with this in mind—you're guaranteed to find at least one place that can be wonderfully converted into new storage space. Let the ideas in this article inspire you!

And if it's not storage space that you're looking for, but rather additional space, then you should still take a closer look at the area under the stairs! Here, you can easily set up a modern study, as in this picture, that takes up little space and gives you enough quiet to work successfully on your projects.

It is also important that you keep your apartment tidy and clean. Get rid of the chaos in the entrance area and hallway and you will see that even this small room will appear much larger if it is equipped with a wardrobe and a shoe cabinet.

If you doubt that you can fit everything into the small kitchen, you should simply invest in practical shelving systems that allow you to use the entire wall. In this picture, you can see that the space on the wall has been used up to the top, not only in terms of the shelves but also for thewashing machine and dryer—this means that the floor space in the room remains almost untouched and the kitchen appears spacious despite the small size.

Finally, a tip on wall colour: If you have a small apartment, you should avoid crazy colour combinations and instead go for simple and light wall colours. Nothing makes a room appear larger than bright white, which is more than clear from the huge living room in this picture. Askinterior designersfor tips, they can give you individual advice on your apartment and help you to make each room appear larger!
These are our 11 tips that show you how to cleverly enlarge a small apartment! So, do you still want to move?

title: 5 things you should know before remodelling your garage
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: If living space in your own house is becoming scarce, but a new extension, basement or attic conversion is out of the question, there is often only one option left to create new perspectives and additional space for living: a garage conversion. Old garages are increasingly being integrated into living spaces and converted into bedrooms, kitchens, guest rooms, etc. However, there are a lot of things to consider, both technically and legally.

If you want to integrate your garage into your home or convert it into a living space that can be used in all weather conditions, you have to equip it with completely new insulation, radiators and electricity. Warm water should also be available—depending on the intended use. This project can be quite complicated, especially when it comes to insulation because garages often have a heat requirement that is many times higher than normal residential buildings due to their anything-but-optimal surface-to-volume ratio and: The low room height can make it difficult to insulate the floor.

A very important point when converting a garage is new entrances and the provision of natural light. The old garage door has to be removed and the remaining opening is bricked up and provided with a door. In addition, new window openings are necessary if the formergarageis now to be used as an attractive living space. By the way: Old garage doors usually sell well. Depending on the condition and model, the resale value is between 200 and 900 euros.

Before you even think about aspects such as windows, doors, insulation and power supply, you should deal with the legal side of garage conversion. German building law sets strict limits for builders for any type of conversion or expansion, although these can vary considerably from state to state. If you want to avoid unpleasant surprises and legal consequences, you must go the official route and submit a building application to the responsible authority.
For which extensions and conversions do I need a building permit?

From insulation to the power supply and from water pipes to windows and doors – a garage conversion like this can be quite complex and therefore expensive. It is therefore advisable to make precise calculations before construction begins and to consider all eventualities, including the interior work andinterior design.

Of course, it is important to think carefully about how the new additional living space will be used before the renovation. Based on this, you can then plan whether window openings are really necessary, whether the extension is already provided with enough daylight through an opening to the house, whether you need running water in this part of the house and where the electrical cables should run.
An architect can help you if you need ideas on how you can convert your garage and integrate it into your living space.

Do you also have a house or apartment with a garage? More and more people, especially in the city, are deciding against owning a car and would rather expand their garage instead. If you also want to insulate the freed-up space in a garage and then use it, this article would certainly be of interest to you.

You have already received some tips and ideas on how you can plan and implement the conversion of your garage. There are many creative ways to build and furnish an extraordinary garage. No matter how you want to expand your garage, the new living space will pay off.
As already mentioned, don’t forget to check all legal aspects before you start construction work. You should only convert a garage once you have a building permit—otherwise, it can be expensive.

title: 11 Counters That Make Small Kitchens Perfect
author: Simone Orlik
article_paragraphs: Along withliving rooms,kitchens are amazing places for the whole family. Everyone comes together here to cook, eat, drink, or spend the afternoon drinking tea. But sometimes thekitchenis tiny and there's barely enough space to store everything, and then you also want a table that can seat two or three people.

For us, almost nothing is impossible, thanks to our professionalkitchen planners.Since we know that dealing withsmall kitchenscan be a big issue, today, we want to present you with 10 designs that have managed to integrate a counter despite their small dimensions.

Do you want to upgrade your kitchen and dining room with a modern counter? We think: Yes, you should! A counter in the kitchen is practical on the one hand and a real eye-catcher on the other. If you are interested in planning and implementing a counter, you should take a look at our idea book. Here you will find great ideas and valuable inspiration for installing a greatcountereven in small kitchens. A counter also provides a nice separation between the living room and dining room. Our kitchen planners have put together a few really beautiful counters for modern kitchens below. Be inspired by the models made of wood, stone and other materials. Your cool counter is then complemented by the matching bar stools and great decorations and accessories.

What a special kitchen! Framed in exposed concrete and open pipes, the colourful kitchen cabinets are particularly striking. The grey stone worktop charmingly extends the kitchen counter around the corner. So you sit in the kitchen area, but the bar still represents a unit in itself. Puristic wooden stools create the connection between the ultra-modern kitchen and the cosy parquet floor.

This counter exudes a very modern design with its stainless steel worktop. But thanks to the many wooden elements in the kitchen, at the dining table and the elegant wooden floor, the counter does not appear too cold but invites you to take a seat. The black bar stools are ultra-modern and harmonize wonderfully with the industrial-looking hanging lamps.

This kitchen was planned in a U-shape, but it is open on two sides. The minimalist design of the pure white high-gloss kitchen can be shown off beautifully. To create space for the residents, a long, narrow bar was installed around two sides of the U-shape. Six designer chairs in bright red provide a cheerful contrast in the otherwise white kitchen.

A touch of light green: This minimalist white kitchen seems to have been breathed into existence, it makes such a light impression. Here too, the kitchen and worktop were planned in a U-shaped design. The counter is again the extended arm of the worktop. On two cool mint green stools, the residents can look directly into the interior of the kitchen. Communication between the chef and the guests is no problem. The funny thing is the stylish refrigerator, which picks up the mint green of the stools on the opposite side.

In thissmall kitchen,we come across wooden elements that give the kitchen a rustic design. Our kitchen planners only designed the worktop in white. There is even room for four bar stools made of a combination of leather and wood at the long counter, which almost looks like a small pub counter, doesn't it?

This blue and white kitchen is also U-shaped. However, our experts have solved the integration of this dining table differently. The white minimalist table extends the U-shape here too but was deliberately placed lower so that we have a classic table with two dining chairs. The small drinks fridge next to the dining table is funny. Three hanging lamps illuminate the table generously.

In the next example, we look at a kitchen that has a classic, homely design. Due to the lack of space, our kitchen planners simply brought the largedining tableinto the kitchen—and placed part of the worktop with the hob on top of it. The white-painted wooden tabletop offers a wonderful, warm contrast to the wooden table. The upholstered designer chairs exude a classy touch.

Pure romance! This kitchen shows its playful side. Due to the lack of space, our experts simply installed the dining table in the kitchen. Together with four bar stools, you can have breakfast in front of the large window. The white lacquered kitchen cabinets with a nostalgic touch offer a great contrast to the worktop in lacquered natural wood.

Admittedly, this kitchen is not small. But we thought the integration of the counter was so nice that we didn't want to withhold it from anyone. This kitchen is presented in the beautiful beach house style that we find mainly in the north of Germany or on the Frisian Islands. White kitchen furniture combined with warm wooden elements such as the worktop and wooden floor creates a great unit.

Now it continues completely asymmetrically! Because everything in this kitchen is different from what we are used to. Our kitchen planners simply installed two counters—not only at different heights but also in different shapes. While the rear bar is triangular, where you can sit on one side, the lower table is oval. Three more stools can be placed here. We think: A kitchen with a mysterious, masculine touch.

We want to end our tour with a modern kitchen design. Because there was very little space for a table, our experts only integrated a small table with two chairs. But that is more than enough for a small meal in between. Even if you don't need the bar, it is a great eye-catcher for every day, together with the red hanging lights and a few fresh flowers from the garden!

title: Mould in the House: How it Occurs and How to Get Rid of it Forever
author: Simone Orlik
article_paragraphs: Mould is a problem in many households these days—inhousesas well as in apartments. It appears on walls, ceilings, furniture and our clothing, especially in basements or damproomssuch as bathrooms or laundry rooms. It is neither pretty nor does it smell good. And it is harmful to health. That is why we should make sure that mould does not develop in the first place. And if it does happen, we need to find the causes that led to the infestation. This is the only way to avoid mould permanently. We have put together a few ideas to help you deal with the issue without fear.

Once mould has appeared in our house, there can be many reasons for it and sometimes, the search for it is like looking for a needle in a haystack. Usually, several factors at once lead to an infestation.

- Sometimes our rooms are too damp simply because they have not been properly ventilated. The humidity in the room should not exceed 55 per cent, because then moisture will settle on the ceilings, walls or windows and provide an ideal breeding ground for mould. That is why we should ventilate our rooms several times a day with the window open. In this way, we exchange the air inside and outside. Incidentally, we should be particularly careful when it comes to ventilation in summer. Because then the outside temperature itself is high, which we bring into the house if we keep the window open. This is especially true for old cellars, which should be ventilated generously in winter and not at all in summer.

- Not all paints are the same and not all plasters are the same. We should ask professionalpaintersdirectly which paints and plasters can absorb or release moisture within a certain range. The differences here are very big.

- Sometimes our furniture is simply too close to a wall. As a rule, there should be at least a 5-centimetre gap between the piece of furniture and the outside wall so that the air can circulate. This is especially true for kitchens and bathrooms.

The aesthetic question is the one that concerns us. But much more important is the question of what an infestation does to our health. We spend a lot of time within our four walls. That is why the rooms should be in perfect condition to support our well-being.

Mould can cause severe breathing problems, respiratory allergies and a higher level of infections—especially in children, the elderly or those residents who are prone to allergies or asthma. Headaches, tiredness and weakness can also sometimes be associated with mold. If in doubt, ask an expert in the field for advice. They usually look at a building thoroughly and take laboratory samples that provide information about possible infestation.

We should never take mould infestation lightly. Because the spores can easily spread to other rooms in the house once they have arrived. Therefore, if you have a large infestation or are unsure, it is best to ask a professional for advice. Some home remedies can help prevent an infestation or get minor mould infestations under control:
- Lemon can work wonders, especially in the bathroom, creating cleanliness and a hygienic environment. Tiles can be cleaned well with lemon juice in water.

- Baking soda mixed with water or vinegar is also a proven household remedy for weekly cleaning without chemical additives. We should make sure to thoroughly clean the clothes used and change the water frequently.
- Saltwater is ideal for clothing that has mould stains.

- There are many cleaners on the market that can be used specifically to combat mould. However, they only combat mould that is on the surface offurniture,walls or tiles. Our tip: always wear a respiratory mask and gloves, ventilate the area well and keep children away from the activity.

In particular, underground cellar rooms often have a very different climate than those on the ground or upper floors. Old buildings in particular, which do not have comprehensive insulation from the ground, often have problems with high humidity. If the cellar is uninhabited and only contains rooms such as a wine cellar, the climate is not a problem. However, such places are not suitable for storing sensitive materials such as cardboard or clothing. Special ventilation systems can then help to ensure optimal ventilation here. When we are dealing with rising dampness, the plaster often crumbles from the wall. Insulating materials such as renovation plaster or material that is inserted into the wall can then help to solve the problem.

After removing the mould, the problem reoccurs after a few weeks. If that is the case, no commercially available products will help. Then the cause lies deeper. In the case of walls or ceilings, for example, this can mean a problem with the external insulation, leaky pipes or structural problems in the house that lead to excessive humidity. Dehumidifiers can also help temporarily. But you should still ask a specialist for an assessment. Because in the end, mould also reduces the value of the house.

title: How to Turn your Flat Roof into a Cool Terrace
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: One of the many advantages of flat roofs is that they are ideal forroof terraces.Especially in big cities or when there is not muchgardenspace on the property, the roof is a great alternative—panoramic views of the surroundings included.
