Of course, you should leave the planning of such a terrace toprofessionalswho have an eye on the complicated static requirements, but when it comes todesign,we can get creative ourselves. We have put together six cool ideas for you that will turn your flat roof into an outdoor paradise.

Do you already have a flat roof or maybe even a roof terrace? Then you should read through our tips and tricks for designing cool roof terraces in this idea book. But even if you are planning the construction, you might want to build a flat roof. This is a pretty cool way to create more living space. If not done when building a new house, the roof terrace can also be built afterwards. In this context, we will show you how impressively a roof terrace can beautify a flat roof and thus the whole house. Let our ideas inspire you and consider having a roof terrace built on a flat roof. You will certainly not regret building a roof terrace.

Whether it's blazing sun, nasty wind or drizzle—on the roof terrace you are often exposed to the weather without protection. If you want to convert your flat roof into a dream terrace that you can use without problems for more than just 5 days out of 365, you should take appropriate precautions—ideally in the form of roofs, awnings or other coverings that reliably provide shade, protect against drafts and give rain clouds the cold shoulder.

The right floor covering plays an important role on the roof terrace, as it should be weatherproof, easy to clean, durable and robust, but of course, also look good. When planning, it is also important to ensure that the substructure is sufficiently ventilated and that no water can penetrate the living space below. So you should not cut corners here and opt for high-quality and professional installation.

For most of us, a terrace without plants is unimaginable. The same applies, of course, to the flat roof, which is to be transformed into a paradisiacal roof terrace. There are numerous options here: from classic planters and flower pots to modern raised beds and vertical gardens to real lawns and vegetable beds, anything you like is possible above and on the roofs of the city. It is best to plan the green roof garden together with an experienced professional.

A pool or jacuzzi on the roof is an absolute dream that many homeowners would like to fulfil. While a real swimming pool on the roof terrace can rarely be implemented without great effort due to static conditions, lack of space and financial issues, things are much easier with a jacuzzi. And who wouldn't want to enjoy the view of the starry sky and the sea of lights of the city in their jacuzzi?

An important part of every terrace is, of course, thefurniture.Roof terraces in particular can be easily transformed into cosy lounge areas with comfortable seating due to their size. From loungers to sofas and outdoor beds to hammocks—whatever you like and what fits your budget is allowed. Our tip: For a cheaper but no less cool lounge option, simply use trendy pallet furniture.

We end our book of ideas with a roof terrace that has the complete package: from the protective roof to the easy-care floor, plants and comfortable furniture to the magnificent view, nothing is left to be desired here. The highlight is the outdoor kitchen with grill and oven, which guarantees culinary revelations in this terrace paradise.

title: The 4 Best Materials for Balcony Railings: What you Should Pay Attention to When Planning and Selecting
author: Mel—homify
article_paragraphs: Balcony railings are an important component in the architecture and external appearance of your property. Accordingly, it makes sense to match the railing to the architecture and the material of the facade. But which materials are particularly suitable and what are their properties?

The following idea book summarizes four materials—wood, metal, plastic and glass—as possible options for use in thebalconyarea. The idea book contains useful tips on choosing the balcony railing. You will also find information on the costs and care of the selected materials. The maintenance of the balcony railing generally depends on the properties and characteristics of the material.
Spruce wood is a natural material. Like all types of wood, it requires a certain amount of care.
Although wood requires more maintenance than, for example, stainless steel, the material costs are also lower. You should expect to pay between €50 and €80 per linear metre of spruce balcony railing
Larch wood has a high resin content and is therefore considered particularly durable. Larch is classified as medium-hard wood and is therefore well suited for balcony and terrace construction.
High-quality larch wood does not need to be treated. The purchase price for a balcony railing is between €80 and €150 per linear metre.
Douglas fir is considered tough and durable. It is very strong and yet remains fairly coarse-grained. European woods are generally a little softer than American varieties.
If the quality is good, you don't need to paint your Douglas fir balcony railing. Douglas fir is often a slightly cheaper alternative to larch.
Wood has a natural charm. The material is ideal for designing balconies in innovative passive houses and classic old buildings. Maintenance and care costs are relatively high.
The railing should be sanded down and repainted every 5 to 10 years. However, since rainwater runs off the cladding well, the wood is less exposed to the weather than the wood flooring.
We recommend:7 Amazing Benefits of Interior Courtyards.
Balcony railings made of stainless steel are robust, durable and have a special elegance. They are also relatively easy to maintain, which somewhat compensates for the high purchase costs.
Their timeless elegance blends in perfectly with many designs. Stainless steel balcony railings cost up to €300 per linear metre.
Aluminium balcony railings are a good and cheaper alternative to stainless steel railings.
They score points for their similarly low maintenance and pleasant surface finish. On average, at €250 per linear metre, they are around €50 cheaper than stainless steel balcony railings.

Iron balcony railings are usually made by hand. Ironwork of this kind is custom-made, which is why the costs for a railing of this type are correspondingly high. The pure material costs amount to around €90 per linear metre.
Stainless steel is particularly easy to care for and can be easily cleaned with clean water. Aluminium is durable and rustproof.

Available in various colours thanks to powder coating, aluminium balcony railings only need to be cleaned with water once or twice a year. Railings made of galvanized steel can be cleaned with gentle, non-alkaline cleaning agents.
In comparison, plastic is the cheapest material for balcony railings. Plastic is also durable. In our opinion, this is the problem:

In most cases, plastic is an environmental sin and cannot be reconciled with a sustainable lifestyle. Plastic should be cleaned regularly. An unsightly patina quickly forms on plastics that are exposed to the weather all year round.
Cheap plastic panels for balconies are available from just €20 per linear metre. There are now some suppliers who have specialised in the production of railings made from recycled plastic.
If you choose a model of this type for your balcony, you can also combine the project with an environmentally conscious lifestyle.
The following aspects influence the cost of a balcony railing:

Balcony railings made of glass are particularly elegant and unusual in their design. Depending on the design, they are barely visible and thus seamlessly connect the balcony space with its surroundings.
Special glass cleaners are required to clean and maintain glass balcony railings.
Glass railings are very well suited for use in modernarchitecture.They are perceived as part of the external appearance of the property and contribute significantly to an upscale look.

In addition to real glass, acrylic and plexiglass are used on the balcony, with real glass being the most elegant. Laminated glass panels can be set in a stainless steel frame. Laminated glass is available in this context from €80 per linear metre.
Frameless balcony railings made of laminated glass therefore also belong to the higher category.
They are only installed by specialist companies. The cost of a balcony edging of this type can be between €180 and €300 per linear metre.
When installing a balcony railing, certain distances and heights must be observed. The basic rule is that the head of a small child must not fit through the individual planks of the struts.

It is also important that the railing is at least one metre high. Before you begin work, it is essential to inquire about legal regulations at the local building authority. These vary from state to state.

title: Complete Guide to Downspouts: Discover Types, Installation and Prices
author: Sílvia Carvalho—homify
article_paragraphs: Downspout: What is it? The gutter is a construction element that has the function of collecting rainwater that runs down the roofs so that it does not come into contact with the walls. This element helps to protect the structure of the house against possible wear caused by water and, at the same time, to use rainwater by running it into reservoirs.

This is an essential element for the preservation of buildings, as it helps them to remain protected from the aggression of humidity. The deterioration caused by water may not be immediately visible and, therefore, may not seem significant, but in fact, when it becomes noticeable it has already caused a lot of damage. Water infiltration into building structures causes extensive damage that costs a fortune to repair.

That being said, it is essential to install downspouts to ensure the integrity of your home. Whatever you can spend now, you'll be saving yourself worry, lack of comfort and costly repair costs in the future.

The first thing to do before installing the gutter is to decide which one gives the best answer to what you want. There are gutters in various types of material, each of which has advantages and disadvantages that you should know about before choosing.
Below we show you the most popular options.

Due to the characteristics of its material (plastic), the PVC downspout is among the cheapest options in the market, both in terms of product and installation prices. Despite being cheap, these downspouts are durable and resistant to certain damages caused by contact with natural elements and do not allow themselves to corrode. They also have the advantage of being available in the market in various colours, so it is easy to make them fit into a home.

On the other hand, despite being durable, they are not as resistant as downspouts made of any type of metal. This lower resistance implies, for example, a greater need for maintenance and regular cleaning so that, as a result of the accumulation of debris, the material does not break or dismantle. Furthermore, despite the wide palette of colours available, this is not the prettiest material. If you want to opt for a gutter that enhances the building from an aesthetic point of view, look for other materials.

Zinc downspouts are very resistant to rust and any other type of wear and corrosion caused by the weather. Due to its quality and composition, the lifespan of this material is quite long (it can reach 50 years) and the maintenance requirement is low, which ends up compensating, in a certain way, for the higher initial price, making this type of downspout a quite common choice.

If, on the other hand, we are dealing with an extremely resistant and reliable element, it is also true that we can expect a much higher budget. Its installation is also more complex and must be carried out byprofessionals.This is a material that contracts or expands according to temperature changes, making its installation process more intricate and rigorous. Furthermore, it is worth remembering that this material is vulnerable to acid runoff from cedar wood roofs, as well as to saltpetre common in environments close to the sea.

Aluminium downspouts are very resistant to weathering, rust and rot, making them a good solution for areas with adverse weather conditions. This resistance capacity means they last much longer (around 20 years) than PVC, although shorter than zinc. Furthermore, it is a material that is available in various colours, making it easy to acquire the ideal tone for your home.

On the other hand, aluminium, being a material with little flexibility, can become dented quite easily. These damages, although they do not impede its proper functioning and effectiveness, make the element less beautiful and, depending on the dimensions, may even require some type of repair. As with the zinc option, aluminium downspouts also tend to contract or expand with changes in the weather, which requires greater installation care to avoid water infiltration. Finally, although they are available in a wide colour palette, we must bear in mind that their colour is normally achieved through a layer of enamel. This means that, over time, the paint will crack and peel, requiring new paintwork with some frequency.

Stainless steel or stainless steel downspouts are extremely resistant and, unlike other metal options, will maintain their shine and initial beauty for a long time. This type of material is resistant to adverse climate conditions and, therefore, does not damage, break, bend or wear out, whether in extreme heat or cold. This is a long-lasting material that, as a result of its chemical composition, remains free from rust and other signs of corrosion for a long time.

Despite these advantages, it is worth mentioning that it is a very heavy material and, therefore, difficult to work with. You will need a team of professionals to carry out its installation. Furthermore, it is an expensive material which, taking into account that its durability is much greater than that of aluminium, may cause some doubts as to the benefits of its use.

Taking into account the importance of this structure in the security of a home, we strongly recommend that you hire professionals with experience carrying out this work. We realize that, after spending a lot of money on materials, it may seem tempting to save on installation and try to tackle the project without the help of third parties. However, unless you have professional training and the appropriate materials for this, don't do it. What you are saving on installation could end up spending double (or more) on repairing damage caused not only to the gutter but also to the structure of the house itself. Therefore, we suggest that you look for a company in the area that guarantees work with high quality and safety standards, a worry-free process and the guarantee that any future problem will be resolved.
As we can see, the lifespan of a gutter depends on the material, but the average is between 20 and 30 years, depending on the climatic conditions of each region and maintenance care.
Here are the six most common problems:

This is one of the main problems. When debris accumulates and begins to decompose, it creates a “sheet” of solid dirt that clogs the gutter. Accumulated rubbish dangerously increases the risk of fire and is extremely harmful to the roof, which begins to wear out and trap water in the tiles themselves. To prevent this problem from occurring, it is important to clean your gutters twice a year: in autumn (because of the leaves) and at the end of spring (because of the rain).
Sagging gutters

The weight of debris can also cause gutters to fall, usually because the material used to hold the components cannot withstand the additional weight. In addition to cleaning, the gutters that make up the downspout must be well-secured and without gaps between them.

If you see that there is water coming out between the gutters, then there may be a hole causing the leak. In this case, you must repair it quickly so that it does not enlarge. In a construction and DIY store, look for the gutter sealant to caulk the gutter. Larger holes will need to be recommended. To do this, it must be the same material as the gutter, as a different material can cause erosion.
Inadequate slope

If the idea is for water to flow, the gutter must be placed at the right angle. If the gutter is clean and water still accumulates in it, then the slope is not correct. Sometimes this problem is solved with some adjustments, but it may be necessary to remove the gutter and install it again, which is much more work.

Damage tends to occur due to the action of the weather. A strong storm or wind could be enough to knock down the gutter. Then, depending on the condition it is in, it may simply be necessary to replace it or it may have to be replaced, partially or completely. Once again, we emphasize that professional installation is crucial to avoid these problems.

The average price for installing and maintaining a downspout is around 400 euros but can go up to close to 1300 euros, depending on the material used and what this implies in terms of installation. We recommend asking for several quotes so that you can compare what each company offers you and thus be able to make the decision that best suits you. We note, however, that you must make a decision based on what seems to be the proposal with the best quality/price ratio, even if it is not the cheapest.

Here on ourwebsite, you can find professionals and companies in the area that work in your area of residence. Look for references in the sections:roofs, pipes,buildersandconstruction materials. These professionals are the best people to advise and help you regarding materials, prices and installation.

title: Motivation Guaranteed: 13 Great Ideas for Your Home Gym
author: Denise Schopen
article_paragraphs: If you have set new fitness goals for yourself, a home gym can be beneficial in achieving these goals. So that you enjoy training in your gym and so that you don't lose motivation, the gym should be beautifully designed. In this article, we'll show you how you can decorate your home gym particularly beautifully—whether in the basement, attic or as part of theliving room.Take a look at the ideas of our sports-lovinginterior designersand let yourself be inspired by the wide range of options. We're excited to see which gym you choose.
This home gym, which is located under the sloping roof of the house, is very well done. The lower areas of the slope can be used to store sports equipment in a space-saving manner.
If the view from the treadmill or bike is nice, the workout is even more fun. It's nice to integrate the garden view into your home gym if you have the space.
We recommend:11 Creative Ways of Designing a Charming Garden.

If you like things simple, this is the solution for you: a discreet training device that you can place in the room of your choice. Today, there are fitness devices that are so beautifully designed that they look like a beautiful piece of furniture.

Training with others is even more fun. So it's best to put your training equipment and that of your partner or friends next to each other and arrange to train together. If you need distraction or entertainment, a TV is a good option.
If the gym is on a higher floor, you can integrate the beautiful greenery or skyline view into your gym. Floor-to-ceiling windows are particularly suitable!
If you align all the fitness equipment towards the TV, the gym will have a nice sense of harmony and will not look cluttered. You can also watch the TV with all the equipment.
If you add nice wallpaper, a picture or bright lighting to your gym, you can benefit from a much nicer atmosphere. This will of course have a huge impact on your motivation.
If you prefer to train outdoors, you can cheat yourself a little by looking at nature. This way, you almost think you are outside.
What could be better than jumping straight into a warm sauna after a workout? If you have the space, it's especially nice to combine wellness and sports areas.
If you choose decoration in a sporty style, you will increase your motivation to exercise.
A wall bar looks great and is useful for a variety of workouts.
Using a mirror in the gym, you can check whether your posture is correct and whether you are performing exercises correctly.
The good thing about a gym is that you can leave all your exercise equipment in there. If you don't have to get your dumbbells and the like out of the basement, you're more likely to work out.

title: 15 Essential Guest Room Items to make your Guests feel at Home
author: LEENA JHA HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: We the Malaysians love to host guests at home. We prefer families and friends to stay with us at home and feel at home rather than staying in some strange hotel rooms. So if you have an extra room at home that you want to convert to be a guest room or have the guests arriving, it's time to decorate it to make the stay as comfortable and memorable as possible. Here's a compact list of the essential items curated by ourprofessionalsto get the guest room ready and welcoming for your guests' comfortable stay. Check this list out, and your home is prepared to receive the guests.

Don’t leave your guests living out of a suitcase. It’s uncomfortable to take out and keep the stuff back even if it is a short visit. Keep a storage cabinet empty and ready for the exclusive use by your guest.

Keep a bedside lamp handy for the guests to use. The guests are unfamiliar with the room's layout, and the switches make finding the path in the dark quite tricky. A bedside lamp will be a boon in the darkness of night when they don’t want to sleep with the light on.
Probably the guests are not coming to work or study. But then, who knows, maybe they would admire a study table or workspace in theroom.
Television has become an integral part of our home and life. So fix a separate TV with TV unitsfor the guest room for the comfortable viewing of their choicest show right from their room's comfort.
Every person has a different need when it comes to getting a comfortable sleep. Throw in some extra comforter, pillows, and bedsheets for your guests. You never know when they will need it.

It's an easy and comfortable hack even for the host to bring some comfort in the guest bedroom. The foldable bed table can be used as a work/study table and serve the morning's bed tea/coffee. Fold it and tuck it away when not needed and no space will be occupied.
Your guests will surely love a comfortable recliner kept in the guest room of your house. You can opt for a movable chair or a sofa; it will depend on the space you have in the room.
The guests will appreciate this small, thoughtful gesture. Fresh towels, toiletries, toothbrushes, toothpaste, etc., is quite handy and helpful for the guests.
You can’t expect the guests to travel with cloth hangers! So keep a few extra hangers in the guest room wardrobe for the use of the guests.
Don’t leave your guests wondering where to collect the dirty laundry to be cleaned. A laundry basket will also help you and them to sort the laundry and keep the cupboard clean and clear.
In modern times everyone has a clock and alarm on their mobile phones. However, the simple gesture of placing an alarm clock in the guest bedroom will not harm and add to the décor too.
Door hooks, a rod fixed or hanging on the wall are a simple way to make space for clothes, jackets, coats, purses, etc. It is especially perfect for a small guest room.

Well… if you don’t enough space for a dressing table, then find a way to fix amirrorin the guest room. After all, it is one thing anyone will need each day of the stay and definitely feel uncomfortable running to share the dressing room of your bedroom.

Use it for sitting, throwing the bag or clothes, or be a seat for you when you visit the guests in the guest room, a humble piece of movable furniture elevates the comfort of the guest room décor without you realizing its importance.

Nothing can be more welcoming than a vase full of flower or green plants' freshness in the planters. You cannot ignore the power of flowers when it comes to decoration. And your guest will appreciate your skilful décor and freshness of the indoor plants.
Get ideas to decorate your home with indoor plants:11 of the most stunning indoor plant arrangements you will ever see

title: The Perfect Lighting Concepts to Make Dark Rooms Brighter
author: Denise Schopen
article_paragraphs: If you want to bring a little more light into darkerrooms,you can achieve amazing results with lights and lighting concepts. Today we would like to introduce you to some great concepts—and tips fromlighting planners- on how you can create more light in your rooms, even if they have smaller windows or no windows at all. We have examples for bathrooms,dining rooms,kitchens, living rooms, bedrooms, hallways, stairs and much more for you!
So, let’s take a look and read on.

Thisstaircasedoes not receive any direct daylight. For this reason, special lighting was sought that would also enhance the room. The result is a room with subtle yet special lighting in the shape of drops.
This spiral staircase is an eye-catcher and at the same time an additional light source for your living space. The indirect lighting provides more brightness subtly.

If you have little light in your dressing room, bedroom, children's room or other rooms where you have cupboards, lighting the drawers is a good idea. This way you will never be annoyed by dark corners again.

If you install indirect lighting directly on a mirror, you can benefit twice. The brightness of the light source is doubled and you can enjoy a very bright atmosphere. In combination with light-coloured furniture, you can conjure up significantly more brightness and light in previously dark rooms.

If you choose lights like these, you can look forward to a special light source. The two lights emit a beautiful beam of light in two directions and thus provide very pleasant lighting in the living room.
Since the lights take up practically no space, they can be installed anywhere.

Are you annoyed by the cold light in the bathroom? If you have a dark bathroom, you can create a great—and above all, a slightly different—atmosphere with hanging lights. The boho-style lights provide pleasant light while you relax in the bath.

Indirect lighting on the ceiling looks particularly beautiful in any room. This way, you can conjure up more perceived daylight in your living room, especially in the evenings or on grey days. You can then complement this lighting with other light sources, e.g. above the dining table.
Do you want eye-catching lighting for your dining room table? Then this model might be something for you: The three hanging rods provide pleasant light and beautiful illumination of the table.
We want goodlightingin the kitchen. For this reason, we live with the great ceiling lights that provide modern and bright light.
A bedroom should also have good natural light. This bedroom, which only has a small window, benefits from ceiling spotlights and stylish bedside lamps.
In this living and dining room, it is clear how precisely the accents for the lighting of individual areas were set.

title: How Can I Make Large Rooms Comfortable?
author: Jens Dittmer
article_paragraphs: Largeroomstend to seem uncomfortable or cold at first glance. They look imposing and at the same time, they also make you feel confused because the existing interior suddenly seems to be insignificant. But you can counteract this. To do this, you need to show a little sensitivity and incorporate a little creativity into your planning. There are various ways to create comfort in larger rooms. You can achieve this, for example, with appropriatewalldesigns, either by using wallpaper with motifs, hanging pictures or sticking special tattoos on the wall. You can of course also get artistic yourself and design motifs yourself and draw them on the wall. In addition, with larger rooms, you should also pay attention to the materials you want to use in the rooms. Individual materials appear cool, while surfaces made of wood or with a wood look radiate a certain warmth.

If your rooms are characterized by a rather soberarchitectureand the large room initiallyoverwhelmsyou,room dividersor partition walls offer tasteful alternatives that not only divide rooms but also allow different uses of the resulting halves. These measures can be designed in different ways and do not require a lot of effort in terms of subsequent installation. When furnishing larger rooms, do not focus on how they may appear to outsiders, but primarily ensure that you enjoy being in the rooms and feel comfortable. Always keep in mind that your own four walls are the central point for you and your family. You spend your free time in them and relax from everyday life. Living spaces should reflect your personality. Take enough time to find appropriate suggestions that suit both you and your ideas. Inspiration can be found almost every day and on every corner if you keep your eyes open.

Designing large rooms requires a delicate touch and a good eye. The room should not be cluttered and should not look like a museum or a reception hall. By using the rightfurnitureand accessories, you can also decorate a large room attractively and create a harmonious image. Today we will show you a few helpful tips from ourinterior designerson how you can decorate your spacious and large living room or other rooms. Decorating a large living room or making a large living room cosy is not that difficult with a few tips.

Large rooms can be a real challenge when it comes to creating a cosy atmosphere. However, this only seems very complex at first glance. There are numerous suggestions for creating a cosy atmosphere. Large furniture looks very bulky and takes away the room's visual dominance.

When choosing large furniture, you should also pay attention to the colour properties. Brown tones have a cosy effect and do not darken the room too much. Accents can be set tastefully by using carpets that create contrasts. But here too, you should pay attention to warm colours so that the overall atmosphere appears calm and gentle. Pastel tones or cream colours can often support this effect, as they greatly facilitate colour transitions.

In addition to a warm design of the walls and floor, accessories are also among the elements that make a large room feel cosy. Particular attention is not always paid to attractive curtains, but also to details that immediately catch the eye but are overlooked.

For example, use sofa sets that are covered in textiles. At the same time, you can tastefully decorate the upholstered furniture with attractive cushions. You can also use pictures and carpets that have a positive effect on the room climate. However, you don't have to base the design of your rooms exclusively on textiles. However, since they have an inviting effect, they should be taken into account in every step of your room design.

Larger rooms have a very elegant appearance and allow for generous division and use of the space. However, they are not easy to handle in some respects. You will notice this at the latest when it comes to creating a cosy atmosphere. If you have carefully chosen your new home, then the architecture may favour your plans.

Large rooms that have a rustic look or wooden beams make it much easier to create a cosy atmosphere. If you can't enjoy the benefits of wooden beams in the walls and ceiling, you can use wallpaper to make them look better. You can also give the floor a wooden look. Wood has a warm effect and creates a pleasant and inviting atmosphere.

With larger rooms, you get more flexibility, which makes furnishing much easier. You can design the rooms more loosely and combine furnishing styles, even if they look completely different. In addition, you can place attractive pictures, which not only act as an elegant eye-catcher but also create a certain cosiness in large rooms.

Pictures not only create a cosy atmosphere in larger rooms, but at the same time, they look very elegant and give the room a dignified flair that invites you to linger. They are an eye-catcher that makes it difficult for the viewer to ignore the effect. Rounded off with an impressive sofa, this way, conversations can take place in a cosy atmosphere.

Large rooms can be decorated comfortably if you dare to let your imagination run wild. It is even easier if you also take your personality into account when decorating. Why not let your favourite colours become the theme of the entire room? In coordination with different elements, this can lead to impressive results.

Use your favourite colour as a base and look for a matching accent. After that, all you need is the intuition to combine the colours appealingly and subtly. This doesn't necessarily have to be complicated if, for example, you choose wallpaper in the corresponding colours and match accessories such as cushions and curtains to the colours. However, the impressive overall picture only unfolds if the base colour dominates the room and the contrast surrounds your favourite colour.

Large rooms appear very bulky at first glance, especially if they are not yet furnished. At the same time, in this state, they also allow a sober view of the possibilities available to you. The first question that arises is how to create cosiness in a room of this size.

The solutions are very diverse and range from floor, ceiling and wall design to lighting and attractive accessories. But especially in empty rooms, you have the option of installing a partition wall or a room divider. This ensures a visual reduction in the realistic space available. In addition, you can concentrate on one half and furnish it in a homely manner and according to your ideas.

title: 30 Great Facades With Stone
author: Sabrina Werner
article_paragraphs: Stone is a natural material that has many advantages. When used for the facade, it automatically conveys elegance and beauty, and depending on the colour and structure, it can make the house look modern and simple or give it a rustic, cosy feel. There are many possible uses for it. Whole walls can be built with stone, but an existing wall can also be bricked or stone can be used in individual areas. We have therefore put together 30 ideas that show you how you can tastefully design a facade with stone.
If you are looking for more facade ideas, then thisidea bookwould be perfect for you.

Stone is a particularly impressive material that can be used to design your house facade. It looks great and blends in perfectly with the surroundings. We will also show you an impressive facade cladding with astone look outside. Whether it's a real stone facade or a facade cladding with a stone look, both options look great! Be inspired by how you can use facade stones to beautify your house. Thenatural stone housecan be designed in a modern or classic style. So take a look at our great ideas for facade design with stone. We are sure you will be just as impressed as we are!
Are you currently thinking about extending the space in your house? Then read this book of ideas:For which extensions and conversions do I need a building permit?
A discreet strip is enough to take the sobriety out of a white, simple facade and transform it into a clear, modern and at the same time inviting facade.
The turquoise windows and doors give this natural stone façade its Mediterranean style, while clean lines make it appear contemporary.
Thishousewith its exciting geometric shapes and interesting lines has a rustic touch by combining natural stone with wood.
Even when used in small areas, the stone helps to create a stylish and individual facade.
This modern, square and completely white house has been varied by vertical stone elements.
In this house, stone was also used in the form of vertical areas, but additionally combined with glass.
This house also combines stone and glass—but on one floor.
The striking composition of this house is created by the visual connection of solid stone with the water of the chic swimming pool.
In this house, the black natural stone serves to contrast the white facade.
The charm of this façade lies in the natural character of the natural stone. Irregular shapes alternate with the coloured shades that the stone naturally has.
In this house, the combination of natural stones with the reddish ceiling creates a beautiful play of colours, which is emphasized by the great outdoor lighting.
In this house, natural stone and glass were combined to complement each other and create a balanced appearance.
Whendesigningrustic houses like this one, natural stone is an unbeatable material.

Houses that consist of several complexes can benefit from the use of different materials. In this house, two complexes with a natural stone facade were connected by an area designed with wood and glass.
Natural stone makes this Spanish country estate a haven of warmth and cosiness.
In this house, the garage itself was enclosed in the stone façade, creating a harmonious image.
The facade of this house is made entirely of stone and has a large veranda with wooden pillars.
Sometimes the facade of a house can gain style through a simple natural stone wall.
The style of houses in Tuscany has been copied many times when it comes to building a beautiful stone house. This project shows what makes Tuscan houses so popular.
This modern, ecological single-family home is characterized by the combination of stone, glass and simple shades of grey.
This house has a dreamy flair thanks to the playful details that complement the stone façade.
The focus of this huge house is the view of the sea from the living rooms. A body with lots of glass and a simple plaster facade was placed on a lower, solid stone level.
Stone was also combined with a modern design in this house. The spotlights on the floor and ceiling underline the effect of the natural stone.
A stone-designed cube was placed in front of this modern house.
A stone wall was added in front of this house and integrated into the design of the front garden.
In this house, the natural stone divides the simple facade into two parts and offers so much variety to the view.
This modern house with its exciting volumes also has a solid stone substructure.
This entrance has been accentuated with natural stone and looks like a solid gate.
The natural stone that was used in part for this façade is not in the form of a gate but still provides an accent.
Just as natural stone is suitable for vertical division, it can also be used for horizontal division. Here it underlines the volume of the two-story building.

title: Beautify The Bathroom Of The Rental Apartment With These 9 Tips
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: As a tenant, you are stuck with a lot of things, especially in thebathroom.Shower, bathtub, washbasin, fittings and tiles—you usually have to take all of these as they are and don't have much room for change. Nevertheless, with a few tricks and tips, you can get the most out of the existing bathroom, make it completely more beautiful and give it a personal and individual touch. With the following nine tips, every rented bathroom becomes an oasis of well-being.

Of course, the bathroom is not necessarily the room you like to clean the most. Especially not if the previous tenant lived there until recently. But we have no other choice: If we want to turn a bathroom that is still unfamiliar into our very own personal oasis of well-being, we need a thorough clean—from the ceiling to the floor. It is worth it because afterwards, we feel much more comfortable in the new bathroom.
Check out this idea book,design hacks to maximise space in small bathrooms.

A new shower curtain works wonders when it comes to beautifying the bathroom in your rented apartment and giving it a personal touch. Brightly coloured or subtly plain, with or without a pattern, romantically playful, minimalistic or crazy—it's not the landlord who decides, but our taste.

The toilet in a rented apartment is a tricky thing… But when it comes to the toilet seat, we have a lot of leeway. If it's too old, too dirty or just not our style, we can swap it for something nicer.

As a tenant, you generally don't have much freedom when it comes to choosing the tiles in your bathroom. Either you're lucky and find neutral white or a cool design that suits your taste, or you're unlucky. But even in this case, you can find a solution—with tile stickers that are easy to apply and just as easy to remove.

If you want to make your rented bathroom even more comfortable with a little luxury and comfort, you can buy a new shower head for a little money. The old one can be easily replaced, but you should keep it in a safe place so that you can screw it back on just as easily when you move out.

Storage space is often scarce in renters' bathrooms. Fortunately, numerous great and practical solutions don't require drilling holes in the walls or investing a fortune. Freely placeable wall shelves, hanging baskets, hooks that stick to the wall and rolling containers are functional helpers that reliably store our things.

We feel most comfortable in rooms with personalities that say something about the person who lives there. In a rented apartment, you just have to know how to help yourself. If you can't choose the bathroom furnishings, you at least have the opportunity to give the room a personal touch with the appropriate decorations. Photos and pictures, souvenirs from trips, a certaincolourscheme or a theme that suits us (for exampleOrient,BeachorAsia Spa) as well as selected small details with charm and character can help.
Another update in the bathroom is plants. They not only ensure a good room climate but also round off anyinterior designin an atmospheric way.
Room fragrances for the bathroom are always a good idea. Whether in the form of scented candles, oils, room sprays or diffusers, it's all up to your taste.

title: 10 Modern Houses with White Exterior Shining Bright
author: LEENA JHA HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: Modern, minimalist, and then monochromatic, the recent home décor trends emphasize simplicity and elegance. When choosing the exterior color, white is a popular choice for its crispness and brightness that make an impression to last forever. The versatility of white is such that it suits every architectural style from classic to contemporary and all locations from hills to beaches. The favorite color among the professionalarchitects, white, is equally loved by the homeowners when painting the house exterior to make it shine and bright. Let’s walk through the modern home with a white exterior color for ideas and inspirations.
Stonework and stucco with gabled roofs, thedouble-storeyhouse suits the fairy tale imagination. The modern combination of white, off white and urban gray, gives the house the mystic style.

With the shine of glass doors, the brightness of white on the walls and ceiling, and then the artistic makeover from the carving on the front column matching in white, the house exterior is serenely pristine.
The Colonial-stylehousepainted in white and the monotony of white broken by glass windows and wrought iron grill and fencing in the balcony is simply splendid.

The concrete walkway leading to the majestic columns guarding the glass doors creates an elegant exterior washed in pristine white. The pergola on the terrace is painted white and decorated with greenery and flowering plants, which mixes the elegance of white with nature's color.

The monochrome magic dominated with white color with a touch of natural stone and warmth of yellow light seeping through the glass doors and windows combine to create a picture-perfect exterior. The gabled roof covered with slate color bricks adds extra magic to the house exterior.

Black-gray stone covering the façade, the patch of brown, the elegance of glass, and the judicious use of white, the merger of various shades, make the white shine bright. The innovative way to add the crispness of white in the house exterior is quite impressive.
The textured wall in off white with pure white gracing thefaçadein bits and pieces, and the gray slanting roof creates a magnificent exterior in different shades of white.

The yellow glow of the light embraces the white walls supporting the glass dominating the modern house. The slanting roof, the house moving uphill with the hills, and the three floors build up a stunning house exterior in white and glass.
Stone and wood merge with the white walls dominating the house exterior, converting it into stunning home basking in the philosophy of simplicity and minimalism.

The modern combination of white andUltimate Graytransforms what would have been a simple house exterior into a grand decor to make an impression that can last forever. The elegant color combination gets complement by the versatile elegance of glass.
Check out these front door designs for your home:13 Front Doors that Contribute to Stunning Façade Designs

title: The Best Way To Separate The Living Room From The Entrance Area: 7 Examples
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: Modern apartments and houses thrive on their spaciousness and openness. Floor plans with as few walls as possible, in which the individual functional areas flow seamlessly into one another, are more popular than ever. Despite all the spaciousness, a certain structure and privacy should of course be maintained. For this purpose, creative room divider solutions come into play, which separates individual areas from one another and ensures order and clarity. Today, ourinterior designers and decoratorsare devoting themselves to the question of which ideas can be used to separate the living area from the entrance area.

Shelves are one of the most popular room dividers because, on the one hand, they create clear boundaries, but on the other hand they allow views and, above all, they let light in. This option is particularly suitable for apartments where the entrance area does not have a window and would otherwise appear too dark.
Are you worried about the perfect place to place your TV in your living room? Here's the guide you need:10 Modern Ideas To Place The Television In The Living Room.

In this case, the entrance area was separated from the living room with a clever wall system. It houses bookshelves, a TV and storage space on one side and a wardrobe with a mirror on the other, thus killing several birds with one stone.
Here we see a house with an open floor plan, but the layout itself separates the living area and the entrance area. You just have to turn the corner and you're in theliving room.

Here we see a room divider variant for bookworms and book fans. The oversized shelf offers plenty of space for all reading material and thus becomes a library between the living room and entrance area, which also serves a dividing function.

Half walls are a popular and effective way to separate functional areas within a home without sacrificing the open, spacious feel of the space. They provide privacy where it is desired, but do not hinder the flow of the open floor plan.

This example shows that you don't have to take any complicated measures to separate the entrance from the living area. Bulky wall systems or huge room dividers would be out of place, especially in small apartments and one-room flats. Instead, a small shelf is enough as a minimal privacy screen and structural element.

Pillars and columns can also be useful when it comes to separating individual areas of the apartment from one another. Here, the supporting pillar was used as the basis for a modern, creative shelving system that visually separates the entrance and living room. D

title: 8 artistic bedside tables that enhance bedroom interiors
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: You can enhance the bedroom with modern furniture, interesting bed linen and other decorative details but its interior decor can never be completed without one or two bedside tables close to the headrest. These pieces of furniture should not only match the overall decor theme of the room, but should also complement the bed.

These bedside tables are functional because they help to store essentials like clock, water-bottle, spectacles keys  and even bedside lamp that can be switched on instantly during an emergency without stumbling around for a light switch in the dark.  Interior decorators always consider bedside tables an essential part of bedroom furniture and plan its design and color to match with overall decor of the room. But sometimes DIY's prefer to design it themselves to suit their temperament. In this ideabook we have curated 8 artistic bedside table designs to match the conceptual look of the bedrooms that will inspire you to try out one of these designs to enhance the beauty of your own bedroom.

Suited to thisminimalist bedroomlayout the bedside tables are also simple, light and elegant. The color and design blends withother parts of room and they just big enough to accommodate essentials as drawers are spacious for all necessities.

This entire bedroom has a modern and clutter free look and the bedside table in the midst of both beds make the whole layout look even better. The square shape and deep drawers of this custom made bedside table are perfectly suited for the region as they have plenty of space to accommodate essential belongs of people sleeping on either side.

These bedside tables  attached to the wall may look small but they are perfectly suited to the needs.  They are ideal for small bedrooms in the attic or guest bedrooms that may require minimal storage. Being lightweight and detachable they can easily be removed and attached elsewhere if required.

If space is a constraint then try out this simple design wherein just a simple of wood doubles as a bedside table here. The rustic wooden design free of artificial paint suits this decor and brightens up the layout. The floating table design gives plenty of room for keeping objects like pictures, lamps, spectacles, cell phone and even small vase on it without taking up any floor space.

This cute bedside table is made up of two sections with a slim drawer on topside and square cabinet below it. It is perfectly matched with the bed made of same dark wood paneling and can be used to store small objects like spectacles or keys and even large objects like books or water. This  creative bedside table can be also homemade if the have the right tools or get it custom made by anexperienced carpenter.

This nightstand has a very upmarket design with top section made of glass and bottom made from wood. This bedside table design is most likely to find place in upscale apartments as there is plenty of space between the top glass and wooden sections of this table for storing books and other paraphernalia.

This nightstand that looks like a combination of two is  very cute! This table with hollowed out niche fits in with all kinds of decor and can fit in multiple objects both above and within its interiors that would be needed within your reach. This unique design can be used as an accent table, random desk or just holding a picture frame.

A classic bedroom as this with all the trappings of luxury like wall sconces, expensive furniture, carpets, wall decor and even a crystal chandelier would look incomplete without stylish nightstands.  In keeping with the decor style the nightstands on either side are also designed like dressers with multiple pullout drawers fitted with ornamental brass handles.
Want to explore some more? Here arebeautiful bedside table for every bedroom.

title: 7 Tricks To Make Your Living Room Super Cosy
author: Conny Eisfeld
article_paragraphs: Slowly but surely, it is no longer possible to deny that summer with its short, mild nights is finally over. Autumn has arrived, jackets and coats are hanging in our wardrobes again, and winter is slowly making its way onto the shoe rack.

To protect yourself as best as possible against the cold, wet temperatures and the dwindling daylight, the need to design and decorate your house or apartment as comfortably as possible arises, especially in autumn and winter. With the help of ourinterior designers and decorators,we will show you tricks to achieve this quickly and effectively!

Crackling fire, cosy atmosphere. Anyone who buys a fireplace for theirliving roomis well on their way to turning their living room into a cosy lounge. Fireplaces not only heat the room temperature but also the atmosphere in it, bathing the living room in a warm glow and increasing the cosy and feel-good factor enormously. Especially now that the transition to the cold season is imminent, using the fireplace is an external and internal benefit. Staring into the fire stimulates the flow of thoughts—you can relax and be lulled by the radiating warmth.
Tip: Open fireplaces increase thecosyfeeling even more.

Of course, you don't want to become a couch potato, but you shouldn't do without a cosy central point in the living room. Even if the environment already seems very homely thanks to soft textiles, warm colours and decorations, the sofa can sometimes be the only piece of furniture in the living room that also makes you feel physically comfortable. If there is enough space, this naturally also extends to chaise longues, loveseats and other armchair-like furniture. The design doesn't have to hide behind the function of comfort. Both can be wonderfully combined these days.

Even though it usually seems cold, a leather sofa in a warm brown tone can become a real centrepiece of cosiness in the living room. Take a look at this idea book,19 smart ideas to create cosy interiors in your home.

The height of comfort, however, is an extremely deep sofa seat, where you can put your feet up in an instant without even taking up space from your neighbour. Ideal for cosy Sunday afternoons while it's storming and snowing outside. Maybe even in front of an open fire?

This corner sofa is guaranteed to become your new favourite spot in the living room. And the best part: It even has a sleeping function, which means it can be transformed into a comfortable bed in no time at all when you have overnight guests.

Soft textiles look exactly like they do: warm and sometimes cosy. The great thing about textiles is that they are wonderfully unobtrusive and increase the cosiness factor of any living room without much drama. They seem more like a connection betweenfurnitureand accessories.

These include carpets in particular, which can have a major impact on the atmosphere in your home. Beyond the floor, there are windows, which can be fashionably accentuated with the help of curtains and, thanks to their relatively low cost, can be replaced as often as you like. You can also add curtains or just choose one of these decorative elements.

Another classic is adding pillows in all shapes and colours, and they certainly contribute the most to cosiness. Depending on the style of your living room, you can choose pillowcases made of different fabrics and with different patterns or as a colourful accent, or you can make them yourself.

Tables also fall into this category. Depending on the colour and size, however, they can quickly turn out to be a dominant eye-catcher. In addition, the choice of fabric and pattern for upholstered furniture can also influence the comfortable living environment.

Warm colours act as a contrast to the wintry tones outside and transform the living room into a cosy place. While it looks bare and dreary behind the glass, the living room is enlivened by intense colours from orange to brown to red. If you prefer your furniture in neutral tones, you can also bring warm colours into the living room using textiles such as cushions or lampshades. You can also add targeted splashes of colour with the help of accessories. You don't have to use only warm tones. A beautiful blue or a soft violet can bring excitement and variety to the room.

If you follow the biological rhythm of plants, you can theoretically decorate your apartment or house with flowering potted plants all year round. Alternatively, it is of course worth visiting a florist to bring the special flair of the seasons into your home. But the classic green potted plant or the charismatic cactus also add decorative accents to the living room ambience. Especially if the plant itself is rather plain, you can let your imagination run wild when choosing the vase or flowerpot. But it doesn't matter which flower or plant you choose. The fact is that they bring harmony into the living room and, as a healthy side effect, also ensure a better indoor climate. Especially in the living room, where you often spend several hours with several people, plants not only have a calming but also arefreshingeffect. There are even plants that can improve the air particularly quickly.

When it comes to decoration, there is often a fine line between comfort and disorder—especially in the living room, as it is the most used room, and people tend to overload it. After all, you want to have all your memories, beloved accessories and travel souvenirs within sight and at eye level. But here too, less is more. This is not to say that bare walls are the new comfort. Instead, you should concentrate on individual, distinctive decorative items or place a few larger accessories rather than many small ones. This could be, for example, a picture with a striking frame around it, a large clock, a sailboat, a row of books or a table lamp.

The classic mood maker: candles in all possible shapes, colours and styles. They spread comfort and the scent of cinnamon, especially at Christmas time, and can also create a romantic atmosphere in the evenings the rest of the year. Similar to a fireplace, candles bathe the living room in a soft, warm light, albeit in a smaller but equally effective style. Who can't relax immediately with so much cosiness in the living room? Whether a mix of styles or a series, in different sizes, whether classic or unusual, candles and their holders inevitably exude romantic charm and create a cosy ambience.

title: 15 Original Ideas for a Shoe Cabinet
author: Stefanie Loske
article_paragraphs: As a piece of furniture, a shoe cabinet is often underestimated and only perceived as functional. But it is often in thehallwayand entrance and is one of the first pieces of furniture that guests and you see. And if you believe the cliché, only women need a shoe cabinet to store their huge amounts of shoes. This cliché has long since ceased to correspond to reality. Because let's be honest, men also need a way to put their shoes out of sight—and families in particular. Shoe cabinets and shelves ensure that the entrance area remains free of shoe chaos, because most of the time all the shoes are standing next to each other and stacked on top of each other, just looking unsightly. The fact that the shoe cabinet not only has to serve a purpose, but can also look decorative, is shown by the following shoe storage ideas, which can range from classic to unusual.
PS: You might need to hire aprofessional carpenterfor these ideas.

This model shows how you can easily bring order to your home and eliminate shoe chaos. More than 20 pairs of shoes can be stored neatly in a row. The slim design means the shoe cabinet can easily be placed in a small hallway and reinforces the tidy overall impression. If you choose it with colored cabinet doors, it will be livened up a bit and won't be as boring as a conventional shoe cabinet.

Another good idea for storing shoes in a space-saving way is to attach angled shelves to the wall. Not only does this look stylish, but the openness of the shelves also puts the shoes in the spotlight.

If you have a lot of boots and ankle boots in your shoe collection, boot panels can help. If boots and ankle boots are on the floor, it usually looks very chaotic, but the storage option with the panels makes it quick and easy to organize the shoes. If they are attached to the wall in the hallway, the wall should not be too narrow, as they can then take up too much space.
8 Storage Solutions for Every Need.

If you don't want to store your shoes in a closed cupboard in the back corner, open cupboards are the way to go. Some shoes are just too beautiful to be hidden in dark cupboards or squeezed next to other shoes. This way you can proudly display them and they will have an impact not only when worn on your feet.

What is more reminiscent of a wall bar from school days is a great way to organize your shoes in a space-saving way. Especially for small hallways, this is another way to create flexible space for your shoes. It is also a very original and fun alternative to the conventional shoe cabinet. Who would suspect that this is a shoe cabinet? But that is precisely what makes it original and makes it a real eye-catcher.

If you would rather keep your shoes out of sight, you can easily integrate your shoe cabinet into your wardrobe. This way, no shoe cabinet takes up space in the hallway and everything is still nicely organized. If you want to show off your favorite pieces, you can do so with individual pairs using other storage options mentioned here.
If you have a whole dressing room , you can easily store them there and keep them out of the guests' sight. This also saves the space needed for a separate shoe cabinet in the hallway.

For the elegant version, this model offers everything your heart desires. It comes in a trendy vintage look and is a real eye-catcher. Its wooden compartments also offer plenty of space for your personal shoe collection.

For those who like something unusual, this metal cabinet is worth considering. Shoe cabinets and wardrobes don't always have to match, but can look stylish just because they look different. An old metal locker was simply converted into a shoe cabinet. Not only does it look super stylish, it also serves its purpose more than satisfactorily. You certainly won't find a shoe cabinet like this in anyone else's home anytime soon.

The idea of a shoe cabinet inside the wall is both really cool and crazy. On the one hand, this idea really saves space and at the same time shows off your favorite pieces. You won't find a shoe cabinet like this in any other apartment any time soon.

There are also a few great ideas for storing children's shoes. This shoe cabinet is a mix of a bench and a shoe rack. The rounded corners and edges are very child-friendly and the curves give the whole thing an elegant and classy touch. It looks particularly good in a child's room or hallway.
Especially for children, it can be something cute and funny. A wooden shoe cabinet is ideal for this, perhaps in the shape of the child's favorite animal.
Most people probably have a shoe cabinet like this in their hallway or apartment. The shoe rack is so popular because it saves a lot of space and can even fit in the narrowest hallway.

If you're a real shoe lover and own a few really valuable pieces, you'll naturally want to show them off. Placed next to each other on a kind of pedestal, the shoes will attract everyone's attention. And if they're well lit, they look even more classy.

For individualists with a sense of humor, this type of shoe cabinet offers a fun solution for organizing shoes and saving space at the same time. At first glance, you would hardly think it's a shoe cabinet, but that's exactly what makes it so charming.

Nowadays, it no longer has to be the boring classic shoe cabinet that every second person has in their apartment. Sure, it offers a great way to save space and put shoes out of the way, and is certainly the right thing to start with. However, if you want to add style and charm to your interior, you should think about the different storage options. There are now numerous stylish, funny, elegant and luxurious versions of shoe cabinets, so everyone can find what they are looking for. They all fulfill their function, but not all of them are eye-catchers and can beautify the interior of the apartment.

title: How To Solve Your Door Problems Yourself
author: Isabel Herwig
article_paragraphs: You only notice doors in yourliving roomwhen they stop working properly. Most of the time, you take them for granted. But they're annoying when they creak, squeak, don't close properly, open on their own, or drag across the floor. We all know what it's like, the problem is ignored until someone else takes care of it or you drive yourself crazy.

It is normal for the doors in your house or apartment to develop one or two problems sooner or later. This is partly due to the frequency of use, such as in the living room, but also to the material and humidity. Often small mistakes are made during installation that need to be ironed out later.

In most cases, however, you can save yourself the trouble of calling in aprofessional.We can repair the broken doors in our house easily by ourselves in just a few steps. In this idea book, we have collected the most common problems that occur with doors and also provided you with the appropriate remedies.

Do you want to repair your doors at home yourself and quickly get rid of annoying squeaking or jamming noises yourself? Then you should read our tips and tricks for apartment doors! We give you important information about your doors so that you can open and close your doors without stress. Regardless of whether the door has a frame or not, repairing a door is not that difficult. We will also show you how to adjust room doors and how to adjust awarpeddoor.
By the way: Here you can see15 original ideas for a shoe cabinet.

Every time you go through a door, you have to lift it so that it doesn't drag across the floor. Not only is that extremely annoying, but it also ruins the floor. There are several ways to solve the problem.

The easiest way to repair the door is to take some space at the top of the frame. Then the door is removed and the hinges are placed under a ring. This lifts the door. If that doesn't work, the hinges have to be screwed in further. Important: If you screw the top one in further, the lock side of the door will rise, while the bottom one will sink a little. If that doesn't work either, the door will have to be shortened! But please don't just cut off the bottom edge with a jigsaw, use a circular saw instead. Otherwise, it will be crooked and uneven and you'll have the same problem again. If you're renting, it's a good idea to discuss this with your landlord beforehand.
When doors close or open as if by magic, they are usually installed crookedly. If you're lucky, only the door leaf is crooked in the frame; if you're unlucky, the entire frame is crookedly installed.

The simplest, but still laborious, option is to lift the door off the hinges and turn the hinges on the door leaf. This regulates the distance between the hinges and the leaf, which straightens the door. You should always put the door back in place after a few turns to test it.

If you prefer to start with simpler means, you can try putting adhesive tape around the hinges and then putting the door back in. Sometimes small adjustments can work wonders. If you're already screwing, you can also try adjusting the hinges. Simply screw the upper or lower hinge in or out further and, if necessary, sand down the frame behind the hinge a little to get more room.
There is no need to worry about creaking and squeaking doors. The easiest way to solve this door problem is to solve it yourself. Because if it squeaks, all you have to do is oil it!

There are two ways to oil a door that makes spooky noises. Old doors often have oil holes in the hinges. They are there for exactly this purpose. Put oil in and you're done. Modern interior doors no longer have the holes. But you only need to take them off their hinges to grease the hinges.

But always make sure you use the right lubricant. Commercially available multi-purpose oils from hardware stores don't always do the job. They contain a lot of liquid petrol and only a small amount of lubricant. It's best to use bicycle oils, as they don't dry out so easily. Sewing machine oil is also good.
And even if home remedies like shaving foam, hairspray or butter initially sound like quick and easy solutions, it's better to avoid them. They do work, but they're only short-lived.

Laying a new floor, incorrect installation or the natural settling of the house can turn a door into an almost insurmountable obstacle. Often, however, a door only jams after a new door leaf has been installed in the existing frame. If moisture is added to this, a lot of the door warps.

If, however, the frame shrinks more in cold and dry conditions or grows more in warm and humid conditions than the door leaf, the door will jam. In the long term, in this case, you can only replace the door leaf or the door frame, ideally with a new or good, used door system.

The easiest way to seal a draughty door is to put a textile, tube-shaped stopper in front of the door. This must cover the entire gap and be extremely well attached to the edge of the door. Otherwise, these things are more of a hindrance in everyday use because they can easily get jammed.

A better way to stop annoying drafts is to use brush seals under the door leaf. They have the great advantage that the flexible bristles also compensate for unevenness in the floor. However, you should first check whether there are washers in the hinges that lift the door. If you can remove these without the door dragging on the floor, the problem almost solves itself.

Making small repairs to your doors is a piece of cake. All you need is a screwdriver and the right parts. You can get new door leaves for around 50 euros. DIN standards have regulated the shapes and sizes of doors since 1985. So if the door is no older than 30 years, you can easily replace the door leaf without changing the frame.

To give your door a new handle, all you need is a so-called handle set (strange word—but it simply means everything that goes with the two handles) from the hardware store, a pencil, a screwdriver, a cordless drill and a wood drill. To be able to use the old drill holes in the door leaf, you need to use at least a handle model of a similar size. It's best to take the old handle set with you to the hardware store when you buy a new one. The many individual parts are daunting at first, but they're not bad at all and can be installed in no time at all.

You simply replace the hinge by unscrewing it from the frame—that's quite logical. You need an Allen key for this. It's also easy to continue: you then put the new hinge back into the frame and when fastening it, make sure that the hinge is about three to five millimetres away from the frame.

title: Which Colour Best Suits Your Zodiac Sign?
author: Anne Krusche—HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: Living according to your star sign—what's the truth? Many experts swear by an interior design style that suits your star sign exactly and is supposed to make you feel good. For example, Aries love vibrant colours like red and Virgos prefer a home in delicate pastel colours. Would you like to know whether you've chosen the right colour for your apartment? Ourinterior designershave put together the most important living tips for every star sign and room—even the children's room.

Cancer and Aquarius are compatible, or Cancer and Sagittarius are compatible? We want to investigate these and other questions about the topic of zodiac signs and furnishings. The perfect and suitable furnishings for you also depend on your zodiac sign. If you follow a few rules and tips, you can create a more harmonious and balanced living experience. We'll show you how to do it with a few simple tips and tricks! You'll find out which colour suits your zodiac sign best and what else you should consider. What are the perfect zodiac sign colours? Which Libra colours should you choose, or does Libra suit which furnishing style? Start reading now and design your home in your zodiac sign colours. We're excited to see what you'll change!

The Aquarius zodiac sign is known for its sociability and great inventiveness. To feel comfortable, Aquarians need open spaces and a decor that doesn't follow any rules. You often see an exciting mix of styles and colours in their homes. In addition to turquoise, they like the colours orange, violet and blue the most.
Irrespective of what your zodiac sign might be, you should read this idea book that talks about5 mistakes you should avoid in your home.

Pisces love colours that remind them of their element, water. A cool blue has a calming effect on us and conveys a feeling of relaxation. It looks particularly nice when you add additional accent colours such as white and yellow to create a friendly and bright ambience.

Passion and fire: Aries automatically feel at home with the colour red. It also stands for courage, self-confidence and an optimistic attitude to life. If you want to use intense colour as the main tone for yourrooms,it is best to combine it with more subtle tones such as white or beige.

The Taurus zodiac sign feels at home in nature and therefore feels most comfortable in its own four walls with fresh colours. Green in particular, a symbol of healing, comfort and calm, brings harmony into the home. This colour can be combined excellently with cosy wooden furniture, which also reflects the love of nature.

They are sociable and feel particularly comfortable in a cosy gathering with friends or family: Geminis need bright and positive colours and an airy, open living environment. One of their favourite colours is bright yellow, which works particularly well in combination with modern, understated furniture.

The Cancer zodiac sign is said to stand for purity and those born under this sign are said to be particularly loyal and sensitive. It is no wonder that this zodiac sign prefers the colour white in its rooms. It offers protection and at the same time helps to recharge your batteries. To bring some colour into your own four walls, you can add individual accent colours such as green, blue or beige.

The king of the animal kingdom likes lavish decor and striking colours. One of his favourite colours is bright orange, which is said to stimulate the spirit and symbolize strength. This colour can be used to create eclectic interiors that play with different colours and patterns. If you prefer something more subdued, you can also combine orange with earthy colours such as brown or beige.

Experts say that Virgos have a preference for order and cleanliness. This is why delicate pastel colours fit perfectly in their apartments and houses. All pastel shades also contain a portion of the colour white, the symbol of purity. These colours are perfect for a cosy Scandi chic that combines white and pastel shades with wooden furniture.
Also, read9 Tips to Protect Your Wooden House from Termite Attacks.

The perfect interior for anyone born under the sign of Libra is a combination of balance and simplicity. A harmonious atmosphere is created by the colour pink, which can be combined with white and light earth colours such as brown or beige.
This zodiac sign loves mysterious surroundings and intense colors such as dark red, which reflects the passionate personality of Scorpio. The colour is best combined with black or brown.

Sagittarius, who is naturally restless, needs colours that bring harmony and relaxation into their own four walls. Dark purple is particularly suitable for this and can be combined with violet, blue or even white.

The Capricorn zodiac sign prefers to live with classic and understated colours such as grey or brown. These create timelessly elegant rooms that represent stability and independence. A mix of modern furniture and rustic wooden elements, as in our example, is a wonderful way to bring these colours into harmony.

title: 11 Comfortable Dining Room Chairs that you’ll Love in your Home
author: LEENA JHA HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: When it comes to dining room design, many thoughts go on tableware, mats, silverware, lighting, tables, and definitely chairs. The dining table chairs are more than just a chair to sit and eat. It’s the piece of furniture that surrounds the table, completing its style. However, while selecting the chairs, you have to keep in mind the comfort. Many endless hours are spent sitting on the chairs, enjoying foods, drinks, and chatting with family and friends. Check out these dining room chairs design carefully designed by our professionaldesignerskeeping in mind the comfort and style that you’ll love in your home.
The robust metal frame with the cushion on the seat and back is a perfect combination to make it a comfortable chair. The soothing blue color enhances the aesthetics of thedining room.
The steel frame's steely strength comes with fluid flexibility and cushioned chairs to be comfortable even when just 'chilling' and using the round table for cards game with family and friends.
The wicker's natural elegance weaved in the metal frame creates a comfortable and warm setting complementing the elegant woodendining table.
The classiness of wood in the base and fiber strength on the seat blends to build up a perfect comfort for the dining table chairs.
The dining table's revolving chairs are a novel way to merge comfort with style in the dining room. The sturdy base is strong enough to support every move you make while sitting on the chair.
The semi-circular full covered cushioned backrests of the chairs provide some extra comfort. The color mauve and the chairs' luxurious style look chic and elegant, along with the comfort it brings.
Explore the comfort of leather in your dining table chairs and if you find its cozy comfort appealing, then try it various texture and color to add to the aesthetics of the dining room.
Soothing to eyes and comfortable to sit with cushioned seat and backrest, these dining table chairs contribute immensely to bring in the luxurious style into thedining room décor.

The high back chairs are quite comfortable for the back as well as neck. If your dining table serves more purpose than just a place to eat, go for the high back chairs that are also high on style and comfort.
Stylishness with a bonus of comfort, these broad base faux leather chairs are sturdy, comfortable, and elegant in the dining room.
The curvy backrest in the dining table chair supports the back comfortably while the dinners continue their long hours after-dinner chat sessions right on the dining table.
Check this out for table-top ideas for your dining table:Table Top Ideas For The Dining Room

title: Rustic elements that can be included in home décor
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: Adding rustic elements into the home gives it a wholesome and welcoming look and guests don't feel conscious about sitting or relaxing anywhere in the house. Rustic décor style is the current trend to bring out the beauty of colors, natural fabrics, traditional weaves and handmade designs that make one feel comfortable and absolutely at home. The core of rustic design is to celebrate everything natural and authentic while making the best of elements available locally. This could be anything from wooden beams on ceiling, open fireplace, handwoven hearth rugs to embroidered cushions, hand-painted flower pots, DIY furniture pieces and many more. Here are some interesting details that you can add to get the rustic style right in yourhouse.

A rustic style home is incomplete without a fireplace surrounded by large stones or bricks and other natural details. Here is a magical fireplace that is rustic in every aspect but looks perfect in harmony with the marble inlay work and beautifully carved wooden staircase.
