Natural elements like wood and stone are the easiest ways to bring in rustic flavor to a home. Wooden beams around the ceiling or on thestaircasebalustrade along with wooden stairs create an air of warmth and elegance in a modern home.

Rustic design style favors masculine decor details so feminine pieces are bound to be left out in the house. Large decor pieces designed out of natural materials like wood, stone or natural fabrics that complement the colors and overall decor style will be more suitable. Items that give every room in the house a unique presence would be ideal.

The foundation of rustic style is based on natural fabrics that are high on texture and feel like wool, cotton and linen that are unprinted or handwoven. Furnishings likecurtains, blinds,bed linen, floor rugs and side table add to the rustic flavor of this beautiful bedroom.

Animal skins and heads are also a great addition to rustic setting as they were used in rustic hunter log cabins and holiday homes. But in current sceario of environmental degradation its only wise that we use faux zebra skin mats, sheepskin throws and rugs made of cowhide for the rustic feel.

Baskets, bags or boxes made of natural materials like burlap, reed, bamboo, wood etc are ideal to hide off miscellaneous items under the table or in the pantry in a neat manner. Some of these handicraft pieces are so attractive that they can be used as containers for keeping remote controls in the living room or essential stationery on the study table or simply stack cutlery on the dining table.

If stone or wood walls are not something you are very keen about then there is another alternative that can be used to get the rustic look right which is neutral or white walls. They provide a great background to fit the furniture of your choice to get the right rustic environment inside the house. White walls are an essential part of rustic style so use that to get the ideal setting.
If you like to mix styles together here areideas to combine rustic and modern styles in your home.

title: 6 Ingenious Decoration Ideas For The Stairs
author: Cornelia Wilhelm
article_paragraphs: The staircase is often the first thing you or your visitors see when you enter the apartment. It is therefore all the more important that this area in particular scores points in terms of appearance. But what means and ways are available to you in terms of the right design and decoration when it comes to getting the most out of your stairs? As always, it is about both beautifying this area and ensuring that functional and safety aspects are not neglected. Whichdecorative and furnishingaccessories you choose depends essentially on your taste, but also on the individual conditions in your hallway area. For example, if the hallway is relatively small, you should always place greater emphasis on using light sources to make the room appear a little larger. With large staircases, on the other hand, you have even more options at your disposal. Let yourself be inspired.

Even oldstairshave charm and can be skillfully spruced up with a few loving details and cool staircase decorations. It doesn't always have to be a complete renovation of the stairs. In this article, we would like to show you a few great ideas with which you can beautify your old stairs in no time at all and thus create a much more attractive staircase—or wherever your stairs are in the house. Can you also beautify an ugly staircase? Of course, that's possible! Today we're giving you great tips on the topics of stair harps, cladding staircases, decorating stair banisters and decoration ideas for hallways and stairs in general.
If you want a new staircase, you will find inspiration in this idea book:Decorative Stairs, 12 Stunning  Designs to Wow Guests.

Do wallpapers only belong in the living and sleeping areas? Far from it! There is nothing wrong with beautifying your stairs with oversized posters. It is very important to make sure that the size of the stairs is right! Stairwells or hallways that are too small can quickly appear overloaded when printed wallpaper is used. However, if you manage to integrate the entire staircase into the living space with the help of the wallpaper, you have done everything right. This type of decoration helps you to ideally blur the boundaries between the hallway and the living area and offers you a homely, modern ambience. Due to the large selection of wallpapers available to you, the choice is often difficult.

If you want to beautify your stairs, you can reach into the proverbial paint pot and let your imagination run wild. It is important, however, that the colours you choose match the general style of the apartment or house. Pastel colours mixed with classic white are particularly trendy here. Most of the tones can be combined excellently with one another and thus create a harmonious image. An attractive colour mix is therefore no longer just popular in children's rooms. As long as the size of the stairs, the incidence of light and the surroundings are suitable, there are no limits to your passion for colour. If you are still unsure about the final choice of shades, it is best to use small colour sample plates from your painter and try things out to your heart's content!

Many people underestimate the potential that a visually appealing stair railing offers them. The largely transparent models in particular are enjoying unbroken popularity these days. Glass stair railings and hallways in which a simple rope acts as a railing find numerous buyers. However, caution is advised when using rope as a stair railing. Especially if there are children in the household, they represent a source of danger that should not be underestimated. Regardless of whether it is made of glass or rope: transparency has arrived in the hallway and staircase area. Anyone who wants to beautify their hallway will find an attractive alternative to the standard model here.

Lights on the stairs not only look good but they are also useful. After all, not everyone who comes home from a party late at night wants to be greeted by bright hallway lighting. Instead, opt for small lights that can be attached to each step, or every second or third step if you like, and will show you the way up safely. Depending on the material of the stairs, it can be useful to use slightly dimmer light to create a warm, cosy look. Read here how you can make perfect use of the space under the stairs!

Do you find your staircase too boring? It's high time to beautify your stairs. Have you ever thought about using motifs in this context? These look great not only in the living and sleeping areas but also near the stairs. Especially if you find it a little difficult to paint walls, motifs on fabric, for example in conjunction with a type of curtain, are a suitable alternative. You can use these not only as room decoration but also as a room divider. Find out what other tips there are for setting the perfect scene in your hallway here!

A stair bannister doesn't always have to be made of just one colour. For years now, more and more people have been mixing different colours to create little eye-catchers. How bold you are in this context, or how bright the colour nuances should ultimately be, is of course up to you. Simple and natural brown tones in particular are becoming increasingly popular, especially in connection with rustic or rural furnishings. The warm earth colours have the positive side effect that they usually blend in well with the rest of the furnishings and thus quickly create a harmonious image. In connection with an otherwise completely white hallway and otherwise modern furnishings, you can be a little bolder. Striking colour mixes are already standard for many people. You can find even more ideas on how to decorate a small living roomhere!

title: Wooden Ceilings: 10 Ideas To Fall In Love With
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: Do you think wooden ceilings are old-fashioned, outdated and dusty? Then it's high time for a new perspective. Wooden ceilings are currently celebrating a brilliant comeback and are taking the hearts ofinterior and designfans by storm. No wonder: wood on the ceiling conveys a cosy, warm and natural atmosphere, contributes to a healthy and pleasant room climate and can also be designed and staged in a variety of ways. From rustic and romantic to puristic and stylish—today we have brought you ten exciting ideas that show how well wooden ceilings look in today's houses.

We have already presented you with a few unbeatable arguments for wooden ceilings. In addition to health-promoting and climate-friendly reasons, from anarchitecturalperspective, wood's design diversity speaks in favour of using this raw material. You can use different wood forfloors,walls, ceilings and furniture to make both your indoor and outdoor spaces comfortable. A true all-rounder! For this reason, it's worth taking a look at our idea book and getting an idea of some of the options for your wooden ceiling. Whether your wooden ceiling can decorate the bathroom, bedroom, living room or kitchen is up to your taste. A great option, for example, is to design wooden ceilings in a modern white colour. A wood-panelled ceiling is also an option that you will like!
A woodenceilingis one of many great tricks on how you can make your living room cosy.

Wooden beams aren't just for country-style farmhouses. Quite the opposite: These days they cover every conceivable furnishing trend and adapt to cosy chalets as well as modern minimalism; they can be found in Scandinavian houses as well as in Japanese, tropical or Mediterranean ones.

This photo proves that wood in a complete look is anything but stuffy and old-fashioned. If you choose a light type of wood and hold back on the design language and furnishings, you will create a cosy, natural and wonderfully relaxed ambience with a Scandinavian flair that exudes modern style and invites you to linger.

Wooden ceilings are particularly effective in high rooms that have been opened up to the gable and have large windows. In converted lofts, stables, barns and farmhouses, the ceiling beams provide much of the rustic charm.

A particularly popular interpretation at the moment is white-painted wooden ceilings, which are particularly suitable for low rooms as they visually add depth and size and optimally reflectnatural light.

For a long time, there was a stubborn belief that wood in the bathroom was not a good idea. Puppy cake! Especially in the bathroom, the natural material provides warmth and cosiness—both on the ceiling and on the floor. However, you should choose the right type of wood, avoid standing moisture and leave the laying to aprofessional.

A wooden ceiling can spice up anyliving roomand add a special touch to any furnishing style. If you want to make the wooden beams the focus, choose simple furniture, reduce colours and avoid unnecessary frills.

Wooden ceilings are also ideal for covered terraces, as this example impressively proves. The great thing about the natural material is that depending on whether you lay it vertically, diagonally or horizontally, you can play with vanishing points, create structure and bring exciting perspectives into play.

Here we see that fans of puristic, stylish interiors with wooden ceilings can also get their money's worth. Here, the architect chose not to use rustic beams and instead highlighted the unusual silhouette of the attic apartment with white-painted wooden cladding. It couldn't be more modern.
Wood plays the main role in log cabins and that is precisely why rustic houses are becoming increasingly popular in this country. Solid beams provide a cosy, homely touch and a very special charm.

Finally, we will summarize all the advantages that a wooden ceiling brings with it: It scores with an excellent ecological balance, creates a healthy living climate, can be designed in a variety of ways, is easy to install and also has a positive effect on room acoustics. Convinced?

title: The ultimate tips against annoying mosquitoes
author: Sabrina Werner
article_paragraphs: The assumption is that you can quickly turn off the light in the evening and you will be protected from the annoying mosquitoes. Unfortunately, anyone who believes in this will quickly find themselves struggling with annoying stitches. There is a whole range of tips that help against mosquitoes and their unpleasant bites. Closing the window is more helpful than turning off the light. In addition, mosquito nets and the power of plants are excellent ways to combat the little pests. But which tips against mosquitoes are among the myths and which ones actually repel mosquitoes and keep them away for as long as possible? Thanks to ourexperts,we clarify!

Every summer we have the same problem with mosquitoes. Who doesn't know it: you sit comfortably on the terrace and get stung? If the pests don't strike outside, you usually fall victim to mosquitoes in the bedroom. Even if you supposedly did “everything right”. After all, the typical tips and tricks on how to keep mosquitoes away are well-known, right? Today we'll get to the bottom of the most common advice: Do mosquitoes like light? How long do mosquitoes live? Mosquito in the room, what to do? Can you catch mosquitoes? It's best to read our exciting article right away and defy the mosquitoes this year. You can outsmart them with simple tricks.
Since we're going to be talking a lot about curtains, here's a hint for an idea book with lots of inspiration aboutcurtains.

An old misconception goes that mosquitoes are magically attracted to light. All you have to do in the evening is turn off the light and be safe from mosquito bites. Unfortunately, this is not correct. The reason why mosquitoes tend to come into the apartment in the evening is because they are active at night. During the day, mosquitoes hide where it is nice, cool and humid. In the evening, when the sun no longer shines from the sky, they come out. When the window is wide open, they are magically attracted not by the light, but by the smell of people. Mosquitoes can sense the carbon dioxide that people breathe out and are almost “clouded” by it. If the window is open, they are attracted by it and find their victim with “sensory certainty”. The person who has sweet blood is not more attractive to mosquitoes, as is often assumed. A person who has a higher body temperature and has sweated more is more attractive to mosquitoes and is more likely to be bitten by them.

It's too hot to close the windows in the evening? Then you can close the curtains and open the windows. The curtains then act like a protective wall against the mosquitoes. This is also a pleasant option if you want to use the cool evening air to ventilate. However, the distance between the curtain and the window should not be too large so as not to leave any gaps and not allow mosquitoes to get in. In addition, the curtains should not be coarse-meshed. The closer the texture of the curtain is to that of a mosquito net, the less chance mosquitoes have of getting through gaps in the fabric. An alternative is mosquito screens that can be attached to the windows. They can be easily attached with adhesive and prevent mosquitoes from coming in through the window. They are preferably attached to windows that can be opened but are otherwise of little use.

Mosquito nets, especially around the bed, immerse the bedroom in the ambience of “A Thousand and One Nights”. The wind moves the net and makes it rustle quietly while you can lie down in bed undisturbed. To ensure that mosquito nets not only look beautiful but also serve their purpose, you should pay attention to a few things. The tighter the mesh of the mosquito nets, the more effective they are. Mosquito nets that stretch for decoration alone and have meshes that are too large allow mosquitoes to get through, even if they are more comfortable to sleep on because they allow more air to pass through. Mosquito nets should also be checked regularly for holes. The thin material tears too quickly and is then no longer functional. The mosquito net must be secured around the bed so that it cannot be touched at night. Otherwise, mosquitoes can bite through at points of contact with the net. The net must also be pinned under the mattress or the bed so that there are no openings for mosquitoes to get through.

It's no secret that essential oils protect against mosquitoes. Many manufacturers of mosquito repellents, which do not use chemicals, use this fact to their advantage. While conventional mosquito repellents and their components often fall into disrepute, the essential oils of plants help against mosquitoes without causing any harm as long as you are not allergic to the substances. However, essential oils do not belong in children's rooms because children can also react allergically to them. The most effective plants against mosquitoes include lemon eucalyptus, rosemary, lemongrass, citronella, cloves, cinnamon, but also peppermint and fragrant geranium.
If that doesn't help, sprays against bacteria to disinfect rooms and surfaces are a good choice.

As already described, turning off the lights does not help against mosquitoes. Even dimming the lights doesn't stop mosquitoes from being attracted to the smell of humans. The opposite is the case. Since mosquitoes are active at night, light that is similar to daylight confuses them. So if you want to stay in the apartment with the window open and the lights on, you should light the room as brightly as possible. The more the light resembles daylight, the less likely you are to be bitten by mosquitoes. In thekitchen,for example, general lighting is often ideal for scaring away mosquitoes.

Tip: To protect yourself from mosquitoes even after turning off the light, you should check the room for mosquitoes again before going to bed. Once the lights are out, it's easy to track them down. They soon attract attention with their typical humming noise. You don't have to search the room. You can simply stand in the room and wait for the mosquitoes to find you.

The temperature in the room can be reduced with a fan, be it a permanently installed ceiling fan, a small table fan, or an air conditioning system. The little pests become extremely lazy, avoid the cooler temperatures and, with a little luck, don't even come into the room. A fan has another advantage: it creates wind and mosquitoes don't like to fly against it. However, it must also be set strong enough for this to happen.

title: The Best Upright Vacuum Cleaners: Complete Buying Guide
author: Mara Silverio—homify
article_paragraphs: When searching for the ideal upright vacuum cleaner, it is essential to consider several criteria, ranging from suction power to versatility and practicality of use. With the diversity of options on the market, finding the most suitable equipment can seem like a challenging task. In this guide, we'll look at the best upright vacuums available, highlighting their distinct features and helping you make an informed choice.

When selecting an upright vacuum cleaner, suction power and efficiency are key criteria to consider. Models with powerful engines and state-of-the-art technology guarantee effective cleaning on a variety of surfaces, from carpets to hard floors. The best upright vacuum cleaners can eliminate dust, pet hair and embedded dirt in any part of yourhousewith ease, providing impeccable results with each pass.

Designand manoeuvrability also play a crucial role in choosing the ideal upright vacuum cleaner. Lightweight and ergonomically designed equipment makes it easy to use, allowing you to reach difficult-to-reach areas and get around furniture with ease. Additionally, models with advanced steering systems provide a smooth and effortless cleaning experience.

The best upright vacuums come equipped with a variety of features and accessories designed to make cleaning more efficient and convenient. From motorized brushes for removing pet hair to HEPA filters for air purification, these additional features ensure a complete cleaning experience. Furthermore, the presence of specific accessories for different types of surfaces allows the vacuum cleaner to be adapted to the individual needs of each environment.

Technology and innovation are distinctive elements of the best upright vacuum cleaners on the market. Models with smart sensors and advanced mapping systems deliver precise, personalized cleaning, automatically adjusting suction power and motion path as needed. Plus, integration with voice assistants and mobile apps lets you control the vacuum remotely, providing a truly modern and convenient cleaning experience.

Durability and reliability are essential features to consider when investing in an upright vacuum cleaner. Choosing brands recognized for their quality and reputation in the market guarantees the longevity of the equipment and its long-term effectiveness. Plus, models with comprehensive warranties and solid customer service provide consumers with additional peace of mind.
Learn it!

Finally, price and value are determining elements when choosing the ideal upright vacuum cleaner. Although it is tempting to opt for the most economical equipment, it is important to consider the relationship between price and quality. The best upright vacuums offer excellent value for money, combining superior performance, durability and advanced features at an affordable price.
Also readsystematic house cleaning: Complete cleaning in three hours.

title: 10 Modern Ideas To Place The Television In The Living Room
author: Cristina Jiménez
article_paragraphs: In this idea book, we will look at 10 ideas for placing the television in a modern living room. Although the shape of televisions and the way we watch them have changed a lot since the arrival of this device into our lives, in many homes we see that the placement of “the TV” in the living room has barely changed. Television, nowadays, is increasingly used to watch movies or television series,streaming, and often connected to other devices.
How does this translate to our living room? Well let's look at some ideas:

The presence of new devices, such as smartphones, tablets and other digital tools, has changed the relationship we have with all of them. In addition to functionality, the aesthetics of these devices have also changed enormously, now being much less bulky, lighter and much more decorative. Nowadays, therefore, it is possible to place a free-standing, suspended TV, as we see in the image. In this way, you will be able to concentrate all your electronic devices in one place, thanks to the living rooms with hanging television.

Precisely because of the lightness that television sets currently have, we can also choose to place them hanging on the wall. In this project, they adopt that solution, creating a modern composition for theliving room.The TV is understood here as another decorative element, combined with a series of shelves and modules, with a minimalist design. Subtle notes of colour provide freshness in a white-dominated configuration.

In this interesting project, we opt for the modern idea of inserting the television in the middle of the living room, through a free-standing element, which it appropriates. We could almost talk about a wall dedicated to the TV, in which the giant screen is located in the centre, becoming the true focal point of the living room. This solution is ideal for dividing rooms when we have a generously sized room.

In this project, the television is placed in a very discreet way. So that the TV goes unnoticed, theexpertshave chosen to paint a strip of the wall behind the television black, in continuity with the side wall. Thus, the black television screen merges with the wall, also black. The final trick is to take advantage of the strong contrast with the rest of the white wall, enriching it with the presence of paintings, posters and framed photos.

In this project, we found a modern and functional solution to insert television into the living room: playing with modular shelves to create the necessary space and achieve a composition full of harmony. This idea is very simple, but also very effective. Alternating modules, arranging them along the entire wall, up to the ceiling, is a solution that never goes out of style and is available to everyone.

A large-screen television has enough prominence to try to prevent it from competing with many decorative elements on the wall it occupies. Today's televisions become the central element of the living room wall. Therefore, choosing a low cabinet on two levels, like the one in the image, is a perfect resource for placing the television and not overloading the decoration of the living room.

The custom design of a wooden wall, with shelves and doors that house objects and books that we want to have in the living room, is another perfect solution for placing the television. To do this, we must be clear about the TV that we are going to place to design the furniture with the exact space that is needed, the niche in which the television is inserted. In this way, we will be guaranteed to achieve a balanced composition.

A niche in the wall covered in natural wood is another of the ideas we found for placing a television screen in a modern living room. In this way, there is a definitive commitment to give prominence to the TV area, playing with the material contrast between the wood in the background, the white paint on the outside of the wall and the television screen itself. Thus, the technological element seems to find its natural space.

In this project we found another idea to place the television in the living room: giving up any other furniture element. The choice here is to place the television directly on the floor, with absolute simplicity. The television is placed on the edge of the rug and centred in front of a modern, low sofa, also in black like the TV itself. The intended careless image of the living room is functional.

A living room piece of furniture, known as a console, fits perfectly into any modern living room and is very functional. In this case, a deep white console is chosen, with blind doors, where a lamp and some other decorative objects are placed. To free up the entire surface, the television is placed hanging directly on the living room wall, centred with the console. Of course, in these cases, it is essential to hide all the wiring…Voila!

Nowadays, we have a multitude of stimuli and entertainment that sometimes prevent us from communicating with those closest to us: family, friends, co-workers… Therefore, sometimes it is necessary to disconnect and leave all technology aside for a few hours. This is what has been done in this room: it has been conceived as a space for conversation, where the complement is the TV cabinet and the device in question, and not the other way around. It is very necessary to create rooms in this way to encourage communication between us. Test it!

Following the idea of the previous example, of trying to ensure that the television does not take away all the prominence of the space and the conversation, a TV cabinet is created where it can be covered when not needed and kept hidden. Especially if you have other elements that you want to stand out more, such as living rooms with fireplaces, this is an ideal option for you. You can find this type of furniture made or custom-made especially for your living room and your television. Don't hesitate to see the options on the market because it is a fantastic idea for your living room.
Recommend:7 Easy Living Room Decoration On A Budget

title: 8 things that sayit's bad luck to have at home
author: I. Gaspar—homify
article_paragraphs: Some people are superstitious, others not so much. What kind of person are you? Do you care about these things?
The truth is that we spend a lifetime listening to certain things and they end up becomingingrained in our heads, assuming them even on a day-to-day basis.

If you want to start the year more positively and avoid everything that could attract bad luck, take a look at this book of ideas. We've put together 8 things that are bad luck at home and that you need to change now, if you have that in your life.
According to superstitions, breaking a mirror is bad luck. Maybe the bad luck of having it broken and having to spend more money on buying a new one.
If the mirror is broken, you should throw it away to avoid attracting bad luck. The same goes for glasses, don't keep them, because you could cut yourself when drinking from them.
Fun fact: The superstition of 7 years of bad luck, when a mirror is broken, dates back to ancient Greece!

We should not keep old objects and clothes, because these can impede change and make progress difficult. Take a few hours off the weekend to do a general cleaning of your closets and donate or throw away what you no longer want and use. You will see that you will feel a breath of fresh air in your home.

Storing a tattered broom will not clean thespaceproperly and everything will remain in the same state. According to superstitions, keeping an old broom can lead to money problems. So, don't start the year off badly, change your broom, it costs so little money to risk it.
Uninspiring, unpleasant images of natural or global disasters, rain or snow storms or other images that do not trigger positive emotions should not be inside your home.
Everything that causes negativity must be outside the home and out of your life. It's easy, isn't it?
Do you have a slow clock at home? Now try to fix it, if it doesn't work because it's broken, get rid of it!
We want to move forward in life and not stagnate, so do everything on time to have good luck in your life!

The superstition of stairs is quite famous and dates back 5,000 years to ancient Egypt. According to this culture, a staircase to a wall forms a triangle, and the Egyptians considered this shape sacred (pyramids). The triangles represent the trinity of the Seuses and to pass through a triangle was to desecrate them.

This belief gained strength over time, and “centuries later, the followers of Jesus Christ usurped the superstition, interpreting it in light of Christ's death”, explained Panati. “As a ladder rested against the crucifix, it became a symbol of evil, death and betrayal. Walking under a ladder brought misfortune.”
For example, in the United Kingdom in the 16th century, criminals had to walk under a ladder to the gallows, their place of death.
Black cats are living beings that only have the colour black. They are beautiful, sweet and cuddly cats like the others.

Interestingly, the ancient Egyptians considered black cats to be good luck. Just like King Charles I of England, who had a black cat as a pet. The king's bad luck arrived the moment the cat died and, the next day, the king was arrested and accused of high treason.

On the other hand, in the Middle Ages, in other parts of Europe, there were other people with a contrary belief. They considered that the black cats were the witches' relatives or the witches themselves in disguise, and the Devil was looking at them!
And this is how history influences times and mentalities.
The frog-shaped symbols have several interpretations and meanings. In the past, the frog was associated with magic and witchcraft. So get them out of your house!
If you liked this article, you will also enjoy reading about Feng Shui, all in the search for a more positive life. Findprofessionalsand articles on our page.

There are several superstitions and the broken mirror is perhaps the best known. If you are curious, you can research more about the meaning of lucky buddhas. One more thing is certain, we all want to have good energy in our home, especially in our bedroom at bedtime. Read this article to find out what things you should have at home to attract luck and good energy.
You can also read this similar article10 simple tips that attract good luck and positive energy.

title: You shouldn't have these 5 bad luck charms at home
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: Horseshoes over the door, dream catchers in the bedroom, bread and salt for moving in—all these things are supposed to bring us happiness at home and positively influence our well-being within our own four walls. On the other hand, there are also unlucky charms and objects that—at least according toFeng Shuirules—should not be kept in the house. We'll show you what these are in this article.

Do you want to bring good energy into your house or apartment? Then you should follow a few rules according to Feng Shui. We would like to give you a few tips, and you can then receive comprehensive advice from a Feng Shui expert of your choice.

Happiness is a cactus? Is a mirror good in thebedroom?What are typical bringers of bad luck and what brings bad luck? Today we are giving you a little insight into the world ofinterior designwith Feng Shui. It's best to take a look around right away and find out, among other things, whether Feng Shui recommends mirrors in the bedroom or not.

According to Feng Shui, it's not just broken mirrors that bring bad luck. Even completely intact mirror surfaces can supposedly harm our happiness and well-being if they are hung in the wrong place. Because they reflect used energy, we don't get restful sleep if we place a mirror in the bedroom, for example. This should also be avoided in front of the entrance door, otherwise the Chi will not feel welcome in the house and will immediately be sent out again.

Black front doors can look very stylish and elegant, but they are still viewed very sceptically in Feng Shui teachings. It says that black doors attract bad luck. The only exception: If the front door faces north, this undesirable effect is eliminated. Alternatives for anyone who wants to avoid black doors: dark grey and anthracite look just as elegant.

Cacti and succulents are currently very popular in interior design—but not among Feng Shui experts. For them, prickly plants radiate negative energy, cause tension and aggressiveness and should therefore not be used in the house if possible. However, they look good on the balcony or in the garden, where they can protect us from evil spirits.

According to Feng Shui, old calendars or those that do not show the current date are also bad luck. Why? Quite simply: a calendar like this keeps us stuck in the past and therefore negatively impacts our lives.

Admittedly, rocking chairs can certainly give you goosebumps in certain horror movie scenes, but do they bring bad luck if you have them at home? According to Feng Shui teachings, they attract dark, magical forces and evil spirits. However, you can easily prevent this undesirable effect by never leaving the chair empty, but by using decorative cushions or other objects to make it difficult for evil spirits to take a seat.

title: 15 ingenious stairs that take up little space
author: Sabrina Werner
article_paragraphs: There are things that you cannot do without in a small house or apartment, especially if it is a house with two floors. The staircase is such a vital element that you cannot remove it, no matter how much you might want to.

In this idea book, we have put together 15 types of stairs that take up little space and are as functional as they are visually appealing. Also, take a look at18 excellent designs for interior stairs in small houses.

This first example not only installs astaircasein a small space but also shows how this small space can be used for several things at once: a vertical garden and a beautiful bookshelf. The staircase itself has a simple but contemporary design and has been finished in white, so it contrasts beautifully with the green garden in the background.

Spiral staircases are the perfect stairs for the second floor when space is limited—like in this case. They have a design that brings movement and never goes out of style. They are also available in many designs and different materials and can therefore be easily adapted to your style and taste.

Stairs that take up little space do not have to rise to the upper floor in one piece. Because there is no railing, this staircase creates an impression of airiness in the lower section and makes the room appear as a unit—a great solution if there is little space in the stairwell. The second section, on the other hand, was provided with a black stair railing and thus contributes to safety in the house. This is especially recommended if there are children in the house or apartment.
These stairs leave you speechless! It is constructed with steps that hang in the air and offer an exciting, industrial design.

This natural wood staircase has adapted perfectly to the space available to it and follows the twists and turns of the room with elegant curves. To preserve the room in its entirety, the stair railing was attached to the outermost wall and coloured to match the wooden steps. If you want such a completely individual staircase, you can seek advice from aninterior designer.

Sometimes not only stairs for the second floor are necessary when space is limited, but also stairs that lead to the attic or a storage room. In such a case, a foldable staircase is an ingenious solution. It saves a lot of space and you can simply fold it out when you need it, which is usually not the case every day anyway.

You don't always need large, wide steps that take up a lot of space. If you use a narrow staircase with steps that are only half a metre wide, you can get a functional staircase in a small space and can save a lot of space.

This staircase is probably the simplest in the entire idea book. If you are looking for an alternative that allows you to get to the second floor but are still looking for a discreet staircase, this classic staircase with simple lines and shapes is the right choice.
This incredibly small staircase is perfect for homes that have an attic or false ceiling. It takes up hardly any space and yet fits into any room with its industrial design.

The stairs can also be designed as part of the hallway, as in this example. Every little corner was exploited here. For example, a small table with a lamp was placed under the stairs, which has a decorative effect and contributes to the lighting design in the room.

No doubt – this staircase is one of the absolute favourites on the list. With its mix of black steel and light wood, it offers a fantastic design and at the same time fulfils an incredible number of functions. It is a staircase, bookshelf, desk, table, cupboard with drawers and storage space all in one. Who would have thought that you could do so much more with a staircase than just climb up and down?

This staircase looks like it is connected to the wall. It adapts perfectly to every corner and every turn of the wall. The spots in the wall ensure optimal visibility and contribute to safety if there is no railing.

There never seems to be enough space in the house for children to play. This staircase has therefore turned into a great place for the children. If you ask the little ones, this staircase with a built-in shop is guaranteed to be their absolute favourite.

The space created under this staircase also opens up many possibilities. A wooden cupboard was installed here, which on the one hand has a decorative effect, but on the other hand, can also solve many storage space problems in a small apartment.
This staircase is hidden behind a false wall—an original and fun idea to integrate a staircase into the room. This staircase is also perfect for rooms with high ceilings.

Now you've gotten to know our great 15 tips for stairs in small houses and you're sure to have a favourite that would look great in your house or multi-story apartment. An interior designer can help you decide and plan your small staircase so that it ultimately looks beautiful. No matter whether you choose a room staircase, a steep staircase or round stairs, each has its charm. Using a spiral staircase inside can also be a space-saving solution.

One point that particularly impressed us was using the small staircase as storage space. For this reason, we will finally show you an example of how you can store numerous things such as shoes, clothing, bed linen, towels or much more conveniently and easily accessible under a staircase. By the way, your little trick with these stairs only becomes apparent when you look closely.

title: Amazing Bathroom Trends to Follow Up this 2020
author: Rita Kumar
article_paragraphs: This 2020 is definitely a well-planned year for all your resolutions, routines, and of course, a mind-blowing home makeover! Whether it is a kitchen or a bedroom or even that chatting corner of your living room, every bit of the space needs its noteworthy makeover!
So today at Homify, we're going to give a quick guide to a trendsettingbathroommakeover to follow up this 2020.
Continue reading to find out more on how to set a trend in your bathroom space!

Glass is one of the most efficient materials that can be seamlessly utilized in your bathroom. Apart from ceramic ware and tile-toned effect, glass makes the way for an astounding finish and makeover. A compact division walled with glass towards that peaceful corner seamlessly paves the way for a fun-filled shower area. Yes, you heard it right! Go for a bright tint of a dominating shade throughout the different alignments and materialization of your bathroom space. Gone are the days when chandeliers were a vital part of your living room, especially to flaunt your decor during parties and get-togethers. A wise inclusion of rich bright lights towards the alignment of your washing area is a perfect idea to illuminate the entire bathroom space. title: Lavish Interior Design Concept at Ukay Bestari

Whether it is carpentry, furnishing, renovation, or interior architecture, El Precio does it all with their magnificent ideas.
Continue reading to grasp what this wonderful team has got in their new interior design concept!

To keep the look chic and clutter-free, the designers have chosen the minimal-decor effect. While every bit of materialization adds to the suaveness of this living room, that vintage-style ceiling fan with light is too gorgeous to ignore. A classic glass vase fused with artificial white flowers finish the look of this modern living room!

Now that we've covered the side view of this living room, let's get that feeling of standing in front of it while lost in its glorious looks! A face-to-face view of this masterpiece of a living room by El Precio once again proves noteworthy of being chic and modern. A gorgeous round mirror is erected with pride on the wall parallel to the TV section.

While a low-built wooden shelf attires the empty space with a classy touch, the fusion of indoor air purifying plants adds to the essence of the space. To add to the vintage looks fused in a modern concept, the designers have chosen to shade the space with a perfect blend of dim and bright lighting throughout the adjacent corners.
Voila! Now that's what you call a modern living room garnished with a classic touch!

Tossing that Burgundy glass filled with red wine wouldn't have been so much fun than now! Thanks to the interior designers at El Precio for coming up with such a marvellous dining room concept. The designers have carefully fused the dining space a bit farther from the living room, giving it a look of lavishness coated with everything classic. A broad dining table with a 6-seater facility makes the way for heavenly brunches and dinners! The fusion of glassware vase and cute condiment containers crown the space with a modish finish.

When it comes to adding to the looks of your home, never forget that cooking area of yours! That being said, El Precio architects have mastered their creativity in bringing out that gorgeouskitchenin this concept. With neatly aligned compartments for storage and baking, this kitchen flawlessly brings out the essence of having a clutter-free cooking space. While the pearl-white tinted cabinets make way for storing all the cooking essentials, a lavish cooking counter sits peacefully towards the corner. To finish the looks with a touch of classiness, the designers have been thoughtful of mounting a vintage-themed low-hung chandelier that overlooks everything steaming in the pot! Now that's what we call an awe-inspiring cooking paradise!

When you have the best interior designers by your side, you can always stay chin-up in getting the best looks for your house. And with El Precio, you can always look forward to a team that masters its creativity to the next level!

title: What is the most suitable material for kitchen countertops?
author: Elisabete Figueiredo—HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: Plan a kitchen! One of the important issues that you must decide before starting construction or renovation is the materials to be used for kitchen countertops and cabinets, and how this material will contribute to the space'sdecoration.The characteristics of the material you use, its colours and textures, will be closely related to your style and the quality of your decoration.

You can choose from dozens of different types of materials for your countertops and kitchen cabinets. Typically products made from various mixtures of materials such as stone, sand and marble are used for countertops, while products made from wood are used for cabinets.

Today Homify has brought together ideas and recommendations for you that will make selecting countertop materials easier. The information we present on the subject, accompanied by beautiful example images, can be very useful to you.

You have two options:—you can order special kitchen countertops for your space and style, or adapt prefabricated countertops, designed by kitchen designers, and install them, without compromising aesthetics. But whatever your choice, we advise you to carefully examine all possible samples and models before deciding which one is best for your kitchen. Do thorough research until you find the most suitable model so you don't have the regret of your life!
For this research, you can read thisarticleand also explore our entire website to find hundreds of examples of kitchen design from different countries and styles.
The biggest advantage of countertops made from natural stone is that they are very robust.
The marble and granite countertops, which are so popular, are in the natural stone group.

Granite countertops are made from a rock that insulates heat, is durable and comes in dozens of different colours. Although it has many colour options, it is always a mixed colour structure, not a solid colour product. It is very convenient for long-term and intensive use, but it may be necessary to polish it every year because the occurrence of small cracks in long-term use is likely.
Although marble has many advantages, it is a material that can create stains when in contact with acidic materials. For this reason, careful treatment is necessary.

Natural stone countertops can be a little more expensive than those made with other materials but they are always beautiful and classic, as well as very resistant, especially when combined with wooden cabinets, to create a solid image and construction.
The stone is perfectly compatible with the aesthetic line of countertop cabinets used in the kitchen composition in the image.
Corian countertops, a material composed of 2/3 natural minerals, 1/3 acrylic and pigments, fall into the group of hard surface countertops, also known as acrylic countertops.

Acrylic countertops are made from raw material products such as stone, sand and glass, bonded with acrylic. It is very popular because it is an artificial material, produced by machines, and can be easily moulded. The surface is smooth and resistant to scratches, as it is non-porous, which makes this a hygienic and very resistant product. It is often used in the healthcare sector and busybathrooms.
These countertops offer a wide variety of colours, with light and bright alternatives. Furthermore, the colours do not fade and maintenance is quite easy.
This design proposal draws attention to its aesthetics, as well as the quality of the materials used.

Dekton countertops are also in the group of countertops made with composite materials. Dekton is a hard but easy-to-work-with material, formed by compressing several different materials at high temperature and pressure.
Since this material is produced by compression, it can be very thin, while still offering great strength. For this reason, if your taste is for fine materials you should consider using Dekton.

This is also a material resistant to heat, scratches and abrasion, colourless and highly resistant to breakage. Due to its non-porous structure, it is also hygienic. The natural appearance is, however, less appealing than Corian, but it is more economical than natural stones, such as granite and marble.

In this example, the colour and model used in this design perfected the kitchen. A smooth white countertop like this one is perfect for completing a kitchen decorated in a Scandinavian, modern and minimalist style.

Quartz countertops are also included in the composite class, but they are not very economical, as they are composed of quartz stone. There are several brands, including Silestone, the name for which the material itself is known.
The colour range is less varied than that of other composite materials. It is usually sold in a solid colour, but can also be ordered with colour combinations and variations.

It is durable and resistant to scratches and impacts but can be negatively affected by highly acidic materials and chemicals, just like natural stone countertops. Therefore, it requires careful and demanding use but is easy to maintain and clean.

Before deciding on this material, you should evaluate your habits and behaviors, and request the opinion of an interior architect. Every day some innovations and features can be added to every material at your disposal, and learning about the latest innovations will help you make a better choice.

Kitchen counters built with solid wood can be the best choice for elegance and naturalness. The passion for decorating with wood, a result of our admiration for nature and our sincere trust in this ancient material, also manifests itself on our kitchen counters.

The use of solid wood in the kitchen countertop is the most striking feature of the rural style. These benches have the advantage of being robust, practical and natural, but their biggest advantage is that any design will benefit from their elegant appearance.
The solid material stands out for its timeless, textured and natural image. Even when it already has a worn and faded image, it still looks elegant and special!
Solid wood countertops are durable, robust, affordable, clean, natural, environmentally friendly and easy to maintain.

Firstly, it is important to emphasize that laminated counters should not be confused with other laminated materials, such as laminated wood. Laminated wood is a material made up of a few layers of thin wood, used in the production of parquet, but not in the production of countertops!

Countertops produced from real wood are known as solid wood countertops, while laminate material is a material that consists of a layer of vinyl lacquer, followed by a layer of paper or plastic material, which gives the appearance, and an HDF layer.

These benches have smooth surfaces and come in a huge range of colours and patterns. They can last a long time when used carefully, but they are not as durable as stone or composite materials. It's almost impossible to repair them when you leave a hot pan on them.
Stainless steel counters, a must-have for modern and industrial styles, blend well with almost all cabinet and floor materials.

These countertops have advantages over stone and wooden ones and have been especially popular in modern kitchen decorations in recent years. If we want to highlight, this material has only one disadvantage:—the damage is difficult to repair. But otherwise, you can use a stainless steel countertop for decades without any problems.
Together with stainless steel sinks, these countertops form a successful team, which can adapt to practically any modern or industrial design.
As you can see, you have countless options for kitchen sinks. It will depend on your taste but without forgetting all the care that each material requires, taking into account the intended use.

title: Break All Rules: 21 Images to Mix Patterns And Colours Like A Pro
author: Swati Mishra
article_paragraphs: When we have different moods at different times of the day, why do we need to stick to one pattern or colour theme throughout the house or maybe even a room? The cool thing about doing up your home yourself is the freedom to experiment with these verycolours and patterns.

That said, using different patterns and colours for your rooms can be quite intimidating and overwhelming because there's so much to choose from. However, there are a few basic rules and some insider hacks that will get you through the fundamentals of mixing patterns and colours like a pro. Then on, you can play with patterns and colour mixes into your spaces to bring out an edge, your own personal style and add character to a given space. There are manydesigners working beautifully with patternsas they use a variety of materials like the natural texture of wood, the geometry in tiles, textures in fabrics, all these in a wide variety of colours. Here are 21 inspiring images for you to learn the tricks of mixing patterns and colours like a professional and truly channel your vibe!

One of the rules while mixing colours and patterns is t have a neutral colour on the walls and floor running through the room on which you can go for bold coloured pieces and patterns. Such as this living room The yellow chairs and sofa stand out while the centre wall is a textured one providing a range of patterns and dimension to the entire room.

An easy trick is to have one big pattern or colour as the focus of your room and find other pieces that complement and add style to it. In this bedroom, the geometric tiles are the focal point and the orange sofa, the yellow and white cushions and the throw all come together to create a unique style of the room.

Those who love bright colours and patterns are in for a treat in this doorway. The patterns are on just the tiles and colour blocking on the wall, cupboard and the door is just the right mix of pattern and colour produces a visual both simple and interesting.

This bedroom has very minimal furniture but look at the interest created just through patterns of different scales. The big bold blue pattern of the wallpaper is in complete contrast to the tiny details on the rug. The neutral tone of the rest of the room balances the bold colours and patterns.
The monotony of living and dining room decoration mostly in shades of grey and white is beautifully broken with the ironwood furniture, coloured canvas, geometric patterns on the cushions and chair.
Don't shy away from having big and colourful pieces of art on the walls and chairs in popping orange. balance it out with neutral seating to fill up space.

The drawing room is made sunnier with the use of yellow on the rug, and turquoise on the sofa. Graphic and geometric patterns have also been used for additional impact and to give the room a more 21st-century feel. Various textures and hard surfaces have been used to give the room additional lift, such as velvet, wool, lacquer, brass and marble. A lovely play of colours, textures and patterns produces an inviting cocktail of colours in this sunny looking living room.
An interesting study space has been created with geometric patterns, and colours in frames. this can be easily recreated in any small space.
This kitchen has iconic bold prints with classic wooden cupboards in white and brown resulting in a is a pretty cool, classy, and tastefully done space.

You can also go for having a singular point of focus in the room, especially if the room is big. Like here, the focus is the patterned rug and the artwork on the wall with the rest of the details forming the background from which patterns and colours rise in contrast.

An evocative British colonial look is created in this bathroom with the black and white geometric patterns floor tiling. The shower curtains in another geometric pattern and scale provide a break to the pattern on the floor. The simple white tiles on white walls and white doors make the room serene and welcoming.

This terrace has been designed as a template for finding inspiration to mixing patterns and colours! There is a lot going on but it all looks like a natural extension of the personality and style of the owners. The handmade cement pigment tiles with geometric patterns and the basket table are certainly the winners here.

In complete contrast to the terrace, this bathroom creates the perfect balance while working with patterns and colours. The geometric pattern on the floor is the biggest pattern used here, the antique wooden chair creates a rustic feel, and the towel's pop of colours works beautifully together to create an interesting but calming space.
The simplest route to take is to go with white and have fun with bold colours and pieces for the floor, seating, artwork and greens. Look at this beautiful living room as an example.
Here a great mix is created by using different materials for the ceiling, walls, flooring, and even with the pieces of furniture giving the room a lot of depth and character.
The bamboo ceiling itself has two different beautiful and natural patterns and is the center of attention in this room.

Probably the simplest and easiest way to add patterns to a given space is through wallpapers. Look at this geometric pattern for the dining room for instance. It creates a great visual effect but what is used is just a single wallpaper.

A great combination of taste, design and colours, this living room has eclectic decor concept and striking colours as the central feature. The exposed brick wall, classic leather sofas and wooden table produce visual stimulation with their different patterns and textures in a similar colour tone.

This living room is a perfect example of visual stimulation through patterns in minimalist decor. The open plan has furniture with curves, giving rise to a different composition. The living room has a beautiful effect created because of the light of the sun that comes through the blinds of residence.
As we said, break all rules with colour and patterns, here is an example. If eclectic, bold colour and boho-chic are your styles show it off in your space like in this living room.
If you loved this ideabook, also check out interestingways to incorporate floral patterns at home.

title: 10 Modern Ideas to Use the Colour Peach in Your Decor
author: Press profile homify
article_paragraphs: Peach: it's not a colour that we use in homes too often, but perhaps it's one we should turn to more. What exactly is peach? It's a mix of pink and orange, often a light and soft tone. As it's a warmer tone, it can brighten a room. Adding peach can bring a summer glow to your home and it looks great with most other colours. In fact, this tone peach is associated with warmth, youth, and friendship. If you like softer warm colours, then peach is a perfect choice as an accent colour.
So if you're ready to start decorating your home with peach accents, then let's take a look at some inspiration so we can steer you in the right direction.

Painting something in your home peach — whether it's ahallway, an accent wall, a chair, or a cabinet — immediately adds warmth to a room in a very unexpected way. We love the way this two-toned peach wall looks, especially with the yellow doorway in the background. As you can see, peach goes wonderfully with all-white walls and simple furniture as well. Paired with plenty of plants, the peach wall really shines here.

Peach is a great colour to use in the bedroom as well. Try using peach bedding or pillows to add vibrance or warmth to the room. Here, the peach is subtle and toned down — using duller peach tones can be a good way to avoid bright colours if you prefer a calm space. Against white, grey, and cream, the peachy tones look rich and regal in this room. Additionally, adding a peach accent wall or headboard can help to tie the warmer tones in a room together.

This peach accent wall looks superb in this dining room. Framing a piece of art, the peach tone helps to make it pop and goes well with the mural on the ceiling as well. Notice that the room incorporates a lot of white again, which is the best way to keep a room feeling fresh and bright. However, the addition of navy-coloured dining chairs adds depth and looks rich against the summery shades of the rest of the room.

Yes, you can use peach in the kitchen. Try utilising peach by choosing warm-toned plates to display or adding peach-coloured kitchen accessories like oven mitts. Peach looks especially great with blues or greens, so do add plants when you use peach in a room. Don't be afraid to add other bright colours like light to medium blues or teals, or greys. Also ensure there's enough natural light to keep a peach wall from looking dull.

Putting peach accents in the room doesn't mean adding stark colour to the room — sometimes, the subtlest of additions can make the biggest impact. Here, the lamp shades are a peachy brown tone, which looks fabulous against the grey-green walls. The simplicity of this shade makes it super versatile, so try experimenting with pops of peach around your home. Aninterior designercould help you to figure out the best arrangement and where accent colours will work best. It truly is an art!

Who would have thought — peach looks great as an exterior colour as well! While this may not be for everyone, peach is a lovely warm tone to use as exterior paint. Another idea to add peach to a yard is to add Adirondack chairs or a peach table — it could be a great look for the approaching summer.
Speaking of summer, add urban jungle vibes to your home withthese ideas.
Let's look at more subtle peach decor inspiration.
Adding peach throw pillows is a smart way to bring warmth to your living room.
Peach chairs? Yes, it's actually a fantastic idea. These chairs add a warm glow to the room and a more retro vibe that we love.
Again, peach paint adds dimension to a room. And while you don't have to paint the whole room for a sunset glow, we certainly love the way this room feels like a holiday.

For a girl's room, peach is a nice colour to swap out your average pink with — it's softer and the orange tones neutralize the colour more, so you can pair this chair with anything. Try a peachy pouf or lounge chair.

title: Incredible Ceilings: 14 Amazing Designs
author: Press profile homify
article_paragraphs: Creating a truly gorgeous and aesthetically pleasing room means covering every aspect of the interior design — including the ceiling. title: 21 Floral Pattern Designs to Incorporate in Your Home
author: Press profile homify
article_paragraphs: Floral patterns are such a classic look for the modern home, and not just for spring! You can incorporate floral patterns in your home all year round. But if the word 'floral' reminds you of stuffy, older homes, then you're not alone. Floral patterns have been recycled through new trends in almost every decade. But that doesn't mean that floral patterns have to fit the retro 70's or Victorian-era style.

Choosing the right floral pattern for your home comes down to colour and size, but also remember to complement your patterns with your solids in each room. You'll want to pick floral patterns that also draw on one of the accent colours of the room so they don't look out of place. Consider sizing, too — a larger floral print may be too bold for you, while others might prefer the funky, retro look of a bold floral. Smaller floral patterns are quieter and may be easier to match with your home.
Whichever type of floral pattern may interest you, we've put together plenty of inspiration for you to get a better idea of how floral patterns can look in a modern home.
These white floral armchairs with dark legs are simply stunning in this living room.
This floral and plaid bedroom looks country — notice how all those colours come together!
Florals don't have to mean colour. Just look at this accent wall with a bold black and white artistic design.
This bathroom looks so cosy with this floral wallpaper reminding us of cherry blossoms.
This bold graphic floral wall is the perfect complement to any home — the burst of colour will add brightness despite the more subtle black background.
Floral patterns are ideal for a baby's room, but this floral wall is bold, which feels chic, modern, and unexpected.
This armchair is beautifully bright in this room — choose a similar floral pattern to add detail to an otherwise neutral room.
A floral headboard is a subtle way to inject spring into your bedroom decor.
This tiny floral pattern is lovely for wallpaper but would look great as any upholstered furniture as well.
If you're not ready for a long-term commitment, adding floral paintings and art is a temporary way to give the trend a try.
Thedining roomtends to be one of those spaces we reserve for more traditional aspects of life — why not add floral patterns for a classic look?
Floral decals don't have to be just for the children's room — these wooden-looking flowers make this room shine.
If you have a library or simply a space set aside for reading near a bookcase, then a floral patterned wallpaper could fit the space nicely.
Double up on your floral patterns for a modern boho vibe in any room.
Pillows are always a fun piece to decorate a room with — choose florals for vibrance.
Again, florals don't have to be permanent. If you don't like artwork, consider adding temporary florals with a piece you can take away later, like a tablecloth or kitchenware.
This mural-like accent wall is everything we aspire to this spring — funky, bold, and unapologetic.
For a truly unique look,try paintinga flower decal on your wall. This oversized white flower looks magnificent in this room.
We love the way this rug with a floral birdcage pattern looks in this gazebo-like outdoor space. The cream background keeps it understated.
You really can't go wrong with a classic: this floral paisley print rug never goes out of style and you can find them in every colour scheme.
Bold is sometimes better — this large floral print rug is graphic and modern, which makes it look totally chic in this muted grey space.
Now let's look athow to make your home a little cosier.

title: 9 Cozy and Comfortable Window Seats to Snug into anytime of the day
author: LEENA JHA HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: Something is inviting and charming in the comfort of the window seat that we all would love to snuggle to read, chat, or even enjoy our afternoon siesta, basking in the sun. The window seat décor has become a popular trend among moderninterior designers and decorators. If not for window seats, the area near the windows usually is unutilized. In fact, along with the additional seating space, the window seat can also provide smart storage space. Let’s check these fashionably comfortable window seat designs to inspire and help you design with the window seats in your home.

Simple and minimalist, the elaboratewindowseating arrangement blends with the décor and is designed as an elevated floor of the study. With drawers at the bottom, cushions on the floor, an open shelf as the windowpane, and the large glass windows enhance the elegance and the comfort for hanging with friends and family, reading, and relaxing.

The smart and sensible design frames the window converting it for intelligent storage. A study table and a chair before it makes it a functional window seating space. The smart utilization of space is a perfect idea for a small bedroom, especially in this pandemic situation, to create a comfortablehome officeto work from home.
Perfectly in sync with the floor to ceiling glass windows, the floor's emptiness is filled with the simplicity of cushions on the floor, creating a modern minimalist window seating.
Construct something new and keep that tall antique cabinet you inherited at the end to giving your window seat an upscale makeover when contemporary meets classy.

The flexible and movable recliner, a coffee table, and a study table near the window over the slightly elevated platform transmute according to your mood. Move the furniture as per your wish and enjoy the flexibility in the window seat's design and décor.
A long bench with hidden storage beneath that culminates into the kid's study table is a perfect way to blend in the functionality with comfort in thechildren's room'swindow seat.
All it takes is an elevated wooden floor with a few comfortable cushions, pillows, and a low coffee table to create a relaxed and rejuvenating seating space near the window.

This window seat is a perfect getaway for relaxed reading or daydream or just gossiping with family and friends, curled up or cuddled up with your loved ones. The delicate décor of the room adds to the comforting charm of the window seat.

A built-in window seat is a textbook solution if you don’t want to experiment much with the design. However, you can still utilize the space under the seat for storage and make the recliner as comfortable as possible for the long waking hours you wish to enjoy there.

title: 25 Bedroom Curtain Ideas to Create a Chic and Serene Space

title: 15 Smart and Sophisticated Kitchen Storage Ideas for your Home
author: LEENA JHA HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: It’s not how much space you have for storage in your kitchen; it’s how you cleverly design it that makes the kitchen smart and chic. Designing a kitchen is not rocket science. After all, how difficult is it to build kitchen storage with drawers, cabinets, pantry, and gadget garage? Ask our professionalkitchen plannerswho successfully design the perfect kitchen storage, keeping in mind the minute details of comfort and envisioning it to make the kitchen look stylish. Let’s take a tour of these kitchen storage ideas to get inspired for your home.

The open kitchen's elegance gets enhanced by the modern cabinetry that matches the shade of the kitchen island's engineered stone and the backsplash. It merges with the décor. It is complemented by the dark walnut colored long pantry door on the side and the shine of glass doors on the wall cabinet.

Theone-wall kitchenwith wall and floor cabinet creates sufficient storage. The handle-free wooden wall cabinet and long horizontal steel handle for the floor cabinet do cleaning and handling the kitchen storage easy and hassle-free.

The kitchen storage made of wood brings in a rich and elegant look in the kitchen. The kitchen storage is running in L-shape along the kitchen counter, and then the wall cabinet on one wall creates enough storage space to keep the kitchen organized.

The monochrome magic in the kitchen brought through the pristine whitekitchen cabinetsfor storage and black kitchen counter. Wooden floor cabinet with steel handles, poster-framed glass on the wall cabinets, extended pantry, and the black and white floor tiles build up a beautiful ambiance.

The sheen of the white lacquered wood cabinet with in-built gadget garage, wall cabinet, open shelves complements the rustic wood finishing dominating the kitchen wall, island, and the floor cabinet builds a stunning kitchen.
In-built kitchen storage with clear glass doors and white lacquered wooden cabinets with in-built kitchen gadgets create a stunning décor in the modern kitchen.
While the floor and the wall cabinet have solid wood doors, the top-most storage shelves are covered with shuttered doors to keep the stored stuff visible.
The combination of the black and white stylish kitchen cabinet for storage decorates the kitchen beautifully. Thekitchen islandhas drawers in wood and white, a classic variety that never goes wrong.
Give your kitchen a high-fashion stylish makeover with a sleek and shiny glass hanger hanging above the kitchen island.

The industrial style kitchen cabinet covering the whole kitchen wall creates sufficient storage space in the modern kitchen. The handle-free design with an in-built oven enhances the elegance of the kitchen décor.

title: 9 Beautiful Ideas to Build Cheapest House on a low budget
author: LEENA JHA HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: Building a house is an expensive affair as everything from the labor to material cost shoots your budget, and often you end up paying much higher than you had planned. When we talk about building a house, we do not only mean thebungalowor independent homes constructed on the land. A home is also in the apartments we buy after shelling out our hard-earned money to call it our own. The interior designers will indeed work to reduce your home's cost and keep it within the budget. We've curated a few innovative ideas by ourprofessionals, the cheap hacks to help you build the house on a low budget and transform it into your dream home.

Spend some time to find a goodarchitectwho follows the philosophy of modern architecture and make a plan for a simple, fuss-free house with simple geometry. A home with clear lines and angles free of curves and complexities will drastically reduce the labor and material cost. It will be a substantial saving, and the modern minimalist look of the house will look attractive.

Concrete on the wall saves a lot since it is much cheaper than a plastered wall with texture orwallpaper. The cement wall's raw look in its natural shade brings a modern industrial charm into the home décor, and it is maintenance-free.

Opt for a rustic style for the staircase and use concrete slaps to construct the steps instead of the costly materials like wood, stone or ceramic tiles. Team it with metal guardrails and it will be a perfectly created rustic staircase on a low budget.

Walk the traditional route to reduce the construction cost of your house. Choose the conventional materials, style, and keep the scope of natural light and air to flush space. Mosaic tiles are cheaper than the expensive vitrified tiles and are easy to maintain. Open brick wall saves the cost of plastering along with enhancing the elegance of the space. Keep it simple, stick to traditional, and enjoy the uniqueness in décor way within the budget.

Look for space in the house that can be used for multiple purposes and indirectly saves money spent on interior décor and furniture. Like here, the window sitting designed on the windowpane doubles up to be the bedroom seating area cum daybed. With this arrangement in the bedroom, you will not need to spend an extrabedroomsitting space.

There is no doubt that the natural wood looks and feels rich and elegant. However, if you go for engineered wood, the factory-made cheaper timber version, it will substantially reduce the cost. The engineered wood is available in a variety of quality in different price ranges.

Exposed beams on the ceilings, electrical wires connecting the lamps, and pipes running exposed on the walls are common industrial style hacks in home décor. Blend it with the modern minimalist style to give the home interior a rustic charm. Apart from saving the cost spent on hiding it behind the plasters, it is functional too since it will be easy to maintain and fix when the problem comes.

Think before throwing out the old piece of wood or metal furniture. You can easily recycle and reuse in your new home, keep memories of the old alive, and save money. Paint the wooden furniture and refurbish it before using it or installing it in thekitchen cabinet.

Open space plan in a modern home is quite popular, and for a good reason. The open plan brings the social area together, where the lights and space flow into one another unobstructed. Fewer walls mean fewer materials required to build it and more savings. So, plan for an open plan home interior if you are looking for ways to reduce the cost.
