title: 5 quick and easy ways to cover an old, ugly sofa
author: Kayla Gulec
article_paragraphs: Just about everybody has one. Whether it was that cheap online bargain, a hand-me-down, or an inherited gem from your friend, the ugly, old sofa is one thing that just about every budding homeowner owns.

Because sofas are so large, they're usually the focal point of the living room, and when you have an ugly or dated couch, it makes yourroomlook a bit unfortunate. And, what if you don't have it in your budget today or even over the next year to get a new one? Well, that's why we're here today.

We're not going above and beyond with sofa replacement–we're going to work with what we have and show you just how to cover ugly sofas easily and decorate around them. All they really need is a little bit of TLC. There's more than one way to disguise that ugly old sofa and each of these tips will help give yourroomthe decorating facelift it so desperately needs.

Slipcovers are perfect for hiding each and every aspect of an ugly couch. Because they cover the entire sofa, your guests will be none the wiser of the ugliness that lies underneath. Slipcovers are made from many types of fabrics and come in a plethora of patterns to go with almost any decor theme.

Some slipcovers are one solid piece that cover the entire couch, while others come in separate pieces. Any slipcover you're looking at will have measurements on the package, so make sure to measure your couch to find the one that will fit it perfectly.

Drape your couch with a beautiful flagthrow, like the one we see here, or an afghan, or try an unusual textile that will add character to your space. These items impart a splash of colour to your room and take all the attention away from your ugly couch.

You can also decorate the rest of your room with more ethnic or complementary items to coordinate the look. This will also help make it look like adding that throw was not just an afterthought or a desperate act to hide something hideous.

This is a keyinterior designertip, and so easy to do. Splurge on a bunch of throw pillows to draw the attention away from the ugliness of your sofa. Some throw pillows may be a bit pricey, but you'll still save a load compared to what you'd spend replacing the couch.

There are so many different throw pillows available on the market, so finding the one that fits your decor should be no problem at all. But whatever you choose, make sure you use enough to make a big impact.

Getting your sofa reupholstered is an expensive and complicated process, so in order to avoid that completely, you can opt for newcushioncovers instead. Similarly to slipcovers, cushion covers will disguise whatever unattractive qualities your sofa has, but these, as the name suggests, just cover the cushion part.
These are ideal for couches that don't have fabric on the arms. And if you're skilled in the craft, you can even create them yourself.

Our last tip could be our most interesting one yet. Did you know you could paint your couch? Well, it's possible–trust us. It is one of the budget living room ideas that will help you to save a lot. If the colour is your biggest issue, buy some upholstery paint and get the colour you've always wanted. Turn your ugly, out-of-style green sofa into a sleek, black, modern one that's adorned with strikinglycolourful accent pillows.

Upholstery paint comes in a spray can and will instantly and considerably change the appearance of your sofa and room. The paint dries soft and won't rub off, but you have to make sure you let it dry for a full 72 hours before you use it. As a precautionary measure, test your spray on an unobtrusive area just to see if you'll get the result you desire.

And if you're a particularly artistic person, here's where your imagination and creativity can run wild! You could paint your couch with patterns or images instead of something monochrome. Each of these tips are super easy and relatively affordable for anyone looking to hide that ugly sofa. Try one tip, or combine a few and see where things take you!
You can also use thesetips to cover an ugly wallto give your room a budget makeover.

The easiest way to give an old sofa a fresh look is by cleaning it. If you are looking for tips on how to clean fabric sofas, sometimes all it takes is a wipe down with a soapy solution to get most of the dirt off it. Before you start cleaning the fabric, dust or vacuum the upholstery to remove as much dirt as possible. Then, make a solution with warm water and liquid soap. Dip a sponge in the solution and wipe down the surface. Allow it to dry for a few hours before you use it.

You can also find fabric guard sprays to protect the upholstery so that splashes and spills don’t soak through and damage the cushions. Use them and reapply a coat at least once a year to keep your sofas looking clean for a long time.
If you're interested in sofas, then you might want to check out thesesofa trends.

title: How to clean and restore wooden beams
author: Kayla Gulec
article_paragraphs: Woodis one of the most popular, useful, and versatile materials used in home construction today. It can be used to make furniture, dining room table and chair sets, and probably most notably, wood is used as a supportive frame for houses. When wooden beams are used as support systems in your home, it can be hard to notice when deterioration sets in, given how many other things you have to worry about on a daily basis. But when neglected, your wooden beams will lose their luster, leaving your home feeling a little less spectacular.

Keeping wooden beams in pristine condition is no small undertaking. You have to consider the type of wood you have in your home, which products should be used in cleaning and restoration, and the frequency at which to do this. But never fear—we are going to show you everything you need to know about how to keep your wooden beam ceilings and  surfaces shining like the day they were installed.

Woodages just like every other organic matter on the planet, and aging can originate from both natural and artificial substances. Outside of the home, severe rain or snowfall can destroy wood and lead to recurring mold growth. Inside the home, however, humid atmospheres and various splashes and spills can have the same effect. Another natural cause of wood aging is infestation. Insects like termites can make their way into your beams and eat the wood from within.

Wooden beams can age through the use of unsuitable cleaning products, as well. Cleaning products that contain harsh chemicals, such as bleach or chlorine, will damage the integrity of the wood, strip it of its strength, and cause it to deteriorate.

There are many different types of wood available on the market for wooden beamconstruction. When selecting the right type of wood for your home, you must consider the decor and purpose of the beam. For example, a support beam must be made from sturdier wood than a simple decorative beam.

Oak beams are the strongest and heartiest of all wooden beams, and they are also the most popular type of wood used throughout the world. Then there are plywood beams – these beams are generally used as vertical and horizontal stiffeners. Plywood beams are lightweight and are used to create stronger structures by nailing them to flanges. There are also veneer beams. This type of beam is created by adhering multiple layers of thin wood together.

Cleaning wood beams, unfortunately, requires a lot of effort and precautionary measures. Before using any hardcore cleaning method, it is best to dust and vacuum the beams. You can clean your beams by soda blasting them or chemical free blasting them. These processes remove and strip the paint, varnish, and any smoke damage (from cigarettes, cooking, fireplaces, etc.) and both processes are not harmful to the wood. And because of the nature of this type of cleaning, you can be very precise with which areas you clean without having to worry about damaging any nearby materials.

If you want to go for a more natural way of cleaning your wooden beams, you can create a vinegar and water solution by mixing two parts water and one part vinegar. Pour the mixture into a spray bottle, spray it on a clean rag, and use the rag to wipe the surface of the beam. Vinegar is a natural cleaner and disinfectant that removes residue without damaging the wood.

Some parts of your home are more likely to attract dirt, grime and grease than other areas. For instance, in an open kitchen, the fumes, smoke and grease will build up quickly, requiring a more frequent schedule for cleaning. The same will be true of wood beams on theterracepergola. While you might be tempted to use chemicals to simplify the process of cleaning the wood bean ceiling in the kitchen, bear in mind that it can damage the material in the long term since you will need to use it more often. So, it’s best to stick to natural products.

One way to restore your wooden beams is to remove the old finish on them. A lot of the time, it is the finish that looks the most tattered, and as it should, being the protective outer layer of the wood. Then, choose an oil or natural beeswax to stain the beams. Oils and wax penetrate deep into the grain of the wood and replenish it. This also helps in slowing down the aging process, as the oil and wax form a hardening layer on top of the wood that will reinforce it and protect it from future damage.

A beeswax polish can be made by shredding a bit of beeswax into a jar and covering it with pure turpentine. Leave the jar to sit overnight and then shake well in the morning. The turpentine will dissolve the wax and subsequently create a good polish. If there are any holes in the wooden beams, make a thinner wax so that it can be brushed into the cracks in the wood. If the timber has worm holes, make the wax into a thinner consistency by adding more turpentine so that the mixture can be brushed deep into the wood, as it will help consolidate the damaged area. Then, apply the wax to the beam with a soft cloth. It is important never to use a thick coat of wax, as it will remain soft on the wood and make it look dull.

Not all wood beam ceilings and rafters are easily accessible. So, for those that are challenging to restore on your own, hiring aprofessionalis a better idea. But, make sure you get it done at least once a year as neglect can cause the condition of the wood to deteriorate quickly.

As with any maintenance ritual, there are certain products that should be used and certain products that should definitely not be used. One thing you never want to use in cleaning a wooden beam is water. As we have said earlier, one of the causes of wood aging is constant exposure to rain, snow, or humidity. Cleaning with water will only increase your chances of damaging your wood.

Another product you want to stay away from is linseed oil. Linseed oil used on wood tends to remain quite sticky and therefore attracts dust and dirt which discolours the wood over time. Harmful cleaning chemicals should also be avoided. They tend to strip the wood of its integrity and strength, and definitely stay away from insect repellants. Some people believe that insect repellants will keep infestations at bay, but they just end up eating up the wood instead.

The frequency at which you clean depends on a few factors – how old your wood is, how susceptible the beams are to moisture or infestation, and how much traffic you get in your home. A good rule of thumb to go by, though, is a twice a year cleaning.

If you have very old wooden beams on theroofor ceiling, it can be a slippery slope when it comes to how often you should clean. You might think, the older, the more you need to clean, but that isn't necessarily true. The older your beams are, the weaker they tend to be, so sand blasting your beams often may lead to even greater weakening. If your beams are in a high moisture area, or you have experienced infestation before, you may need to clean them or apply wood varnish more often. And if you have a large family or just tend to entertain a lot, you will find yourself needing to dust and vacuum your beams more frequently (which is a great preventative measure against aging), but you don't necessarily have to go through the entire deep-cleaning process.
We hope this article helped you to clean your wooden beams! For more tidy tips, read on to discoversix ways of deep cleaning your home!

title: Garden furniture ideas to enjoy great outdoors
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: Greenery around the boundary of a house gives it an inviting aura and is also good for its inhabitants.  Decorative flower plants in colorful pots around the house periphery and lawn creates pleasant surroundings for family to relax during evening or early morning.  Whether you have a small or largegardenit is incomplete without proper furniture.

While details like fountains, plants, garden ornaments and other details make it beautiful, furniture can make it a true outdoor relaxation zone. Some people like to make DIY garden furniture while some prefer stylish ones made of sturdy materials that don't need to be brought in everyday. So here are some attractive garden furniture ideas that can be installed artfully in the region and increased or decreased to meet requirements.

Got a small garden? That should not deter you from enjoying its beauty and lovely outdoor greenery. See this smart deck and built in benchmade from reclaimed woodwhich is made comfortable with pretty cushions?  The box below the seat is for storage and cushions can be used only when residents are likely to use sofa.  A neat arrangement that does not require money or time on maintenance.

The easy way to personalize a small sit-out area to enjoy the greenery without worrying about having to rush inside due to rain or sun is to use light bamboo furniture in a traditional veranda like this.  Here you can relax and enjoy a cuppa or discuss about interesting topics for a long time.

This may not be exactly a comfortable piece of garden furniture but it suits the visual aesthetics of this stylish mini garden. Flanked by trees on either side and a beautiful cement mural as a backdrop this garden furniture idea is what contemporarylandscape architectsstrive to achieve.

There are no rules about choosing garden furniture as long as it is comfortable, durable and looks pleasant against the surroundings. This garden furniture idea made of rattan is stylish and is just the right color to suit the surroundings.

The eclectic beauty of white is hard to deny which is why most garden owners prefer this color for their needs. Here wrought iron furniture designed like art work adds charm to the tiny backyard garden that is everything a small family would love to own.

An easy way to personalize a small garden is easy with the right choice of furniture. While the gardener has taken all efforts to create this sculptured garden, owners have created a cozy space for enjoying outdoors with wooden furniture.

In a clean clutter free garden like this which just has a lawn you need to use furniture that enhances its beauty. The owners here have used minimalist wicker furniture that pleasantly transforms the region sitting amidst warmth glow of light from the house.
Love to add garden furniture to your collection? Here are some moregarden furniture ideas to lure you outside.

title: 7 Easy living room decoration on a budget
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: Every living room is the heart and showcase of every home that creates first impression about a family in the minds of guests. Decorative items, furniture, electronics, paintings and other details are an indirect representation of wealth, taste and personality. Usually in our zeal to make a living room opulent and stylish we either tend to overdo the decoration or fail to make the right choices from aesthetics point of view. To keep living room vibrant and balance maintain a flexible design that can be quickly changed to improve its style quotient or to meet changing trends. Here are some easy DIY ideas to givethe living rooma stylish fillip while balancing your budget.

Wood is a versatile material that can be used with any style that you may want to adopt to keep up with changing living room décor trends. This custom built  cabinet design makes a stylish partnership with the industrial style center table.

Lightinghas the ability to transform the living room from dull to delightful and brighten up the mood of people using it. Instead of a standard showy glass chandelier adopt this stylish circular arrangement. The tiny backlights behind the showcase enhance the shelf objects and can be switched off when you don't want to show them off.

Rearranging furniture and layout of items in the living room is the most cost effective idea to give it a new vibe. Here the sofas were rearranged against the staircase wall to create more space for small furniture pieces that could be moved around when needed and also to bring in a larger table.

Modern living roomsare as incomplete without thoughtfully displayed pieces of art which were the mainstay of classic style living rooms. Here stylish pieces framed in gold bring an air of elegance into the space and give a sense of balance to the opulent sofas and heavy dresser in the corner.

If you have a plain tile or wooden floor invest in floor decoration pieces like small carpets, colorful floor mats that create act as focal point of your living room. These pieces can have rest of the items centered around it like furniture, lamps or single seater sofas. It need not be expensive handwoven Turkish carpets as even those made of artificial fibers are good enough as these can be easily be washed with soap and water at home and are worth every penny.

Look for natural elements like plants or locally made mats, décor objects and botanical prints that bring color to the living room without affecting the budget. Combine them with neutral colored sofas and black framed windows to make the room look smart and contemporary.

Painting is one of the best ways to give life to living room walls. You can try to create a statement wall or just give it an unusual twist with dark color like here. This navy blue shade is a subtle masculine touch yet the white furniture adds charm and lightness to the environment.
Here are some more ideas onhow to decorate your living room.

title: 10 simple tips that attract good luck and positive energy
author: Kamla Villanueva
article_paragraphs: Good luck is a residue of preparation.—Jack Youngblood

Life can be unpredictable at times, but in those instances, it would be best always to be prepared. Like having to save up enough for the rainy days; collecting positivity and good energy can be a lifestyle that you can acquire to help you live a happier life. It may sound clichéd, but the truth is this: positive attracts positive. It is therefore very important that we change our way of thinking and try to have a more enthusiastic attitude and zeal in life: smile, get out of your comfort zone, talk to people, listen to more joyful songs, and refrain from thinking negative thoughts. If you are a positive person, then half the battle has already been won. It's positivity that wins the vote and the hearts of people.

Today, we have put together ideas from ourprofessionalsto show you some helpful ideas on how to get positive energy, starting from the elements that you can acquire at home. We have brought together these 10 simple tips that will enable you to attract positive energies or neutralise the negative.
It's never too late to change, and there is no harm in trying. Let's do it!

Every day you should open the windows of your house, even if it's five minutes and let the sunlight in because it is the main source of life. Spaces with dark areas, tend to have dense and heavy energy.

You know those Lucky Cat charms with the paw moving back and forth? Well, they say it attracts luck and fortune, but more than that, we all know that animals always make excellent companions. They provide us with love and affection. They absorb bad energies and turn them into positive energy. On the other hand, stroking or petting them also reduces stress levels.

Aloe vera is known for its healing properties; it has also been used for many medicinal purposes throughout the years. Moreover, it is ideal to have at home not only because it is decorative, but also because it absorbs negative energies and helps purify the air.

As for choosing the right plants for your home, you can't go wrong withbamboo! Plants always attract positive energy and bamboo specifically attract success and prosperity and is much used in the philosophy of Feng Shui. It is believed to have favourable energy since it symbolises the prosperous union between two elements: water and wood.
If you have to choose a candle colour to have at home, opt for the white candles, as these attract good energies. In addition, lighting candles at home creates a pleasant and relaxing atmosphere.

The salt that we normally use in the kitchen is a very important element to protect you from bad energy. Putting salt around the house will keep out envy and any other kinds of bad feeling from peers.

In addition, if you are moving from your home, to live in a new space (which has already been inhabited), drop a few pinches of salt in all corners of the rooms. It will absorb the bad energies of the ancient residents. Forty-eight hours later, you just have to vacuum and throw it away.
A clean house is a house with good energy. Do not have broken furniture or broken pieces. Keep your space as neat and clean as possible to restore balance and good energy.
Have a few crystals in your home, such as Selenite, transparent quartz, black tourmaline or onyx, as these will help ward off bad luck.

In various religions and philosophies, water is associated with emotions. In this sense, afountainin a garden or even on a balcony will control and balance your emotions. Allowing our actions to be driven by emotion can sometimes be detrimental; likewise, having sound judgement is always important for living a happy life.
Having natural flowers or plants in the house are great for purifying the environment and raising the mood! They will add vibrance to any area, whether it is aliving roomor a bathroom.

While buying or arranging artefacts can help to increase the positive energy in your home, you should also take measure to keep the energy or refresh it every once in a way to increase its effect. One way to do this by connecting the indoors with the outdoors.Designing your housewith sliding doors that connect with nature seamlessly is the best way to achieve this.

If you live in an apartment, besides using natural materials such as wood and stone that reflect nature indirectly, designing indoor gardens or greenwallsare an excellent option for infusing positive energy in the interiors. You can go a step further and choose indoor plants with air-cleansing properties to refresh the stale air and give a boost of energy to your home interiors
This article may also be of interest to you:10 Feng Shui tips to keep the bad energy away from home.

title: 9 best designer ideas for creating family kitchens
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: Everyone wants to give beautiful and modern design to their kitchen which is according to their cooking and storage needs. Today we have hundreds of interesting materials such as ceramics, wood, stone, brick pieces, laminates, etc. with which we can make the kitchen beautiful and attractive on a low budget. These ideas are for aspiring  kitchen redecorators looking for inspiration because experts believe that inspiration is an important part of perfect decoration.  With trends of decoration changing every few years it is best that you have a clean and spacious kitchen with all modern appliances arranged neatly.   In this book of ideas ourkitchen plannershave presented some modern designs composed with ideal combinations according to the shape and size of area wherein decoration and design play an most important role.

This attractiveminimalist kitchenmay be all white but every section compliments the other from the counters to the wide kitchen island. A wide range of modern kitchen appliances make it the ideal work area for a small family that can cook and eat its meals in complete harmony with the breakfast bar located just across the island.

This colorful wall decor may be completely in contrast to the former design but is perfect for this small kitchen and it makes this area come alive and look fabulous. Despite the unusual colors, large cupboards have been used but this area does not seem cramped by its presence.
The right mix of colors is very important to give the kitchen a simple and stylish look. If you cannot afford expensive finishes then use complimenting colors to enhance its appearance.
To change the traditional image of the kitchen the owners here have used a unique solution to with glass ! The right size of glass and patterns here have created an attractive atmosphere.

We all know how important storage is for every kitchen to avoid utensils and food items spilling on to the counter. To stash bulky appliances like mixers, large utensils and large containers of dry rations turn to large cupboards like these that can act as container areas.
Modern lacquer gives a stylish finish to kitchen surfaces. Available in bold colors and shiny finishes it is very durable and can transform a traditional kitchen into a modern one.

Use different types of natural stone on the floor or the counter surfaces and mix it up with varied shades of wood like here in both matte and glossy finish for a stylish look that is out of this world like here!!

Comfort should always be taken care of during the decoration of the kitchen area so tasks like cooking, cleaning and storage can be completed without hindrance. Using multiple lighting arrangements on the ceiling and below counters the entire kitchen can remain one of the brightest work areas of the house at any time of the day or night.
Backsplash made of colorful tiles and glass enhance the kitchen's beauty. Here hexagonal shaped tiles instead of the usual four dimensional ones add to its simple beauty without being obtrusive.
For moreideas on modern and affordable kitchens see here.

title: 6 Open floor house trends to copy
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: In recent yearsinterior designers and decoratorsare increasingly experimenting and considering open floor layouts that offer unrestrained spaces or rooms not limited by walls in modern formats. In this layout living room, dining area and the kitchen are included in open plan setting by clever association of furniture, colors and decor along with some intelligently designed architectural details. The key of this design plan is to have a cohesive and collaborative home with a warm feeling of togetherness that is tastefully created.

The simple yet spacious layout is minimalist in nature and thedesign style is Scandinavianwith an eclectic mix of soft and dark tones. The sophisticated living room is subtly divided from dining area by the wall which opens out to the stairway region and kitchen beyond. Though all the three regions are under the same ceiling, details like furniture, floor mats and kitchen island act as separators.

This spacious layout uses a humongous kitchen island to divide the region into separate sections. Designed like a galley kitchen it stretches across the entire rear area abutting dining region and living room. This design is ideal for contemporary homes where the focus is to create fluid layouts without sacrificing functionality. Instead of being a buffer zone between kitchen and living room the dining area here is just an extension.

The rectangular layout of this kitchen and dining area is perfect for serving warm meals straight out of cooking area. The meal sharing area makes efficient use of space while separating living room and kitchen. The cabinet dividing kitchen and dining areas has shelves to keep tableware that can be easily reached out from the other side too.

Planning to remodel existing closed spaces to open floor layout by removing walls? Consider using an L shaped layout like here like this that will allow privacy in the kitchen as it is tucked out of view from the living room without walls. easier to break a room up if it isn't a standard square or rectangle shape. The soft lighting, subtle divisions and modern furniture allow inhabitants to enjoy spaciousness of open layout design without compromising on comfort and privacy.

The design and layout of this house located in lap of nature was done to ensure free flow of natural air and light and avoiding right-angle spaces.  Keeping that spirit in mind the kitchen and dining area are visually connected and combine essential services of cooking, serving cleaning and storage so that all these tasks are completed without hindrance. Using elements such as wood and steel, it is easy to make a cohesive and beautiful arrangement with light colors.

The stone kitchen breakfast bar and combination oflight colorsis remarkable where the use of right elements gives a unique glow to the whole environment. There is a balance even when the design is open and there is enough space in the kitchen for every detail which is connected to dining area. While these two are pretty close, the living area is a little aloof as a public region of the house and feels aloof.
Here are moreideas on how to divide an open plan house.

title: Modern kitchen designs for stylish homes
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: Every kitchen is a home's heart that should be clean, attractive and well-organized as the family's health depends on it. There are many trends in making a kitchen, but it is important that the design is functional as well as reflection of your personality. Apart from optimum use of available space it is also important to use it in beautiful manner as the family and guests usually gather here as the food is prepared.

Thekitchen plannersthat have built these beautiful kitchens that not only speak through their design but also ensure that layouts meet needs of their owners. They have used high end technologies creative designs that help to make modern kitchens functional. So whether you are building a new home and looking for a suitable kitchen design or renovating your existing kitchen, the compilation of these kitchen layouts included in this idea book can give you inspiration for both tasks.

Doesn't this design make you wonder about how can the kitchen be so simple yet look so beautifully furnished? Fawn wall white wooden drawers and white counter tops create the perfect atmosphere for the cooking experience. If you like a large and light-colored kitchen, you will also love this modern kitchen design.

This spaciousScandinavian style kitchenis large and airy despite being  equipped with every modern appliance. Every object and device has its own place due to amazing design and therefore everything looks orderly. The linear design with large window at the corner keeps kitchen bright throughout the day.

This modern kitchen layout shows you how to effectively incorporate wood into the kitchen. Deep wood furnished kitchens provide contemporary style when partnering with granite counters and colorful drop down lights above the workspace. The use of color above the counter and backsplash region give life to this beautiful workspace with an attractive image of greenery.

If the kitchen is small where there is not enough space to decorate everything needed, then color plays a great role in expanding. Take the example of this kitchen that has used monochrome color palette of grey and brown with a bit of white thrown it which adds to the beauty of this kitchen. The brown cupboards and combination of grey floor and backsplash tiles here makes this kitchen admirable.

This inspiring built in kitchen design shows how effective use of space can make every inch of floor area functional. The combination of wooden cabinets above and below the counter along with kitchen appliances built into the wall ensures that every inch is used effectively. The glass door leading out to open area bring natural light in the kitchen that has a busy island which has been extended to include breakfast nook.

An easy and quick way to add a stylish touch to your kitchen is to install custom-made designer cabinets here. These plush white shaker cabinets above the counter form a beautiful partnership with combination of black granite counters. Here the kitchen decorators have opted for different dimensions to make this combination more useful.

Glass has the ability to leave an impact in any space and the space shines if the glass is attached to the door in place of wood to maintain the contemporary details of a small kitchen. To brighten the interiors the transparent glass windows make this work area a delight to work in. The artistically designed retro style kitchen is dressed in warm colors of blue and light pink.
Here are some delightfulexamples of minimal and modern kitchens you shouldn't miss.
