While the wall decor is kept minimal, the chandelier-style lanterns wrought on the ceiling makes the whole concept unique and extravagant.
On one marginal corner of this amazing cafe lies the most awaited part of this whole project journey—the classic bakery-style counter!

This counter is an artistic part of the ambience that displays everything hot and delicious lined up in the menu. Behind the counter from a space of about 5 feet stands a mighty vintage-style shelf that lines everything from your favourite Café Latte to the traditional White Coffee!
Stone-blocked finish wrought on the pillars adds to more traditionaldecorwhile inculcating the feeling of dining in a world set back from the modern era.
This Kopitiam Interior Design project is a marvellous illustration of architectural excellence by the ever amazing Li A'alaf Architect!

title: Lighting for Your Walls: 16 Fantastic Inspirations
author: Simone Orlik
article_paragraphs: In the summer, we tend to neglect thelightingin our house. But now that the dark season is upon us, lamps for indoors and outdoors are more important than ever—and also part of ourinterior design. Regardless of whether we want to make our four walls warm and cosy, have a cool design or are very classic: the right lighting sets the interior in the right light. In this idea book, we present you with 16 ideas that we can use to make the walls of our house shine, both inside and out. Ready?

The lighting on the exterior facade of a house can be very simple—or, as in our example, prominent and unusual. As part of the planning, the experts attached a strip to the facade in the terrace area, on which some spots shine downwards. These create a beautiful triangular shape, which makes the wooden deck a very special place.

How beautiful is this exposed brickwork in the spaciouskitchenanddining area?To ensure that it does not lose its appeal even at darker times of the day, minimalist cuboids were used as spotlights that emit light upwards and downwards.

The experts have taken a different approach with this wall, which is also a room divider. The wall looks a little like it is outside—including the gravel edge. Six spotlights are set into the gravel bed, which illuminate the wall from below. We think this is a beautiful play of light!

Rough stone walls are a beautiful design element for rooms as well as outdoor areas. Walls that are in shades of grey or anthracite are sometimes difficult to depict as they look very dark. Spots like the ones in our picture help to illuminate the wall and create beautiful effects through the rough structure. The light creates attractive contrasts, especially with the narrow green strip.

We wanted to show you this beautiful terrace because the lighting on the natural stone wall connects the two parts of the building with the inner patio so wonderfully. Small spotlights set into the ground and shining upwards onto the wall immersing the inner courtyard in an almost mysterious atmosphere. A white-painted concrete block in front of the wall invites you to sit and relax.

In the past, lights were only intended to illuminate rooms. Today, however, lamps can do much more than that. In our example, we see a rare integration of lamps. Because they let light out on four sides, an interesting cross-shaped look is created on the natural stone wall on the terrace of this house.

These lights are also more of a design object than a lamp. However, in this case, it is not the wall that is illuminated, but the ceiling of this lounge. What already looks great in the bright lighting must create a spectacular backdrop in an otherwise dark environment.

In this single-family home, our experts have installed a mix of different eye-catching and more subtle lamps. While spherical hanging lamps can be found throughout the ceiling area, the design of the wooden wall is more reserved. Wide but narrow spots made of stainless steel provide small, warm lighting for the wall.

We go outside together again to an outdoor area that is intended as a parking space for a car. Here, small spots are set into the ground on the wall, which cast warm light—almost like small flames—onto the terracotta-coloured wall. Light points in the wooden pergola provide additional light from above.

Sometimes there is no other option in rooms than to work with outlets on the wall. One of the reasons for this is the lack of power cables in the ceiling. If this is the case, you don't have to tear open the entire ceiling to integrate the right lighting. There are numerous spotlights available on the market that cast powerful light into the room.

Isn't that a magical play of light? Small window niches in the wall of the staircase let daylight into the building at certain points, while still providing plenty of privacy. Round wall lamps bring light onto the stairs so that no one falls. Our tip: especially on stairs, make sure to install spotlights that are as flat as possible in the wall so that no one gets caught on the lamp cover.

Now let's look at a completely different wall area that is no less interesting: We are in a kitchen that, due to the given dimensions, is partly in a somewhat dark corner. Thekitchen plannerssolved this challenge by installing spotlights under the upper cabinets in the corner area that cast a triangular cone of light downwards. This means that the entire corner is illuminated so that work can be carried out here without any problems even at dark times of the day.

Lamps don't always have to emit light in specific spots. With LED strips, you can also design areas continuously. This is also the case in our example, where the upper edge of the wood-clad wall was covered. This is a great effect, especially in the dark, which supports the linear design of this living area.

We're sticking with unusual lighting designs. Here, square spots with warm light have been completely sunk into the ground. The lights are not intended to illuminate the room, but rather to accentuate the gravel bed in the living area. Successful, in our opinion.

This staircase area at the entrance of the modern single-family home also proves that indirect light creates a great atmosphere. You would think that the subtle lights outside are not enough in the dark. This example proves the opposite. Precisely because the stairs have been underlined with light, they are so well lit at the edges that no misstep can happen.

At the end of our collection of ideas, we will go back to a classic single-family home, which shows through the various lighting systems how important it is to plan the lighting points when planning a new building or renovation. If this is forgotten during the planning stage, it is almost impossible to make up for it once the building is finished.

title: 8 Astonishing Ideas That Will Make Your Living Room Look Modern
author: Rita Kumar
article_paragraphs: While every room in a home is unique in terms of decor and tastefulness, the living room forms the crux of the entire abode. This particular room is the first destination where everyone from frequent guests to relatives and all those friend circles gather!

It can be anything from a tuxedo sofa to a modular sofa. With the help of your interior designers, mount the best looking chandeliers and choose to ornament the room with complementing ceiling lights. You can always have a low-built decked cupboard aligned towards the wall to complete the look.

To fuse in more aroma of grandeur, go for pastel-hued artificial flowers and ceramic showpieces. Remember, do not overcrowd the space with everything and just go for accessories that help in bringing out a lively contemporary look.
Wooden furniture and materialization is not only unique, but also helps in bringing out the essence of modern decor. You might wonder how wooden accessories would do the rounds in your living room!

This living room idea is one of the best concepts to flaunt the modish side of your gathering space. Choose your favorite sofa and complement the looks with a glass-wrought center table. For a modern look fused with a touch of vintage-style ornamentation, you can shift your piano towards the adjacent corner.

Now coming to the crux of this concept, ask your designers to frame a majestic marble-glazed wall right where you want to mount you huge LED TV. Additional shelving units on either side of this wall make the way for boasting your antique collections and ceramic showpieces!

A royal living room such as this is a desire of those who love colors and lighting! While everything is in place—your sofa, table, and TV unit, try to focus on something more vibrant. Yes, we are talking about shading the accessories with rich colors.

Go for a luxurious combination of blue, grey, and white. Attire your living room with colorful blinds, sofas, and walls by carefully picking a perfect combo of these three vibrant colors. To complete the look, mount a grand chandelier on the center.
You can also complement the empty corner with a royal lampshade! This concept not only looks modern, but is also blessed with everything savvy and gorgeous!

We all know the wonderful magic of color combinations and when it comes to home décor, it is obvious to run our creative minds with colors. Tint your living room with rich brown and yellow-hued ornamentation.

Go for an ivory brown-hued sofa complemented by plush yellow cushions. A golden-yellow glazed velvet fur rug crowns the look of the wood-marble tiled floor. Sequence your blinds with an adjacent finish of chocolate brown and caramel yellow. To finish the look, shelve some antique collections and ceiling lights.
Now this concept is not only vibrant, but also fosters a sense of positive energy from all angles.

This is our personal favorite! This living room is the best when it comes to reviving the space with cute concepts and modish looks. With the help of yourinterior designers, attire the gathering space with neatly aligned wooden and bamboo sofa complemented by plush white cushions.

Towards the angled center, place a mesh-balled iron wrought glass case table as shown in the illustration. This table is the showstopper in this concept! To fuse the looks with more elegance, have a wooden block-patterned ceiling running through the center above.
A vintage-style ceiling fan just about the seating completes the look of this modern and cute-looking living room concept!

A decent sofa adorned with plush cushions marvelously aligns the corner of this concept. A low-built ceramic-style marble table beautifully sits on that velvet-mesh rug you picked recently! Moving on to the TV unit, well ask your designers to have a minimal slab-style shelving unit just below where your big size LED TV is mounted.

Now coming to the gorgeous hint of this concept, well, make some art out of waste! You heard it right—reuse the remaining marble slabs after you're done with your kitchen counter and table. With the help of your designers, get these slabs cut into cute hexagon-shaped structures and have them cemented on the wall.
As shown in the illustration here, this concept would be the liveliest idea to flaunt the lavish and modern looks of your living room.

Coming to end of our living room journey, we have saved the colorful one for the last! Fuse your living room accessories with rich and bright colors. Start with your sofa cover—attire them with bubbling colors of blue, red, white, and orange.

You can master your creativity of colors very well here! Ask your designers to tint a color-blocked hue to one wall while mounting an asymmetrical shelf on the adjacent wall. Finish the looks with bright ceiling lights and a wood marble-tiled floor!

title: 6 Spectacular Ideas to Crafting the Most Practical and Beautiful Kitchen Cupboard
author: Rita Kumar
article_paragraphs: Saving space while enjoying that clutter-free look is one of the most sought after expectations in every home.    And yes, we are talking about that wonderful food paradise of yours— your kitchen!

A neatly aligned kitchen space with all the essentials beautifully in place paves the way for an attractive and orderly cuisine deck. But what is that major part of the kitchen where you actually need to focus on to crown the looks with more elegance.
It's nothing than that sequenced cupboard where you store all cooking accessories and foodstuff!
So today at Homify, we are going to help you with 6 amazing ideas to crafting the most beautiful and useful kitchen cupboards!
Go ahead and read on!

Our tip of an advice for you would be to be very careful in choosing the material of your cupboard. If you prefer a wooden cupboard in yourkitchen, then the best idea would be to minimize the touch of wood in your other accessories.

Make sure the material you choose for your cupboard blends seamlessly with the overall look of the ambience. A sequenced wooden cupboard such as this one goes amazingly well with the marble attired benches and countertop.
Well, to complete the look of it, brush your kitchen with minimal hues to make your cupboard stand out at the very first glance!
Keeping it minimal actually helps in bringing out the complete beauty— and this suit your cupboard too!

Attiring your kitchen with lesser details helps your major accessories to be noticed. Choose to go the contemporary way. With the help ofrenowned modern designers, have the common parts such as the handle, additional ornaments, and everything else mounting on it removed!
This gives a very smooth satin finish while crowning your cupboard with a glossy touch to perfection. This idea is indeed a very good choice if you prefer a modern kitchen.
If you have an enclosed kitchen that has every reason to be narrow, don't worry—you can do a lot to enhance the look!
Firstly, focus on giving some freshness to the entire look of your kitchen. Choose light colored cupboards and remember to keep everything light-hued.
The idea behind this is to fuse natural light with the light decor in the kitchen. A pearl white finish on your cupboard gives a slim and satin shine while illuminating with the natural daylight.
This wonderful idea is a great concept for amodern kitchenwith a touch of professionalism!
With a few innovative concepts, you can stay assured of grabbing every attention to flaunt the stylish side of your cupboard.
Here, you can choose to not have a cupboard over your counter! It might sound surprising, but try it!

You can glaze the wall with an artistic touch of decor and seal the space to make it more visible. Beneath the counter comes the best fitted white-hued cupboard to board all your kitchen essentials. A wonderful and amazing idea for those with compact kitchen space, this concept has every reason to boast the style quotient from every angle.
Finish the side view of the cupboard with polished plywood to amalgamate the looks of white and sand dune brown!
If you are a person who enjoys a clutter-free look while saving a lot of space in the kitchen, then this idea is worth trying!

Instead of having a cupboard angled throughout the kitchen, you can choose to go for minimal cabinets. This kitchen island design not helps in saving space, but is very handy in helping you reach out to all your essentials without having to lean up all the time!
The cupboard below your counter remains the same, but with a perfect finish of off-white hues. To complement the space, go for a compact yet sophisticated cupboard beneath your cooking counter.
This amazing idea not only looks classy, but has everything shelled to flaunt your modern kitchen.
If you are someone who enjoys classic furnishing, then this wooden glazed cupboard is a worthy try to flaunt the looks of your kitchen.

Your kitchen might already attire a modern look, but with a few changes, you can very well change the ambience to a classic one! Complement your kitchen with wooden cupboards that amazingly blend with the marble counter and tiled floor.
Wooden cupboards are not only durable, but a healthy choice for the entire house!

title: Sliding doors for your small kitchen
author: Swapnil Kangankar- Homify
article_paragraphs: Modern-daykitchensare getting increasingly smaller due to higher land costs and reduced construction space. As a result, many of us are forced to come up with creative space saving solutions with a view of increasing the usable area. The kitchen sliding door is one such solution thatexpertsfrom all the world love to experiment with, particularly in the case ofsmall areas. They not only look good but also free up space for other activities and enhance space utilization. Let's take a look at 20 such ideas for creative sliding doors designed especially for the kitchen by professionalkitchen planners. They can be installed as the kitchen door, instead of the conventional hinged door. Alternatively, in modern apartments with an open-plan integrated space, they can serve as the kitchen divider.

Here is a design that will work even in small homes, without cutting out light or spaciousness. The sliding mechanism for the kitchen door design provides accessibility without taking up too much space.

In this home, the sliding door to the kitchen is the ideal solution, considering the narrow entryway between the dining room and kitchen. The white tint matches thewallcolour, making the kitchen almost invisible from the dining room, once the door is closed.
If you liked this article and would like to know more, please read14 sliding doors that maximise your space

title: 7 Tips to create your home theater
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: With rising movie ticket prices and problem of traffic snarls everywhere, going for a movie with the entire family and having a great time outdoor has become expensive for most families. So here is a solution if you are are looking to create a similar environment with a small investment to get a fully immersive movie experience right in your own home. We are here to help you with the pertinent question of where to begin? Yes there are many variables to consider like screen size, seating arrangements, speaker systems, lighting which may make your wallet lighter by several dollars.Our workers have created several home theater layouts across the world and we have put together some of the best ones to give you inputs about creating the entire design process.

While getting the home theater designed by a professional is the best alternative as it requires  intimate knowledge of electronics, acoustics and design, an enthusiastic DIYer risk taker with adequate knowledge of basics can also make a reasonably decent home theater. Here are some home theater ideas that will help you to understand that beside investing in appropriate audio visual equipment one also has to select appropriate seating options for the room.  If you have a tight budget then a few essential details can suffice to make a home theater ormedia roomand we recommend that you familiarize yourself with acoustics and lighting before beginning the experiment.

Selecting the right room and making a budget are the foundation stones of designing a home theater as only then one can plan layout, equipment, decor and other details. The ideal size of a home theater room should be 20 feet by 13 feet and relatively away from the rest of the house. ideally theater rooms should be built in basement of family room that are spacious and large enough to seat family members comfortably and does not disturb neighbors.

Choices of home theater interior décor ideas are limitless so start considering if you want a casual entertainment area where the entire family can relax over a movie or you want a real theater like experience with surround sound,special lightingand other arrangements.  Some people believe that décor in this room should be consistent with other parts of the house. But people with large budgets can indulge in creating thematic ambiance for their home theaters and work with interior  decorators to create artistic images featuring favorite movies, colors, movie stars or patterns.

The most important part of any home theater set-up is a display screen and though the temptation of setting up a large screen to enhance viewing pleasure is strong there are limitations. An immersive experience is fine but it should not be so large that it forces viewers to swing the head every-time to catch the action. Use an expert’s help to find right combination of size and angle for the display. Finding the best viewing height is also important and ideally the center of the display screen should be at eye level for the idea home theater design..

In this media room idea the residents have stuck to a casual layout where the living room is the main entertainment area. Instead of having a separate theater room they large screen television on  the wall is used for streaming all forms of videos like movies, television programs, games and internet streaming content. Sound system is spread across the room with boom boxes placed in strategic locations to enjoy an immersive experience.

You wouldn't want neighbors to complain abut sound pollution would you and call cops when you are in the midst of an interesting scene? Then soundproof the theater area with soundproof drywall or treat the walls with materials that dampen the sound. While the former is quite expensive the latter can be done with thick vinyl on the windowless media room and also affixing a solid-core door. Here is a theater room layout with comfortable seating arrangement located at sufficient space away from the screen

A classic home theater includes a video projector along with a large screen and great sound system to create the right ambiance of a real-time theater. Covering all areas where light can come in is critical as screens can get washed out by stray light. Along with energy efficient projector lamps you would also need to have space to setting up boxes for streaming content and maybe a video player too.

Ensure that the seating arrangement in your home theater is suited for various age groups that are likely to use the region for entertainment. The chairs should be comfortable enough for aged people to get up and sit down and also for squirmy little ones that may keep walking in and out of the home theater.
Here are someoutdoor entertainment areasif you love outdoors more than interiors.

title: Water in the Garden—29 Ideas for Ponds, Fountains and More!
author: Lisa—homify

title: 18 Ideas To Perfectly Organize Small Kitchens
author: Simone Orlik
article_paragraphs: We always demand perfectionism in our kitchens. Because kitchens today are not just for cooking. They also reflect our love for an individual style. However, especially insmall kitchens,we always struggle with enough storage space. Because everything else often looks far too chaotic.
We seized this opportunity and collected ideas from our professionalkitchen plannerson how we can best store our food and kitchen accessories, even in small kitchens.

This deep drawer offers space for all kinds of accessories—it's all a question of proper organization. In our first example, on the left side, we find a place for knives and wooden spoons of all kinds, and on the right side, there are the most commonly used spices at a glance.

Openshelvesand cupboard modules can quickly become too much of a good thing, especially in small kitchens. They make a room seem even smaller than it is. Our tip: It's better to store some of the dishes and kitchen accessories behind uniform cupboards and drawers.

In this kitchen, the spices are hidden behind a narrow wall unit. In our case, it is arranged vertically and can be pulled out completely. We think this is a solution that is particularly gentle on the back.

Furniture and kitchen appliances don't always have to have the same design. But they should somehow form a unit. The kitchen we see here combines the light kitchen fronts with the stainless steel appliances almost perfectly.

Students or young professionals don't always have the budget to afford large planned kitchens. Then you have to stay within the chosen budget. That also works, as we can see in this small kitchen. A modular kitchen cabinet has been combined with an open shelf that even houses a microwave. Kitchen accessories such as ladles or spoons are simply hung on a rod.

Cooking pots and pans are kitchen appliances that can be difficult to store—their shape alone ensures this. In this drawer, an order was created by dividing the drawer with a few narrow dividers. This way, the pots don't slide around in the wrong place. Clever: Also in the same drawer is a swivel module with storage space for small sieves or other flat accessories.
Such pivoting modules make a lot of sense, especially inkitchensthat extend over corners. Otherwise, the pots in the furthest corner of the cupboard are hard to reach. Chaos is then unavoidable.

This kitchen uses a pull-out vertical module, which is now available in all possible sizes. In our case, it is a very small and narrow shelf that can hold the most important spices. A practical design that also looks good.

Kitchens that have to be built into a corner almost always have to face the challenge of how to make the most of the space in the entire corner area. Here, several narrow pull-out drawers have been combined. They offer maximum flexibility given the limited space.

The interior of this kitchen cabinet has been structured with just as much attention to detail as the exterior. Drawers of different heights offer space for kitchen appliances, dishes and cutlery. Beautiful wooden drawers divide the drawers so that nothing can slide into one another.

Vertical stainless steel modules not only look stylish. They are also particularly robust, easy to clean and require little maintenance. This means that the one-time investment is worthwhile over many years.

Often we have a kitchen built in our house and realise far too late that we have forgotten the rubbish bins. These days, it's not just a bin that's left lying around, but usually an organic waste bin and plastic waste in addition to the general waste. Our kitchen planners have planned the rubbish bins directly into the kitchen and installed them in such a way that they disappear behind a cupboard.

What a look! The kitchen planners in the next example followed an industrial design and functional lines. It's not just the white tiles and the sink that speak this language. The open shelves that stretch across the entire width of the kitchen are also a testament to this.

Admittedly, this wonderful wooden ladder doesn't offer much storage space. But it looks incredibly chic and houses some beautiful kitchen appliances that are far too good to be hidden behind cupboards.

Here we come to a design that almost looks like a cupboard within a cupboard. Behind a white closed kitchen front, there is an interior cupboard with many compartments. Here you can store baskets, spices, flour and sugar, biscuits or tea. The cupboard is so tidy that the open kitchen cupboard itself seems like a design element.

With this minimalist kitchen, we might think that it has very little storage space. But that's not the case. The beautiful white kitchen begins behind the kitchen counter and offers swivel modules in the corner that can accommodate lots of kitchen accessories.

Sometimes our style dictates that we want to show off our collected dishes. This can be done with an open shelf like this, but it is divided up in such a way that all the pieces look nice. The shelf and work surface are somehow reminiscent of grandma's times—but interpreted in a contemporary look.
This drawer has been designed really cleverly. Stainless steel modules divide the drawers into different areas for open foods such as salt or sugar and spices in tightly sealed containers.

title: 8 Beautiful Ideas for a Dressing Table in the Bedroom
author: Denise Schopen
article_paragraphs: If you don't have much space or no natural light in thebathroom—or if you live in a shared apartment and therefore have to get out of the bathroom quickly—a dressing table in thebedroomis a great idea. Of course, a dressing table in the bedroom also makes sense if you like to do your make-up and hair while sitting down. In this article, we would like to give you a few important tips about your dressing table so that you can enjoy this piece of furniture for a long time. There is room for a small dressing table anywhere. However, it is important that you adapt the style of your new make-up area to that of your furnishings and thus create a coherent, harmonious overall picture. Please take a look at a few ideas from ourinterior designers.We are excited to see which solution you would like to implement.

When it comes to a dressing table, paying attention to thelightingconditions is imperative. Daylight is particularly popular because it makes the makeup look as natural as possible. You can store your makeup utensils in one of the small cabinets, conveniently and easily accessible but still neatly stored away.

In this example, a place in front of the window was also chosen to create the best possible lighting conditions. If you place a simple table next to your closet, you can store your make-up and other make-up utensils there and take them out when needed.

If the light falls from the side onto the dressing table in your bedroom, you will also get very good lighting conditions. Put a chair next to the table and your dressing table is ready. If you wish, you can attach a wall mirror or set up a small makeup mirror—whatever you want.

You can see a particularly romantic example of a dressing table in this example. The light falls pleasantly through the thin curtain and thus provides a very beautiful and natural light. You can also put a small lamp on the table as an additional light source.

You can store all your cosmetics neatly in this dresser. If you want, you can also put your makeup right on the dresser. To do this, simply move the nearby armchair closer, find your makeup and your mirror in the dresser and off you go!

An illuminated mirror is also a great idea for setting up a dressing table. This way you have more flexibility in how you arrange the table—you don't necessarily have to put it near the window. You can store everything in the drawers of the dressing table and a plant next to the table creates more ambience.

You're never wrong with this fold-out table! You can store lots of cosmetics and at the same time have a large table surface available. Put a lamp on the table and attach a mirror to the wall if necessary. Your dressing table is ready.
Whether it's a desk or a dressing table, this table is suitable for a variety of purposes. It's quick to assemble, easy to combine and gives any bedroom a modern touch.

title: Conversion from a Pitched Roof to a Modern Flat Roof House
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: Here atHomify, we always present you with great renovation and modernization projects that show how old-fashioned, unfashionable single-family homes can be transformed into stylish, contemporary and attractive homes. Today we have brought you the amazing transformation of a staid housing estate house, which our experts fromArchitektur Liniegave a completely new look and feel. The interior photos of the project were taken by the photographerChristoph Tempes.

We begin with a look at the facade of the house before the renovation and conversion work. It is a classic housing estatehousewith a gable roof, like those that were built all over Germany in the post-war period. Over the past years and decades, however, the demands on single-family homes have changed fundamentally, so that this home did not meet the expectations of its new owners in aesthetic, energy or practical terms. So ourexpertshad a lot of work to do.

Hardly recognizable, is it? Here you can see the street façade after thearchitectsfromArchitecture Linietook on the matter. The old-fashioned housing estate house was transformed into a modern flat-roofed building in a contemporary shape and colour scheme, which was only equipped with small window openings on this side of the house to protect the privacy of the residents in the densely built-up housing estate.

Of course, we don't want to withhold thebeforeview of the back of the building from you either. Here, the single-family house is surprisingly modern and opens up to the garden on the ground floor with a large window front. This concept should be retained, but the appearance and of course the energy balance of the house should be significantly modernized.

The after photo clearly shows that the large glass front on the ground floor was retained, as was the balcony on the upper floor. The gable roof was replaced by a more contemporary flat roof and the windows on the first floor were significantly enlarged. In addition, light grey accents were added to the white facade and the terrace was made more spacious and more homely.

Unfortunately, we don't have any before photos of the interior of the house, but a lot has happened here too during the renovation and modernization work. The small-scale floor plan with narrow rooms typical of classic housing estates has been broken up and the entire living space has been made more spacious, spacious, bright and airy, as can be seen in the new entrance area. Large doorways with practical sliding doors lead into the living area, and a modern, railing-free staircase leads to the upper floor of the house. The interior has been colour-coordinated with the outer facade. Lots of white and light, subtle tones dominate the overall picture.

The ground floor is now practically one large room, in which the kitchen, dining and living areas merge seamlessly into one another and benefit from the large windows at the back of the house. From the open kitchen with white handleless fronts, you go through the dining area into the living room, which invites you to linger with its cosy fireplace corner.
For you:Transforming a 30-year-old apartment into a modern space.

Even in the large bathroom, nothing reminds you of the past other than an old housing estate. The room is characterized by plenty of space, modern furnishings and high-quality materials. Natural daylight comes in through the high, narrow windows, while at the same time preserving the privacy of the residents. Bright white on the walls and the large mirror open up the bathroom even more and give it even more visual depth.
Are you wondering how to perfectly maximise space in small bathrooms? Read thisidea book!

title: 6 + 6 Great Furnishing Ideas with the KALLAX Shelving System from IKEA
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: There is hardly anyone these days who doesn't have at least one piece offurnitureorfurnishing accessoryfrom IKEA at home. No wonder, it's because the products from the Swedish furniture store are practical, inexpensive and functional. The furniture in particular impresses with sophisticated storage solutions, space-saving concepts and cool design. One of the most popular IKEA models is the KALLAX shelving system, which is available in various sizes, dimensions and colours and can be used both as a shelf and as a room divider or, with the doors closed, as a storage miracle. Today we'll show you six great furnishing ideas with KALLAX.

TV furniture can be quite expensive. If you want to save money, simply go for KALLAX as a cost-effective alternative that is practical and looks great too. The compartments underneath can either be left open and used as shelves or fitted with doors or drawers. KALLAX is also available with castors for those who like to remain flexible.

Using KALLAX as a bookcase is a classic that also works well as a room divider and can then be filled with books from both sides. But record collectors also get their money's worth with the IKEA shelving system and can store their vinyl treasures safely, practically and stylishly. Another tip for theliving room:Equipped withdoorsand drawers, KALLAX is a casual and inexpensive alternative to the traditional wall unit.
KALLAX also looks great in the dressing room. In every conceivable size and design, it stores shoes, accessories, bags, folded clothing and jewellery—behind closed doors or in drawers, as you prefer.
In the home office, KALLAX is a reliable partner and practical accomplice that can easily handle all kinds of files. Numerous different inserts also allow us to visually ensure order and seriousness.

In the hallway, the IKEA KALLAX shelving system can either function as a stylish shoe rack with storage or, in the single-row version, as a clever bench that helps you put on your shoes. Things like gloves, hats, scarves and umbrellas can be hidden in matching baskets or inserts.

Here we see a place where IKEA's KALLAX shelves are particularly popular. Thanks to its many clever uses and design options, the shelving system is a hit in children's rooms. Here it serves—with or without inserts, cupboard doors and drawers—not only as a bookshelf and storage space for toys but also as a wardrobe alternative, room divider, bench or even a doll's house. The best thing about it: KALLAX practically grows with the kids and is just as useful in the baby's room as it is later in the teenager's room.

A super creative idea for all cat fans who want to give their furry friends a cosy den but don't want to buy new furniture. This felt insert makes it possible. It fits perfectly into every KALLAX from IKEA and invites cats to hide, snooze and laze around.
Another creative hack for all KALLAX shelves from IKEA: The compartments of your favourite shelf can be transformed into space-saving and stylish record storage in no time.
Knitting fans will also get their money's worth with this ingenious KALLAX insert, which ensures that you never lose track of things.
One of the unbeatable advantages of the IKEA Kallax shelving system is that you can easily and effortlessly transform the shelf into a cupboard when needed—thanks to matching door and drawer inserts.

If you find a plain shelf too boring, you can turn your KALLAX from IKEA into a stylish highboard in no time at all, and you won't be able to tell where it comes from. Simply add feet, a matching top, replace the drawer knobs and add inserts as you wish—and your customized, wow piece of furniture is ready.

Our last example also shows how elegant the IKEA KALLAX shelving system can be: In this dressing room, it looks like a much more expensive piece of furniture and becomes a style guarantee par excellence.

title: 16 Clever Fences For Small Gardens
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: Hardly any space, an unfavourable layout, too close to the neighbours: a small garden always presents a particular challenge. There are a few things to consider, especially when it comes to the boundary to the street or neighbouring property. Of course, you want to be undisturbed in your garden and not necessarily be on display, but if you have little space outside, you should still avoid fences, walls, hedges and the like that are too large, sprawling, wide and bulky. The following sixteen variants are also ideal forsmall gardens.

If you have a small garden with aterraceand maybe a balcony, you still want to protect yourself from the neighbours' gaze. We'll show you how this can be done stylishly and functionally in this book of ideas. So start reading now and find out more about a beautiful barrier that you can copy. Smallgarden fencescan look better than you might think! The privacy screen for small gardens just needs to be chosen correctly. We'll show you beautiful fence pictures and lots of beautiful garden fences—there's bound to be a fence for you too: We're excited to see which privacy screen you choose!
Could your garden also use a little attention? Be sure to check out our amazingprofessionals.
We start with an exciting property boundary, where natural stone and wire surfaces alternate. This creates a relaxed overall picture that does not overwhelm the smallgarden.
Classic wooden fences are always a good idea because their natural look means they fit into any garden. Despite the solid, stable slats, such a fence looks delicate enough for small gardens.

An interesting option for the modern garden is stainless steel details. Whether it is the entire fence, just a gate or a combination of masonry and decor—this gives your outdoor area that certain something and a very personal touch.
Naturalness wins, even when it comes to the property boundary. As long as there is greenery involved, the hedge can be a little higher without visually overwhelming the XS garden.
A real classic that always works: the garden fence made of steel, not too high but still stable.
Here we see a combination of filigree steel fence and sophisticated greenery.
Completely closed privacy screens and solid walls also work in small gardens. However, they should not be too large or bulky. The wave shape gives this model an individual, relaxed touch.

If you like natural, idyllic garden paradises, you can also give nature free rein when it comes to property boundaries and, for example, let half-high natural stone walls or inconspicuous chain-link fences grow wild.
The half-height wall made of natural stone is always a visual asset and also reliably fulfils its function as a boundary. If you add plants on top, it also becomes a natural privacy screen.
This type of fence does not provide privacy, but it does allow a clear view of the beautiful natural landscapes around the garden. And it does not visually restrict even the tiniest outdoor area.
White is not only a good solution inside the house if you want to create the illusion of more space and depth. This trick works great outside too.
Gabions are durable, high-quality and visually appealing alternatives to classic fences, hedges and walls, which also score points for their ease of maintenance and dimensional stability.
Bamboo is probably the most sustainable material there is. A privacy screen made from this fast-growing natural product is not only impressive in this respect but also has a special aesthetic appeal.
Another natural weave that makes a great visual screen: this hazelnut border can be integrated beautifully and naturally even in small gardens.
The most important rule for property boundaries in small gardens is that they should be as delicate as possible.

If high walls or massive walls cannot be avoided, it is advisable to have agardeneradd some sophisticated greenery to them. This way they appear less massive and oppressive and instead blend in harmoniously with the natural garden design.

title: Decorative Stairs: 12 Stunning Designs to Wow Guests
author: Press profile homify
article_paragraphs: Stairs are an important part of the two-story home — why not decorate your stairs as you do the rest of the house? Making your stairs a little more interesting by redesigning or adding decor such as rugs can elevate your home easily. Remember to keep it simple, though. While it can be a great idea to incorporate an interesting staircase in your home, it's best to keep stairs as functional as possible so that you or your guests don't have trouble moving around the home.

If you're looking to do a complete revamp of your home, it's best to get a professional involved. Not only can they help you to redesign your staircase, but they can also advise you on other ideas, decorative aspects you may not have considered, and more. So if you're ready to improve your staircase, let's take a look at twelve stunning designs to wow your guests.

title: How Can I Integrate a Walk-in Closet into my Bedroom?
author: Marie Carstens
article_paragraphs: A walk-in closet is every woman's dream. But many men can also get used to the idea of having extra room for clothes, shoes and accessories. Many people know the dressing rooms from Hollywood films or luxury apartments. But it is not that impossible to set up a walk-in closet in your home. You don't necessarily need an empty, separate room that has access to your bedroom. With a little space, a few simple tricks and a little craftsmanship, your bulky closet will soon be a thing of the past. Today we would like to explain to you how you can integrate a walk-in closet into yourbedroom.You can of course also hire ahomify professionalto do this work for you. If you want, you can even have walls installed that turn the dressing room into a separate room. Today we will show you how you can make the luxurious dream come true.

The first step in setting up your walk-in closet is to determine the size. Look around your bedroom and consider where the walk-in closet should or can be placed. Keep in mind that your old closet can either be integrated into the project or used for something else. Otherfurnituresuch as a bed, dresser and armchair can also be rearranged to make room for the dressing room. One option would be to place the walk-in closet behind your bed. The bed can then simply be placed against the new wall or the back wall of the closet. A bedside table on the left and right, a nice picture above the bed and the new bedroom is ready!
You can read this article that talks about20 wardrobe ideas for a small bedroom.

The simplest solution to integrate a walk-in closet into your bedroom is to align two large closets. As shown in the example image, one closet is used as a room divider. The closet should go up to the ceiling, as it can be secured there for safety. The whole thing can of course also take place in a corner by aligning two closet walls at a 90-degree angle to a corner. Just look at how your bedroom is laid out and what options are available. Make sure that you plan enough space to be able to move around and change in your walk-in closet. The back wall of the closet, which serves as a room divider, must of course be properly covered. Light wood materials are perfect because they can be painted and even wallpapered. Of course, you can't consider the new walk-in closet aroom, but you can still create a small area that is reserved just for your clothes.

Aprofessionalcan of course get a lot more out of your bedroom. New walls can be put in to create a proper room. However, your bedroom should be a little bigger to ensure there is enough space for the dressing room. The room can also be fitted with a space-saving sliding door. This means the entire closet disappears from your bedroom and you have space for nicer furniture and home accessories.

To design the dressing room exactly as you want it, you have to choose the right colours and materials. Since the closet area is open on one side, it is advisable to adapt the design to the rest of your bedroom. If you have white furniture, you should also choose white materials; if you have wooden furniture, you should choose wood to achieve a harmonious overall look. In general, however, light materials are more suitable, as they brighten up the small, probably windowless room a bit.

Before you rush out to buy a wardrobe, you should take a look at what kind of clothes you have. The point of a walk-in closet is to organize clothes, accessories and shoes as clearly as possible. If you have a lot of shirts and blouses, you should make sure you have enough space to hang them up. Long dresses and winter coats, however, need a deeper space to be able to hang them up without creasing. There are special devices for belts, ties and other accessories in which they can be stored in a space-saving and clear manner. A laundry basket should also be planned in your walk-in closet so that you can immediately distinguish between clean and dirty when you change. The following is also important with shoes: high heels are of course always nice to look at—sneakers, on the other hand, could cause a noticeable smell in your closet instead of a chic look. If you want to store all kinds of shoes here, you should get a few nice boxes or crates in which to store them.

Light is particularly important in a dressing room. After all, you want to be able to see the colours of your clothes correctly. In dim light, it can easily happen that a black sock and a dark blue sock are chosen. This can lead to embarrassing moments at a later meeting. A bright ceiling lamp provides a decent basic light, while spotlights can be aimed directly at the clothing. For those who like things a little more luxurious, special shelflightingis an option. This is mounted directly on the underside of the shelves and illuminates everything that is in the area below. If you want to implement the DIY version of the walk-in closet, you can also work with clamps or floor lamps.

One accessory that should not be missing in any walk-in closet is a mirror. This way you can check your outfits directly without having to go to the bathroom or bedroom. There are no limits to your imagination when it comes to further design. If you have enough space, you can of course choose a comfortable armchair for your best friend to sit on while you try on the clothes for your next date. Pretty baskets for accessories, a bowl for jewellery or decorative boxes are also a good choice for beautifying your new dressing room. In the example picture, you can see a spacious dressing room, the design of which is not only luxurious but also cosy. The fluffy carpet makes it easier to pick out the right clothes in the morning with cold feet. You can also see the perfect example of how beautiful baskets and boxes can enhance the room. If you have a small bedroom that cannot under any circumstances accommodate a walk-in closet, you don't have to be sad.

title: Systematic house cleaning: complete cleaning in three hours
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: Cleaning is probably one of the favourite leisure activities for very few of us, but it is a necessary evil that sooner or later cannot be avoided. Our tip: Set your sights on a rainy Saturday morning and tackle the major cleaning well-prepared. This means you can rest longer and don't feel guilty every few days about having to clean the bathroom or tidy up the bedroom. Those who proceed systematically will finish things faster, work more effectively and be more motivated. That's why today our experts have brought step-by-step instructions that will show you how you can completely tidy up your entirehouseand bring it up to scratch and shine in just three hours.

Cleaning your apartment, where to start? Many people ask themselves this question. If you have now pulled yourself together and want to start cleaning the house, we will give you some great ideas on how your cleaning activities can be carried out quickly and efficiently. A key to success is “tidying up and cleaning systematically”. With our house cleaning plan, house cleaning is made easy. Check out our tips on how you can get your house in shape within 3 hours. This way, all rooms will be sparkling and clean within half a day.

We have many other exciting topics that we cover at homify. For example, take a look at this idea book if you are interested in smallprefabricated houses.We have some great houses for you at great prices.

The first step is the most difficult because it starts with a battle with our inner weaker self. But today there are no excuses. So: Get your butt off the couch, turn off the TV and let's go. We set our stopwatch and give ourselves ten minutes to prepare everything and equip ourselves with the necessary tools, devices and utensils. Important accomplices in the next three hours are vacuum cleaners, mops, cloths and rags, sponges, brushes and various cleaning products, a bucket with lukewarm water and a feather duster.

Before we look at theroomsindividually, we first have to do some general tidying up. Over the next 40 minutes, we go through every room and remove any items that are not in the desired location. Clothes that fly around go either in the laundry or back in the closet, used dishes are put in the dishwasher, what is no longer needed ends up in the trash, books go back on the shelf, etc. In this way, we have created an initial sense of order. We can clean without being disturbed and immediately feel much more motivated.

The next half hour belongs to the living room. Here we first dust and vacuum. The best way to do this is to first remove the coarsest crumbs with a handheld vacuum cleaner and then use the feather duster to do the finishing touches. Don't forget often neglected corners, shelves and table surfaces and wipe them thoroughly with a damp cloth. The floor is then thoroughly vacuumed and mopped. Important: Choose the right cleaner for the floor covering.

The kitchen often presents a particular challenge when tidying up and cleaning. Thanks to step one, we have already put everything in its place, removed used dishes and disposed of leftover food and other rubbish. Now it's time to clean. To do this, first vacuum the surfaces and the floor and then wipe the surfaces with a cloth and the corresponding cleaner. The stove and sink sometimes need particularly intensive attention with a sponge and polishing cloth so that everything shines and shines in the end. Finally, the floor is quickly mopped—and this room is finished.

After the kitchen comes the second problem child: the bathroom. We start by cleaning mirrors and surfaces with appropriate (glass) cleaners and microfibre cloths. Then we take care of the sink, shower and toilet. Important: For optimal hygiene, use different sponges and cloths and use hot water if possible, which kills the bacteria. Finally, the floor is vacuumed and mopped.

There's usually not much to do in the bedroom once the infamous piles of clothes are removed. While we remove and remake the bed, we ventilate it properly. Then we go over all surfaces with the feather duster and finally turn on the vacuum cleaner.

The remaining 15 minutes belong to the dining room and the hallway. When guests come, it should look particularly beautiful here. It's already tidied up, so it's time to dust the surfaces and then vacuum and mop the floor. Finally, we add a few fresh accents. How about, for example, fresh flowers in a vase, a beautiful scented candle or a room fragrance? All of these things ensure a pleasant living experience and guarantee that guests—and not least ourselves—feel right at home.

title: 13 Dazzling Terraces That You'll Want for Yourself
author: Press profile homify
article_paragraphs: Dreaming of a better way to decorate your outdoor space? Terraces are a space we often overlook, but it's a place we often spend a lot of time with our guests. Why not spruce it up a bit and make it more glamorous? There's plenty of options for taking your terrace up a notch — think adding nicer chairs with patterned cushions, installing a warm and cosy firepit, or even getting a professional to help you create a bar where you can serve your guests cocktails poolside. And with summer coming up, you won't want to miss the chance to make your backyard into a nirvana.
With this in mind, let's take a look at seventeen of the best terrace furniture ideas to get some inspiration for what you can do this summer. You'll never want to go back inside!
Wow — this view is incredible, but it's made even better when you can enjoy it by a warm fire on a cool summer night. We can imagine lounging here on those modern couches all summer.
Looking over a city? A terrace is a perfect place to have meals and enjoy a great view. This wooden dining table looks fabulous against the natural look of the fence.

This enclosed terrace is perfect for colder areas where you may not want the cold air rushing in! You can still enjoy the views and cuddle up on a nice couch. When everything's covered, you won't need weather-resistant furniture.

With the tiled backsplash of the kitchen, this terrace feels Spanish-inspired. We love the look of the wooden furniture, the woodstove oven, and the openness of the kitchen. Have you thought about turning your terrace into a kitchen?

If you have a terrace, why not make it even more functional by adding a hot tub? A professional can help you figure out your best options and pricing. It'll be well worth it when you can enjoy the view like this!
It's a classic look and you can't go wrong with a New England style terrace. With stripes and simple wicker furniture, you'll feel like you're on the Atlantic wherever you are.

This terrace feels different because of the limestone walls and metal table, which come together to create a unique look. You can recreate a similar look by mixing and matching different materials and textures when decorating your terrace.

Want to add some light? You can enjoy your terrace by night too, so don't forget to install enough lighting. Fairy lights are a popular option, but if you want an upgrade, then a professional can give you some tips on installing more permanent light fixtures.

Half-enclosed terraces are a great idea for enjoying the benefits of the indoors and the outdoors at the same time. This is the ideal situation if you want to enjoy a bar to serve drinks to guests. Make sure to use weather-resistant furniture in case of rain!

This all-white terrace looks fabulous thanks to the contrast with the dark wood furniture bases. The firepit is also a nice touch. We imagine this terrace would be a great place to enjoy with guests this summer!

If you're not looking for an extravagant look but still want a cosy terrace to enjoy on a quiet night, keep your furniture soft and add plenty of seating with pillows. It's still the perfect place to let loose or chill out!
All of that sun can be really harsh for your skin, so if you want to avoid too much sun exposure, make sure to have a professional help you install some overhead shades.
This modern but Greek-inspired patio looks spectacular. If you want to lounge around on your terrace, make sure to pick up some lounge chairs to really let yourself kick back.

title: The Colour Taupe in Interior Design: 15 Beautiful Living Ideas
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: Neutral colours are currently very popular when it comes to living. From sand to grey and from beige to white, trendsetters in the interior sector have been decorating their homes in a more subtle and reserved way when it comes to colours for a long time. At the top of the popularity scale is currently an exciting mixed tone of grey, brown and beige: taupe. Incidentally, there is no clear definition of when a shade can be called taupe and when not. In general, anything that lies somewhere between grey and brown can probably be called taupe. Sometimes the versatile trend colour even goes a little in the direction of old pink or violet. For this idea book, we took a look at ourinterior designers and decoratorsand brought you various living ideas for the colour taupe. Be inspired!

We begin our concentrated load of inspiration with abathroomin a light taupe tone. In addition to classic white, modern bathrooms are currently dominated by shades of sand and grey—or a successful mix of both, as can be seen in this example. The floor, wall tiles and bathtub panelling blend seamlessly into one another and the neutral taupe creates a beautiful contrast to the white of the rest of the furnishings without losing the harmony.
Would you like to also know more about somemodern colours for a chic and contemporary bathroom?

The colour taupe also looks great in thekitchen,as this example proves. The great thing about this trendy colour is that it is as cool as grey, but the brown component makes it look warmer and more natural. And thanks to its neutral effect, taupe is a perfect combination partner for all other colours or other taupe tones or similarly neutral shades.

Taupe is not only suitable for modern, minimalist interior design ideas with clear, straightforward lines but also comes into its own in the more playful, romantic version. Here we see a lovingly furnishedbedroomin a dreamy country house style, which uses a light taupe tone alongside clean white, making it particularly inviting and magical without appearing too kitschy.

Taupe is also the perfect choice for the floor. If brown is too warm and grey is too cold for you, then this trendy mixed tone is just right for you and can turn any room in your home into an absolute style highlight. Whether it's real wood parquet or laminate, tiles or carpet, whether in the kitchen, living room, bathroom or bedroom—taupe really can be found in every variation and for every taste.

Here is another example of the colour taupe in a modern bathroom, this time in a light colour. Clear lines, modern fittings and high-quality sanitary objects are the perfect partners for the neutral trend colour, which radiates homely warmth and cool elegance at the same time and turns every bathroom into a stylish wellness oasis.

Taupe can be used not only in the kitchen and bathroom or other rooms as a floor or wall colour. Even the smaller details look great in this trendy colour. Home textiles such as pillows, blankets and curtains or smaller decorative objects such as vases, figurines, candles or these pretty fabric hearts look super modern in taupe, yet warm and friendly and are the icing on the cake of any interior.

This bed is truly a dream in Taupe. The eye-catching headboard is complemented by pretty pillows and a bedspread—and you feel like you're in a luxury hotel. The great thing about taupe: There are seemingly endless different shades between brown and grey and they can all be wonderfully combined with other colours.

Taupe is also ideal for windows and their textile design. Whether it's a roller blind, curtain or drape, whether plain or patterned—a little taupe is a must these days. The perfect choice for anyone who is not only looking for reliable privacy and sun protection on the window but also wants to create a modern, timeless and homely interior.

Taupe is currently a particularly popular wall colour. No wonder: A wall in this tone looks much more exciting than boring white, friendlier than cool grey and cooler than beige. Another plus: Taupe goes with all styles, colours, materials and textures and always forms a reliable, stylish backdrop for all interior design ideas. So with taupe on the wall, you can only win.

Here we see a successful example of how well taupe harmonizes with other colours. The great sofa looks wonderful in front of the blue wall. The trendy colour is ideal for sofas, armchairs and other upholstered furniture anyway because it looks cosy and inviting, but at the same time stylish and timeless.

Taupe is particularly popular in the living room—both as a floor or wall colour and in the form of furniture and accessories. This way, you can furnish your living area in a trendy and modern way, but at the same time be sure that the whole thing won't be out of fashion again next season. Taupe will not be a thing of the past anytime soon.

Whether it's a guest toilet or a master bathroom—tiles in taupe are always a good idea if you can't decide between grey and beige. The contrast with white bathroom ceramics is particularly eye-catching without being too prominent. A real advantage of the trend colour: If you choose a light taupe tone, you can use it to design small mini-bathrooms, while a darker shade looks particularly good in large rooms.

Here we see another example of how well taupe goes with stronger colors. The colourful chairs look perfect in front of the neutral brown-grey wall. Regardless of whether you want to set accents with red, yellow, green, blue or pink details—taupe simply goes with everything and allows colourful colour partners to make a big statement.

From the living room to the dining area and from the bedroom to the hallway: with a wallpaper in dark taupe, every room can be impressively changed and given a new look. By the way, light furniture goes particularly well with darker tones on the wall, and dark furniture goes particularly well with light wallpaper.

Not only within our four walls but also outdoors, all signs are pointing towards taupe at the moment. Muted, smoky, grey-brown woods without a red or yellow tint are ideal here, as they naturally match the trendy shade perfectly. From the house facade to the patio flooring and the balcony furniture to the garden fence, you can design your outdoor area entirely in trendy taupe and remain completely natural.

title: 11 Wonderful Ideas For A Charming Seating Area In The Garden
author: Anne Krusche—HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: When the first rays of the sun appear in the sky, we are drawn outside into ourgarden.Here you can enjoy the good weather and nature in a relaxed and private way. What could be nicer than a cosy seating area that not only offers a lot of comfort but also beautifies the whole garden? Whether it is a spacious dining area, a small retreat or a charming bench—there are endless possibilities for integrating a cosy seating area in the garden. Ourlandscape architectshave brought you some fantastic ideas—see for yourself!

Where do you like to sit in your garden? By the pond or on the terrace? Is yourgardenseating area perhaps under an old tree? Most of us have our favourite spots where we like to make ourselves particularly comfortable. But even if you don't have a place yet, you will like our garden seating ideas. We will show you where a possible seating area could be in the garden. You will also get great tips on how to create a seating area in the garden or how to design an existinggardenseating area. We are excited to see which ideas you will implement in your garden!
If you want inspiration for unused corners in your garden, thisidea bookprovides you with a variety of ideas! So take a look now!

A wonderfully warm and cosy atmosphere emanates from this small seating area, which fits perfectly with the style of the rustic wooden house. Surrounded by lots of greenery and a beautiful flowerbed, a small seating area was created that offers an ideal retreat. A small tray with a fresh flower is all it takes to make this charming niche perfect.

Small corners are often empty because it is not always easy to use them for an additional seat. We think this charming wooden bench is a perfect solution for anyone who does not have space for largegarden furniture.

This Japanese-style garden is a true masterpiece and offers a unique sense of peace and harmony. Who wouldn't want to sit on these loungers and enjoy the view of the water and the artistically designed garden landscape?
Who would have thought that there would be room for a beautiful seating area next to the swing? Here you can watch the children play and enjoy a small snack or coffee at the same time.

This idea is further proof that garden sheds are no longer just about their functional properties. This wonderful wooden design offers an interior for equipment etc. as well as a sheltered terrace with comfortable garden furniture, green plants and an atmospheric floor lamp.

Whether for afternoon cake, summer breakfast or a barbecue: this centrally located seating area in the middle of the garden offers plenty of space for the whole family or friends and the trees create a wonderful shady spot from which you can see the whole garden.

Located right next to colourful flowers and a beautiful lemon tree is this simple seating area, which consists of an elongated table and a few chairs. The fresh, dark green fits wonderfully with the gorgeous garden and the rustic stone facade that we see in the background.

Natural materials are best suited to creating a cosy and warm garden atmosphere. In this case, the seating area was positioned next to a decorative stone wall. Together with the wooden furniture and some plants, a wonderfully fresh and harmonious ambience is created.

This terrace also impresses with its combination of stone and wood. Protected by a rustic stone wall, which even has small shelves and a window, a cosy area was created, which was also decorated with beautiful plants, flowers and statues.
Who says a new seating area in the garden always requires a lot of effort? In this example, two modern chairs and a colourful side table were added, giving the outdoor area a fresh and modern look.

Stylish and modern: Two loungers and a great parasol have been placed on a dark wooden floor, creating a wonderful holiday atmosphere. This seating area also feels cosy and protected thanks to the beautiful stone wall and variety of plants and flowers.

title: 17 Modern and Minimalist Home Designs to Inspire you
author: LEENA JHA HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: In this era of a fast-paced world, minimalism and simple living have become the new way of life. The professionalarchitectsare creating stunning design following the minimalist design philosophy. The minimalist architecture has become popular among the client and the modern family either building a new home or a house-hunting spree. Subtle design, simple materials, honest detailing, clean look that creates a calming feel, and the humble elegance it exudes make the minimalist home design quite appealing. Let’s take a tour of the minimalist homes for ideas and inspirations.
The elevated entrance, slanting grey roof and white exterior with perfect lines and angels of the poster windows in symmetrical style gives theminimalist homea regal and elegant look.
Clean lines and perfect angels, this minimalist design of the modern home, made of brick and mortar has an open and uncomplicated design.
The shine of the white, slanting roof, large windows of glass and the intricate jaali wall-cladding for privacy allow the sunlight and fresh air to seep inside; it’s a visual delight.
The solid concrete walls in its natural shade, clean lines and the concrete blocks stacked on it, this minimalist home is the epitome of elegance.
Glass, wood, concrete, stone, metals and the generous splash of greenery merge to create a minimalist home's beautiful exterior.
Three-way elegant home exterior dominated by massive glass windows and doors with acourtyardin the middle is the smart amalgamation of traditional and minimalist style.
Surrounded by nature, this house's simple detailing with slanting roof devoid of any flashy décor works to enhance the minimalist charm.
The simplicity in the house's form and design with an elevated portico, huge glass windows, slating roof covered in clay tiles, and the house exterior painted in light grey looks majestic.
Stone wall-cladding on the platform elevating the house, and the glass dominating the house exterior is a fine blend of style and elegance in this minimalist style house.
The minimalist design philosophy is all about playing with simplicity like this entire house exterior styled in different colours of the same colour grey on wall-cladding and thewall colour.

Glass guardrail, glass windows and doors, stone and metal boundary wall and exterior gate with wood striking a balance on the ceiling, floor and first-floor wall-cladding; this minimalist house is drenched in luxury and elegance.
Clean exterior in three different shades, the grey, brown and white with an open balcony with glass railing; this simple minimalist home is devoid of any decoration and looks chic and stylish.

The combination of dark and light grey on the two floors designed to be stacked one above the other with symmetrical glass windows and stone wall as the boundary combines to create a perfect minimalist-style home exterior.
Glass doors and windows dominate this minimalist house exterior. The white walls, extended roof, and long wooden panels on the upper deck give the home a warm and welcoming feel.
Strategic use of materials, colours, and texture creates visual magic and brings in a serene personality in this minimalist-style house.

Minimalist design philosophy believes in uncomplicated style. Take a clue from this two-storey house with covered patio, the concrete wall in the ground floor and wall to the wall glass window on the two-floors above, protected by metal railings of thebalcony.
The pure and pristine look of the white house creates an elegant exterior of the house. The graceful presence breaks the monopoly of white of large French windows covered in glass.
Check these white house exterior for inspiration:10 Modern Houses with White Exterior Shining Bright

title: 8 Attractive Kitchen Shelves Ideas
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: The most easy way to upgrade a kitchen is to remove closed cabinets and replace them with open shelves. These could be in the form of floating shelves one above the other of the same size and with similar amount of space between each shelve or a mix of small and large shelves suited to specific needs. Besides being easy to manage and clean, open shelves make it fairly easy to find essentials when needed instead of hunting through cabinets. Here are some examples of wall mounted open shelves inkitchenssome of which are also detachable and can be fitted into any kitchen to suit changing demands of storage.

In this nearly all white Scandinavian style kitchen the wooden cubby style open shelf located just below white cabinets is of the idea size and depth to store emergency essentials like tissues, condiments, spices, tasting ladles and small bowls.

In several kitchens open shelves surround a cooking range and are evenly spaced so that the entire wall looks balanced. But depending on your storage requirements open shelves can be placed right opposite the cooking area like here which serves as a barrier between kitchen and other parts of the house. The open shelves are built into the wall and are of mixed sizes making it easy to store a wide variety of kitchen essentials.
In abuilt-in kitchenlike this where nearly all the gadgets are neatly arranged in their respective slots it is important to have custom designed storage to maintain symmetry.

Open shelves running along the entire length of the kitchen wall is easy to reach out for items and also to put them back let us consider something different too. Here are open shelves at the right angle that make effective use of corner spaces. As corners are usually left unused or applied to hang knives, scissors or other implements why not make shelves to store lesser used kitchen gadgets like hand blenders, vegetable carvers or small cutlery and bowls.

This open plan kitchen located at one corner of a spacious layout is designed entirely from metal and has end to end copper cabinets that give it a strong personality. While every item is neatly ensconced in its respective niche within the cabinets there is an open alcove style shelf at its heart that lightens up the somber atmosphere of this modern kitchen.

In a small kitchen storage space is also limited andkitchen plannersgenerally resort to sliding doors or upward flipping cabinet doors to save space. Here the cubby style shelve has been given added dimension by spreading it all along the bottom section of cabinet to create reachable storage above the sink.
For a neat flawless kitchen resort to an open kitchen shelf plan like this where floating shelves of various sizes maintain the minimalist look.

This charming countryside kitchen shelf is built into the wall and designed entirely out of wood.  With neat cabinets built into the bottom section and open shelves on the upper section this design is perfect for storing and showing off designer glassware.
For more kitchen storage ideas do visitkitchen shelf designs that you can use in your modern house.

title: 20 Impressive Exteriors That Breathe Grandeur
author: Bishwadeep Mitra
article_paragraphs: We are too wary of our home interiors, paying little heed to what comprises the dialogue of our home with the rest of the world! Our minds keep getting confused with the innumerable bunch of options that surround us whenever we start to think of exterior paint colors. Let’s accept it: it is a daunting task, to say the least! The main obstacle in the path of making decisions in relation to choosing exterior paint colors is the notion of permanence attached to it. Sure, you can’t shuffle the wall colors as radically as you can swap and shift the interior design of your rooms.

But keep this simple tip in mind: if theinteriors of your homereflect your personality, the exterior paints exude the first impression. This is the reason I curated this list of 20 grand and eloquent exteriors, all of which will organically fit your palette of creativity and interior design plans. Check them out.

The titled, tiled roof, with the bricks laid in a seemingly random assortment of shapes and sizes looks so elegant, and we thought it would be best to delve a bit more attention to its different exteriors.
Just adjacent to the beautiful brick walls, this hint of a modern design stands and creates a signature of its own. The contrast of the colors is what appeals to the eyes.

This short series is for those readers where they may face painting restrictions. Seeking this entire idea may blend perfectly in a neighbourhood despite other contrasting & modern designs standing side by side.
A simple grand welcome with a hint of the ember days of the previous century, the 1960s! The interplay of the different shades of brown is reminiscent of the warmth.
How do you feel about a terrific time warp altogether? Like in the quaint neighbourhoods of Midwest, these shades of exterior paint color can ooze out exactly what you are looking for.
You might like to wonder at the simplicity involved in this exterior wall design. It is minimalist and cost effective.
Often a simple white goes a long way in establishing a message. The walls of glass further assert dominance within the landscape as well as protrude the white shade even more.
I included it in the list to take you closer to the feeling that comes from having a grand window that overlooks the city.
The red and brown of the bricks emote differently while the portion of the exterior paint colors underneath take you to a different world.
Also, have a look at the shapes, lines, and the complete absence of curves that have been used alongside a rare choice of exterior paint colors to create a signature.

An elegant choice when it comes to going minimalist and simple. If you are looking for more such designs that embrace their minimalist existence, you would love to check out this list of professional designers andpainters.
The red exterior surpasses the original woody exterior in the beauty of its appeal and lets you transcend to another period of peace and joy!

This is a grand exterior for a bungalow or even a duplex. The warm yellow blends perfectly with its surroundings, which is also congruent with the stark and perpendicular appearance of the overall structure. Homify is the seminal storehouse of all such beautiful exteriors adorned with elegant interior designs.

This exterior paint color and style seems like a slice of any Hollywood rom-com, a distinct feel-good and optimistic appearance that you can also consider. Notice how the perpetual blandness glows in the sunlight.
When it comes to hitting on nostalgia, a combination of crimson and green with a mix of multiple windows is the best choice.
Such elegant exteriors will only hide the beauty of curved walls matching up to the ceilings inside.
Nothing matches in grandeur when your exterior paint color resembles the sky. Even if your home isn’t magnanimous, playing with different shades of blue is always fun!
How about mixing large tracts of white and a brown tiled roof and placing it amidst all the glory of nature? Check out this beautiful exterior and ponder on the choice.
Closely resembling the modern look in many aspects, you can have an eye out for such designs in apartments surrounded by greenery to this extent. The yellow exterior is versatile.
