Sometimes a counter can be not only a place to sit but also a room divider. And that is exactly what was solved perfectly in the mini kitchen. The small black bar creates a visual separation between the living room and the kitchen. Yellow, stylish bar stools are a real highlight in the room.

Of course, the kitchen is one of the rooms that should always be well-lit, either by daylight or artificial light. In the second case, it should be perfectly placed when it comes to the appropriate lighting of a counter. The lighting situation is beautifully solved at this white, elongated bar. In addition, the white fronts and walls of the kitchen contribute to the brightness, although there are hardly any windows available.

There are now countless chairs and counters available in stores—for every taste, in every colour and the desired style. The best thing to do is to browse through specialist magazines, kitchen studios or the Internet.
If space allows, this is a great way to add a counter to your kitchen. This works particularly well in open-plan living spaces.

Bars and counters for kitchens are available in any design, as we want to show with this example. If you don't like the off-the-shelf models on offer, individual fronts can be attached to the standard modules.

You can create a small bar in the kitchen even if the space is small. For example, a worktop can be extended a little to accommodate one or two bar stools. This creates a small dining area that is extremely practical and doesn't get in the way.

Sometimes the shape of the room makes it difficult to imagine a small dining area in the kitchen. This picture is a good example of this. Because the room is not only elongated but also has a small wall that protrudes into the room, there is hardly any space for a table. Luckily, thekitchen plannershad a good idea and installed an extremely narrow worktop on the right-hand wall that opens up towards the end. Everything is also well-lit through the window above.
A small, movable bar like this is great for very small kitchens. You won't be able to eat a four-course meal here, but it's enough for a quick morning coffee.

As we see time and again, wood is one of the most popular materials in kitchens—including kitchen counters. And for good reason: the variety of wood types always creates new looks, no matter what style you are pursuing. And because the material is easy to paint, wood is particularly versatile.

This modern-style bar is set on two levels, giving it an interesting accent. This is reinforced by the two-tone design of the counter with a black base and white table tops. Theoretically, the upper worktop can be used as a work surface, while the lower one can be used in a classic way for eating and drinking.

The last example not only has a practical meaning but also serves the structure of the room. The elongated counter intelligently divides the kitchen and living areas. We think this is a good solution even for the tightest of spaces!

title: With These Tips You Can Recognize a Load-bearing Wall!
author: Simone Orlik
article_paragraphs: Those of us who have already remodelled a house know this challenge: Older buildings often have a room layout that is hardly up to date today. Hallways are long and narrow, and rooms used to be closed-off spaces just for cooking. Theliving roomsthemselves were small and manageable. Over the decades, the needs of today's society have changed—and with them the houses. We attach great importance to living our everyday lives in our houses as openly as possible.

That's why it's almost always necessary to tear down certain walls in old houses to create larger rooms. However, this step requires a certain amount of specialist knowledge. Not every wall can be removed so easily for structural reasons. We have an overview of the details provided by ourarchitects.

Today, our idea book is about the exciting topic of load-bearing and non-load-bearing walls. After all, walls play a crucial role, especially in the context of interior design and layout. To decide which walls can be torn down and which cannot, you should—in addition to looking at the building plans—also ask aninterior architect.A professional knows which is a load-bearing roof beam and which wooden beam supports the wall, etc. How thick is a non-load-bearing wall? Or how can I recognize a load-bearing wallattic? Can I build a load-bearing wall? We answer all of these questions for you!
Once you've finished planning your walls, it's time to decide on the colour scheme for them.Hereyou'll find great inspiration for large and small rooms!

A basic detail for understanding whether we are dealing with a load-bearing or non-load-bearing wall is usually determined by the position of the wall within the house. Thick external walls, for example, are usually load-bearing walls, because the entire structure of the building rests on them, such as the rooms above, ceilings and walls, as well as the roof. It is more difficult with internal walls in the house. If walls are stacked on top of each other over several floors, they could be load-bearing walls. Sometimes knocking on the wall can help to hear what the masonry is like. Our tip: always get an expert on board for an assessment. Because possible later damage to the house can be immense.

In multi-storey buildings, retaining walls can be identified by looking from bottom to top. This is because the walls that are closer to the ground often have very thick walls that have a load-bearing function, and rooms are placed one above the other on each floor to dissipate forces. Other walls in the upper part of the building are sometimes thinner or made of a non-load-bearing material such as wood or MDF boards. These can be removed without any problems. However, electrical or water pipes could run through them. Therefore, a detailed inspection is also mandatory here! The load-bearing walls on the lower floors must remain unchanged so that the building does not become unstable.
We recommend this idea book for you:The Best Interior Design Hacks for Round Walls.

Load-bearing walls can vary in thickness depending on the material used and the type of structure. That's why it's important to have the wall carefully inspected by a professional. Walls made of reinforced concrete, sand-lime brick or concrete are usually load-bearing. So don't just tear them down with a sledgehammer! Partition walls made of plasterboard or bricks are easier. As a rule, you can assume that a wall is load-bearing if the masonry is 17.5 centimetres or thick.

Walls often consist not only of the wall material itself but also come with various frames or supports. These are also part of the overall statics and must remain in place before being inspected by an architect or carpenter. Incidentally, half-timbered houses should be looked at separately when it comes to statics. Houses with wooden frames were built less according to technical standards than based on the extensive experience of local craftsmen. This is why the statics in such a house can be misleading.

In this example, we also see a living space through which large wooden beams and supports run through the visible area, bearing the weight of the rooms above. When inspecting an older house, always keep an eye out for beams like this somewhere.

If a building has not been built correctly, normally non-load-bearing interior or partition walls suddenly behave as load-bearing walls. Therefore, if you suspect this, it is best to consult a specialist before tackling such walls. Also, pay close attention to the statics of wooden beam ceilings. In most cases, load-bearing masonry is perpendicular to the span of the wooden beams.

What have we learned? Never tear down a wall if you are not sure whether it can bear the weight of a building or not. And even if you think you know, you should call in a professional. Because once damage has occurred, it is very difficult to repair.

title: Magnolia Colour—15 Inspirations Between Rosé and Beige
author: Mel—homify
article_paragraphs: Inspired by one of the most wondrous and beautiful trees, the magnolia comes with a special colour trend:Magnolia. Playing delicately between rosé and beige and with a matt to pearly finish, Magnolia can be found more and more ininterior design.

Wall colours, pieces of furniture and classic kitchens are pampered by Magnolia and given an elegant timelessness. What makes this wondrous colour? To understand this, this idea book looks at its neighbours: rosé, beige, grey and white. Get inspired by the following ideas and designs.
Magnolia has been found in thekitchenfor several years. It meets all the requirements for a natural and generally simple kitchen design.
In many kitchens, there is a lot of life even without an impressive colour scheme. For this reason, Magnolia stays discreetly in the background.
Magnolia's palette ranges between rosé and beige. Therefore, combinations with these colours are not surprising.
Rosé always brings something luxurious and underlines the uniqueness of an interior. Like the tree that gives it its name, shades like these shine in a noble light.
>Modern Kitchen Designs For Stylish Homes.

Tileswith a glossy or matt surface shine with an extra dose of decadence with Magnolia and its sister shades. This gives the bathroom or kitchen a wonderfully individual touch, excellently combined with white and gold-coloured elements.
Like Magnolia, sand grey is a rediscovered colour. Its natural charisma gives every kitchen a special level of homeliness and underlines timeless designs in the country house or modern range.
It is often not clear where exactly a sandy grey ends and a creamy magnolia begins but then, it's all about dressing your kitchen in a charming colour that suits you.

Lighting elements and lamps have a significant influence on perception. Accordingly, soft colours such as magnolia also react to the light and temperature of the lighting. The warmer the light, the more yellow a Magnolia wall can appear.
In this idea book, you will finddazzling lighting ideas and tips for small kitchens.
With the right colour scheme, a bathroom can be transformed into a wellness oasis in no time. The facets from beige to magnolia to rosé can create excellent tone-on-tone shades.
The room gains in plasticity and welcomes you with a warmth and clarity that can enhance any bathroom.
Particularly light-colouredfurnitureis suitable for combination with the colour Magnolia. Natural wood begins to shine in front of a Magnolia wall and is thus placed in a unique light.
In addition, black frames or floor lamps are also an interesting decoration for Magnolia designs.
In thebedroom,shades of beige and magnolia can create a calming and cosy atmosphere.
Combined with white accents, this creates a special kind of resting place. You can concentrate on the most important thing in the world. Sleeping.
Natural light coming through the windows of your house makes Magnolia shine in iridescent colour gradients.

In an interior room, the colour appears completely different than near windows and doors. With this in mind, when designing the walls, it is always worth doing a test painting to find out which shade is best suited to the room.
Upholstered furniture with rose-coloured covers is a fresh expression of luxurious living. They can be perfectly combined with magnolia-coloured living elements.
If the upholstery also has a velvety surface, a modern and upscale look can be created. Interior designs like these work well in both city apartments and rural properties.
Magnolia combined with green elements creates a confident ambience. The green tones are given an extra portion of charm, with Magnolia elegantly taking the lead.
It's not so much about a coordinated choice of colours. Rather, two relatively unequal poles are contrasted here—a room in magnolia with green is a lively place for self-confident residents.

Powdery rosé sweetens your home and appear relaxed and reserved. To balance it out and not trivialize it, you can combine it very well with black decorations and brown-coloured elements. This way the lightness of the Magnolia sister is somewhat grounded and it appears balanced.
Magnolia and wood are a match made in heaven. Natural woods and light glazes in particular complement the colour.
They join in and make transitions between living areas such as the kitchen and dining room smooth. Design elements of this type unfold together timelessly and elegantly.
If a magnolia has enough room to develop as a colour, it quickly becomes a design statement.

Colours like these are particularly popular in modern interior designs that tend towards minimalism. It can fill a room with naturalness and elegance and the next moment it discreetly fades into the background.
The Magnolia colour in the kitchen is a classic. The elegant restraint of this colour wraps itself around the kitchen furniture like a soft-focus veil and gives it a fresh look for a long time.
Accordingly, this nuance between rosé and beige is a timeless companion for modern interiors and underlines the value of modern living culture.

title: The Right Colour for Your Facade – What You Need to Know
author: Catherina Bernaschina
article_paragraphs: Does yourhousefacade need a new coat of paint? Or do you simply want to give your house a different colour look? A new coat of paint on the facade is like a face mask: sometimes the applied layer brings a little refreshment, but sometimes a complete renovation is just desperately needed. Whendesigninga facade, personal taste is the most important criterion. But not everything that you like is allowed and within the scope of what is possible. Factors to be taken into account include the surroundings, the choice of the right colour system and the size and location of the building. We will show you step by step what you need to pay attention to when choosing a colour so that the new paint lasts as long as possible and your neighbours turn green with envy when they see your facade.

The colour of a house facade not only determines the character of a building but also shapes the neighbourhood and its surroundings. You can't go wrong if you choose white as the base colour. With striking colours such as pink or blue, great caution is advised, as there is a risk that the colourful building will dominate the entire neighbourhood and look completely out of place. Your personal choice of colour should always harmonize with the context, i.e. fit in with the overall concept. On the one hand, this means that the house paint does not stand out too much concerning the neighbouring houses. On the other hand, the colour should also be chosen in harmony with the building parts such as the balcony, garage and roof. These days, you can find out whichfacadecolour suits your house and its surroundings with the help of colour simulators and 3D planners that allow you to try out different colour variants of the house. Many municipalities stipulate what is legally permitted, which is why it is best to get information directly from the responsible office before starting your work.

There are colours such as yellow and orange that convey warmth and security. Then there are colours such as blue or turquoise that radiate coldness. The same applies to the different facade materials available: reddish-orange to earth-brown Corten steel or wooden facades are often associated with naturalness and warmth, while grey aluminium and fibre cement make the facade appear cold. So when choosing colours and materials, always keep in mind what effect the new paint should have. Of course, there are other aspects to consider when choosing colours and materials. If you do not want to achieve your desired colour on the house facade with a new coat of paint or plaster, but with a specific material, then you must find out as much as possible about the respective material properties, including maintenance effort and costs of the corresponding facade cladding. When choosing colours and materials, be sure to get advice from a specialist such as anarchitect.He will be able to tell you which of the many facade systems best suits the condition of your house wall.
With a dark grey facade, you are definitely on trend right now. The advantage of a neutral tone is that it is timeless. You won't get tired of it so quickly.

This premium facade paint in professional quality impresses with many advantages: self-cleaning through the lotus effect, high CO2 and water vapour permeability, protection against algae and fungal infestation, extreme weather resistance, low emissions and solvent-free, lightfastness and a huge selection of colours.

For a colourful facade paint, you need to know that it not only has to look good, but first and foremost it has to protect the building. The quality of facade paints depends largely on the properties of the binding agent they contain. Facade paints with a high binding agent content, such as pure acrylate, are considered to be particularly colourfast and durable. Ready-mixed dispersion silicate paints are also popular because they are easy to use and offer good rain protection. Dispersion paints are among the all-rounders among facade paints. They are moisture-repellent, permeable to water vapour and are also available in many colours (including strong and unusual ones). Silicone resin paints are part of the luxury class of facade paints. They are extremely permeable to water vapour, and water-repellent and provide effective protection against fungal and algal infestation.

It makes a big difference whether you redesign just one wall or the entire facade. After all, paint and materials cost money. A compromise can be to set a nice accent by painting the most exposed side of the house. Keep in mind that the size and shape of the house also influence how the colour looks. For example, it is not advisable to use bright and eye-catching colours for the entire building, as they can be very obtrusive in context. The location of the house also plays a key role in the colour effect, as the colour appears in a different light depending on the sunlight. In addition, constant and intense exposure to light—for example on south-facing walls—causes colourful facade paints to fade over time, similar to rain.

If you are painting the facade yourself, you must prepare the surface accordingly before painting. Make sure that it is clean, dry, without cracks and stable. For a long-lasting, beautiful result, you must carry out a visual inspection, i.e. remove defects such as discolouration, loose paint, old plaster, dirt, algae and moss. The best way to do this is with water and a brush or, even more efficiently, with a high-pressure cleaner. For an even and absorbent surface, you then apply a facade primer. Before doing this, cover all windows, doors and other openings that could get dirty with masking film. Before the main coat, use a facade roller to apply a primer diluted by ten to 15 per cent so that the paint appears richer and adheres better. You can then apply the second and final facade coat undiluted.

The first impression counts. This wisdom also applies to a house. If the building looks run-down from the outside, you don't want to look inside. Impressive living rooms and other rooms often await us here. An attractive exterior, on the other hand, looks inviting. A house facade needs a new coat of paint about every ten years. Of course, the time intervals also depend on how damaged and dirty the house wall surface is. If there is major damage, don't wait too long, because the more time you let pass, the more expensive the entire facade renovation will be for you. Also plan the weather conditions when painting: weather that is too hot, too cold or too wet will damage the paint. The same applies to direct sunlight when painting, as the paint dries too quickly. For optimal colour results, it is best to paint in spring or autumn when the temperature is mild and the sky is clear. Don't forget: always stir the paint well before applying it!
As you have seen, adding colour to the facade of a house is not that easy. You have to put a bit of thought into it.

When you think about the colour choice and style of your facade, you should also include the design of yourgarden.Depending on the style you pursue in yourgarden,the house facade should also be designed accordingly. Do you have lots of blooming flowers, and playful elements, mainly lawns? Ornate, colourful, traditional or modern—there are many possibilities. Once the style has been decided, the question now arises:
Painting the facade – which colour? After all, the house colours are at least as important as the style.

title: 42 Fantastic Ideas To Have A Small Garden Full Of Charm!
author: Isabel Rodríguez
article_paragraphs: Outdoor spaces are a perfect setting to indulge in the pleasure of rest and leisure. Terraces, patios and gardens become, especially in the summer, a real attraction to mitigate fatigue, high temperatures or organize a meeting with friends and family. Regardless of their size, these spaces are capable of recharging our energies and making us live unforgettable moments.

In this book of ideas we offer you a journey through inspiration. We sneak into more than 40 smallgardensdecorated with a lot of charm in which the small details make big differences. Decorative accessories, vertical gardens, outdoor furniture or original lights are just some of the fantastic ideas that you will find in the examples that we have selected for you, original and accessible resources that you can incorporate into your small garden to make it exude personality.
Also read42 ideas to create a small and surprising garden.
Drawing attention to the elements that define your small garden is a fantastic idea to make all eyes focus on a specific point, ignoring its dimensions.

A small flower bed with plants of different species and sizes will give your garden an element with its own character. By wisely choosing the right flowers and shrubs you can create a space that causes a great visual effect.

Beyond the vegetation, using different materials whendesigningyour small garden will make it look much more beautiful. Stone, for example, is a raw material whose presence fills spaces with elegance, including exterior ones.
Try delimiting a small garden area with a flower pot made of wood. The warmth of this material combined with the vegetation will give your small garden an exotic and attractive air.

Ingenuity is essential when designing spaces in which the meters are not too generous. If your garden is small, you can always opt for a vertical composition to add a touch of charm to the scene without having to sacrifice a single extra centimeter.

Another fantastic idea that you can put into practice when designing your small garden has to do with plants. A wise choice of the species that best adapt to the particular conditions of the terrain or climate will make this space always look spectacular.
Even the smallest space can become an aesthetically very attractive small garden and, if not, look at the result of integrating it into a concrete hallway. Simply spectacular.

The minimalist concept of less is more also has a place in the design of small gardens . The example that we propose in this image is committed to combining bushes and plants of different sizes with materials such as stone that, in short, make this space an elegant and cozy place without excesses.

If what you want is to fill your outdoor patio with life, there is nothing like reserving a corner to create a small garden full of charm like this one. A few plants on a stone stage will give it the personal touch you need.
Choose the most appropriate plants so that the climate does not influence the beauty of your small garden.

Don't be scared off by their thorns, cacti are a highly recommended species for your small garden and, regardless of their resistance, well combined, they can give life to compositions that could well pass for authentic works of art.
Any space, no matter how small, is susceptible to hosting a small garden. The area under the stairs is an original and creative solution.
And continuing with the idea of taking advantage of every corner… why not create your small charming garden on the windowsill? Reinvent your spaces to fill your home with life.
A small Zen-style garden to welcome you at the entrance of the house.
Water, stone and even bamboo, main ingredients of a small oriental-inspired garden.
With brick as a backdrop, this small garden delimited by the forcefulness of the stones, offers a very cozy aesthetic of contrasts of rustic inspiration.

Do you know the upcycling design trend? It is a trend based on the reuse of objects that, originally, were conceived for purposes that have nothing to do with their final destination. These chalices converted into pots are a good example of this.

The fantastic effect caused by the sinuosity of the lines that delimit this small garden is only comparable to the aesthetic appeal that is derived from the mixture of tones of its plants and materials, a fascinating chromatic dialogue for a space filled with a lot of character.

Incorporating a fountain into your small garden is another of the fantastic ideas that we want to propose to you if you are thinking about designing your green area. The wide variety of models and materials makes it difficult not to find the perfect piece for all types of gardens.

The maximum use of the available space is the hallmark on which the approach of this small garden is based. Floor and walls are completely colonized by different types of plants that rest on as many pots with very original aesthetics.

If what you are looking for is to give a contemporary look to your small garden, a composition based on geometry like the one you see in the image is a fantastic idea that will bring you closer to your purpose.

The curved lines are once again the protagonists in the design of this green area that reserves the space closest to the wall to a flowerbed area, freeing the rest for the installation of grass. A border in the form of a wooden fence is responsible for delimiting each of the areas.

When we think of a garden, we are often struck by the vision of large green expanses. However, you can give life to a small green area that complements the design of your terrace by placing several planters that attract attention and allow you to add a very natural touch to your outdoor spaces.

If you don't have much space or an area where there is too much sun, there is no reason to worry. You can take advantage of any corner of your patio to create your small garden by choosing plants that do not need too much light.
Incorporate different areas within your small garden to fully exploit its functionality.

If you have a large outdoor garden but want to differentiate the area closest to the entrance of your house, the ideal is that, at the exact point where both spaces come together, you create a composition with its own personality. Some brightly colored flowers, a stone wall or a change in the materials used will be enough.
Climbing plants are ideal for small spaces or, in other words, they are a fantastic idea for creating attractive designs in small gardens by taking advantage of the height space.

Water is an element of capital importance in the design of gardens that embrace the most oriental inspiration. If the fountains do not attract attention, you can incorporate the aqueous medium in the form of a pond, giving life to an ecosystem with a life of its own.
The incorporation of aquatic elements in the form of fountains or ponds will give your small garden a very characteristic freshness.
Take advantage of the presence of plants in your garden to reinforce its privacy or delimit different uses.

A good way to draw attention to your small garden is to provide it with adequate lighting. In this example, the beauty of the proposal is enhanced thanks to the lights that emerge from the ground, drawing attention to the palm trees and creating a most exotic atmosphere.

Whenever dimensions allow, installing a covered area in the form of a pergola or gazebo will give your small garden a unique charm. The idea of having a romantic and intimate space is the most appropriate for those who want to enjoy their outdoor areas in the best company.
A lawn is a classic in gardens of any size.
Create attractive terrace designs and fill your small garden with colour.
Blend your garden with the surrounding nature by delimiting the area to be occupied with rocks that evoke the Mediterranean charm.

Interior decorators and designers like to look for balanced and harmonious spaces, a consideration also applicable to the configuration of outdoor areas. In this example, every one of the elements that are part of the green area intermingle in perfect harmony offering an overwhelming appearance.

Another classic idea when planning gardens, small or large, is to reserve a space for recreation and relaxation. A simple stone pavement and outdoor furniture in the form of a white bench give life to this proposal full of charm in a no less attractive garden.

If you want your small garden to look perfect all year round, it is interesting to use perennial plants. Spread them over the floor and walls, flooding every corner with greenery to give life to an enveloping and seductive atmosphere like this one.
Bet on impossible shapes giving life to a garden with a unique design with a very personal imprint.
Here is another example in which a well-lit pond becomes the protagonist of the garden design. If you have a large garden, you can even opt for ponds that resemble natural pools.
Introduce seasonal plants to renew the image of your small garden so that it is always perfect.

Whatever the size of your garden, remember that the choice of plants will have a direct effect on its final image. Different colours, species and dimensions guarantee attractive results adapted to all tastes.

After filling this article with a good amount for your small gardens, below we bring you some slightly different ideas, to get away from the size of these spaces a little. We tend to think that gardens are exclusively for the outdoors. The truth is that it is ideal, that nature develops outside, but certain species need special conditions for which we create indoor gardens. In this way, we bring vegetation to more closed spaces than usual, we create the right conditions for the planted species and we manage to bring the joy of the outdoors inside our home.

We like to see how home gardens develop, especially if they are colourful. During all times of the year, a garden can look spectacular. And this can only be achieved if you have professionals who know what species to plant, how to locate them, what shapes and volumes to achieve, etc. These professionals are landscape designers, who know perfectly everything that is related to vegetation, outdoor furniture, maintenance and irrigation systems.

To tell the truth, I'm sure someone has asked themselves the question:I don't have a garden, what should I do?Well, very easy: in the absence of a garden, a good terrace is the best alternative! In the pandemic circumstances we find ourselves in, outdoor spaces have resurfaced, so it is a good time for you to give a more personal and vigorous touch to your terrace. Use your imagination or consult with professionals, and create a garden area that makes you feel like you are in a beautiful garden. Keep in mind that having so many plants at home, you have to create an irrigation system, whether automatic or planning to do it yourself by hand. It is important to keep plants well-fed and watered so that they look in all their splendour, and that they can decorate your garden or terrace in the best possible way.
A great idea for small spaces! Take advantage of the walls and add a touch of decoration by integrating nature into your interiors and/or exteriors.

title: Modern Industrial Style Home full of rustic charm
author: LEENA JHA HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: The humble intention of renovating the single-story to a double-story with a modern minimalist design theme and maximum space utilization to make it feel spacious resulted in a modern industrial home bubbling with rustic charm. The home décor has everything from a no-fuss aesthetic that highlights the elegance of natural materials to the industrial feel of concrete and metal. The professionalarchitectsofN O T ARCHITECTURE SDN BHDin Petaling Jaya, Selangor, have done fantastic work defining the private and semi-private space of the home, keeping them separate yet visually connecting them. The home décor exhibits modern industrial design philosophy with a rustic style that effortlessly mingles to make the house stylishly contemporary.

The smart combination of the different shades of grey on thefaçade, the metal gates and railing in the balcony, picture windows, and the vibrant potted balcony garden is in sync with the neighbourhood skyline and at the same time gives a subtle clue of what’s hidden inside.

Three old scooters of the children hung on the wall, an antique mirror on the concrete wall creates a rustic ambiance right at theentrance hallway, boldly projecting the old-style home décor in the modern world.

The concrete slabs with gaps between each step and the sturdy metal guardrail merged to build a modern stairway of the house. The house has a semi-private living and dining room on the first floor. Hence, the stairway's strategic placement directly takes the guest to the upper floor without disturbing the ground floor's privacy.

A room with a music corner, a swing chair, a low coffee table, and anindoor gardenis a perfect relaxing spot for the family. The place gets flushed with natural light and air with full height glass doors and windows opening in the outdoor garden.

The double-height ceiling connecting both the floors creates an illusion of spaciousness. The overall décor boasting exposed wooden beams with hanging lamps at regular intervals and electrical pipes with spotlights fixed on the wall show modern industrial style interior décor. The split ceiling design is quite a smart way to install sun windows for natural light on the roof.

Rustic style décor emphasizes natural elements and highlights minimalist living. The concrete wall in a natural shade, the sloped ceiling, and large glass doors opening in the balcony inundates the open-planliving roomwith natural light.

Theopen-plan kitchen/ dining room has an industrial style look and feel with concrete and wood, rustic style chairs, stools, and dining table, designed to create an informal atmosphere. The big library adds up to the flavour creating an exciting and innovative décor perfect for the family who loves to entertain.

A mezzanine floor above the dining space makes room for family fun activities. The mini-rock climbing on the wall for the children will keep them engaged for a long time. Here also, space is flooded with natural light through the semi exposed linear trusses split roof.

The playful addition of a slide on the staircase side is designed to enchant the children and make the young relive childhood again. Climb up the stairs and zoom down the slide; it will be an exciting indoor physical activity.

The vintage round top door fits perfectly in the modern industrial décor to enhance the space's elegance and make it chic and trendy. The beauty of the vintage style is that it never goes out of fashion.
Get more ideas of vintage decoration:Vintage decoration ideas

title: 21 Fantastic Ideas for the Garden Right on Your Doorstep
author: Janin Istenits
article_paragraphs: When designing their own home, many builders consider the garden to be crucial. It is the first thing visitors and neighbours see, so it must be well-maintained and make an excellent first impression. Garden enthusiasts enjoy spending time in the front garden and appreciate the details that make an entrance area look attractive and inviting. Our professionalgardenershave found fantastic ideas for gardens that are right for your doorstep—small spectacles of nature guaranteed to put a smile on your face.
It is particularly beautiful when the entrance area is lined with flowering shrubs, as in this example – plant the pots and sweeten the way to the front door for yourself and all visitors!
If you like it a little bigger, you should go for trees—they also serve as a perfectprivacy screenfor your terrace, garden or balcony.
Many builders also rely on unusual details when designing their homes – and simply decorate the house wall with flowering greenery.
You can also play around with different planting methods when designing your front garden. How about placing potted plants in the frontgardenin summer in addition to the hardy plants?
When gardening, don't just concentrate on the flowering plants, bushes and trees. Also keep an eye on the lawn, which should always be well cared for!
Do you love an orderly overall picture? Then you should take a look at the garden in the picture above, which completely completes the adjacent terrace!

In addition, gardening does not have to be expensive at all; simply use things that are already there or do not cost much—such as the stones in the picture above, which now serve as a boundary for the new planting.
The garden should also look good at night – with the right lighting, this will work!
… this example also shows how harmonious the right lighting in the front garden can look.
If you like things more colourful, you should choose brightly coloured flowers when planting.
Or do you simply want to inspire with a highlight, like in this example?
Sometimes it is not the delicate details but the tall trees that attract all the attention.
When designing your garden, the perfect symbiosis between the house wall and the garden is also important; you should always keep that in mind!
Don't let yourself be limited in your work and play around with different methods—a few flower pots here, climbing plants there and a well-kept lawn, and your dream garden is ready!
Or how about a blooming flowerbed right on your doorstep?
Seating areasare becoming more and more common in front gardens.
… these seating areas are the icing on the cake and allow you to fully enjoy nature right on your doorstep.
Simply combine your lovingly designed garden with the terrace, which is protected from the sun by a pergola.
Planting can also work wonders in longer entrance areas and paths.
With all the design, don’t forget about maintenance – because lush planting in the garden also requires a lot of commitment!
When designing your garden, be inspired by current trends, contact experts and also consider the style of your house – then nothing can go wrong!

title: 13 Ideas For The Unused Corner In The Garden
author: Lisa—homify
article_paragraphs: Not only in the house but also in the garden, you often have a corner that you don't know what to do with. Either it is simply empty or the compost heap is placed there. But we think that this area should get a little more attention and thanks to our professionalgardeners,we have collected a few ideas about what you can do with the unused corner of the garden.
A fully equipped guest house is a great idea! Privacy for guests and also great for more storage space!
Who wouldn't like a secret retreat? A secluded corner in thegardencan be the perfect reading spot.
A little away from the hustle and bustle, a greenhouse can fill the gap perfectly. Our experts can also help you with this.
Do you have a pool? How about a changing room?
With a fireplace, it becomes cosy.
A cooking area also looks good in a corner of the garden and no smells come into the house.
The older children get, the more they need a place to retreat to. These tree tents are ideal for that.
Need we say more?
The kids want a swing, but you want a fancy garden? Simply place the play equipment a little away from the centre of the garden.
That's right. Rather than leaving the area bare, you might want to decorate this unused area with plants and accessories.
Garden hoses and other things that don't look particularly appealing can also be banished to the farthest corner of the garden.
Of course, you can also just let the unused corner grow over and attract lots of animals. This area will then require almost no maintenance.
Now that you've gotten to the end of this idea book, you can also check out this similar garden idea:42 Fantastic Ideas To Have A Garden Full Of Charm.

title: A beautiful spa in Selangor to soothe mind and body
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: In the fast paced lifestyle that we have today, relaxation of the body and mind is needed to rejuvenate and work with renewed vigor to achieve our goals. In this ideabook we are going to showcase and describe the details of a reflexology spa designed byLI A'ALAF ARCHITECTan interior design and architect firm located in Selangor. This beautiful spa has exquisite interiors, custom-made furniture and all the requisite amenities tied together within intelligent spaces designed for the comfort of the spa's clients.

From the stylish reception area to its interiors containing saunas and steam rooms, every section of the spa is avant garde and stylish. Interior designers have integrated cutting-edge technology and modern design to create intelligent customized layouts that prioritize the customer needs and comfort while creating aesthetically pleasing spaces. Although each section of the spa has been developed to contain different routines, their layout, color and designs reflect the activity for which they are destined. Let us explore every section of this beautiful spa.

This is a view of Reflexology Spa's stylish exteriors. The glass exterior shows teasing glimpses of the warm and inviting interiors that invoke curiosity to try out its hospitality. Stunningly beautiful lights placed strategically around the reception and waiting area create a strong impression of the Spa's personality without intimidating.

In a commercial outlet related to wellness and health the first impression is very important, which is why the designers have proposed a reception that is clearly divided into two environments. We start with the customer service area equipped with a modern counter and direct lighting that bathes the region with stylish lighting fixtures highlighting every detail.

Secondly, there is a visual barrier that does not completely obstruct the view towards the waiting environment, where a half wooden wall is designed with vertical wooden planks make a partial screen that defines two areas without dividing them.

Each section of the spa has a catalog of elements that make up the concept or maintain aesthetics consistency. This angle shows how well the simple wooden desk and other furniture pieces are made with the same cedar color finish that blends naturally with the wall paper and rustic style lighting arrangement used here. .

The waiting room is spacious and minimalist with just the right amount of furniture to maintain comfort and enhance feeling of spaciousness with limited elements. Within a spa it is necessary to install separate spaces for various activities but that should be done without departing from the decorative concept. Here the eclectic combination of warm brown, beige and white colors,  complement the interiors in a functional and aesthetic way.

The personalized care area of the spa must maintain a degree of privacy and tranquility. These environments can be achieved with closed cubicles or divisive spaces within a room, which has been charmingly achieved by these curtains to provide privacy. When working with small spaces where some luxuries cannot be adopted it is very important to provide solutions such as sliding/folding doors or curtains which create extra space and generate a good flow for clients moving through the space.

The installation of dividers and drywall structures allows a flexible adaptation of spaces and a much more practical and functional decoration. The adoption of the beige background and dark toned wooden details enhance the decorative pieces on this storage area in a simple way, giving personality to the place. The lovely ceramic plates, decorative vase and other details generate visual patterns through textures and sensations.
If interior design and luxury is your passion then theserelaxing design will impress you.

title: 20 Double Bedrooms With Fantastic Wall Ideas
author: Isabel Rodríguez
article_paragraphs: Who more and who less knows the magic that is breathed in a double bedroom? A space designed for rest but that, in the intimacy of its walls, houses many more experiences, encounters, confidences and, ultimately, unique inspired complicity among many other things, for a cosy and warm atmosphere.

It is precisely its walls that end up being key pieces in the design of this room in the home, a space designed by and for two that, in any case, responds to specific needs without leaving aside the aesthetic component. In this book of ideas, we propose a tour of around twenty romantic, cosy and intimate bedrooms but, above all, 20 rooms whose walls play a determining role when conceiving the space. Ready for a walk-through inspiration?

Don't panic, you won't have to set your bedroom on fire to give the wall the burned look we're looking for. A simple coat of paint will be enough to achieve the desired look, a contemporary finish suitable for all tastes.

Exposing a brick wall in the bedroom is an option that does not convince everyone. However, changing the reddish tone for something softer, like white, will make the environment look less harsh and will probably win over your 'partner' more easily.

Have you ever imagined a colourful covering for the bedroom wall? How about some paint? Blue is a fresh and cheerful colour that, however, transmits peace and tranquillity, something basic in the bedroom.

Thebedroomwalls are blank canvases waiting for the teacher to arrive. You can use different textures and colours to generate spaces full of personality. A solution like this in neutral tones, for example, will be ideal for giving the bedroom a sober and sophisticated look.

Wood is one of the materials par excellence for those seeking warmth in their environments. So much so that its use as a bedroom wall covering is more than recommended for those who like to look for that characteristic 'warmth of home'.

The bedrooms are full of original solutions and none of its elements escape becoming a focal point within this space. The headboard is a key piece of any bedroom and can give a lot of play. Illuminating the back will make your bedroom an original and authentic space in equal measure.

If what you are looking for is something that goes beyond the usual proposals or the trends and fashions that everyone follows, why not some padded walls for the bedroom? They are comfortable, and different and the 'newness' is sure to impress your companion. Ready to try?

A couple shares many things, including the design of the bedroom. So that there are no fights, you can opt for a decoration that both parties like. If you share hobbies with your partner, posting photos related to the topic is a perfectly valid option for the design of your room.

The bedroom is a space designed for rest but also a place to enjoy. That being the case, why not use the walls of the room to place a television so you can watch a movie or play a video game? An original and fun idea to continue sharing unique moments with your partner.
Ceiling lights are common when it comes to artificial lighting in modern rooms. An option that you can consider is to adapt this system to the walls to achieve a more original and harmonious image.
You can also readsuperb lighting ideas for your home.
They say that opposite poles attract and, as if it were an invisible magnetism, these brick and wood walls form a perfect combination to make this bedroom a unique and singular space.

The use of mirrors ininterior design and decorationis a resource widely used by professionals in the sector. Their particular characteristics make these elements have a very positive impact on the aesthetic aspect of the design. However, beyond the elegance they can provide, mirrors are a perfect resource for spaces in which the dimensions are not too generous and, among their properties, the ability to make spaces look visually larger stands out.
Another resource that you can use when covering the walls of the bedroom is wallpaper. Take it as a game and involve your partner so that you both enjoy the decorative process from start to finish.

Sometimes it is enough to put our talents at the service of decoration to create spaces full of charm. If you have a good hand with brushes, dare to give life to your particular designs on the bedroom walls, motifs that make you dream without having to go to bed.

Decorating the wall of your double room does not mean flooding it with ornamentation. It is enough to reveal its charms in the form of natural materials to conquer with a single glance as in this captivating design.

Lightingis a determining factor in the design of any room but in the bedroom, it becomes even more important. Generating an intimate and personal atmosphere is key to turning your bedroom into a unique space.

They have as many defenders as detractors and the use of pastel tones on the walls of double bedrooms does not convince. However, if you and your partner agree, nothing more is necessary… Let's paint!

In a society in which every square metre is valued at the price of gold, not a single corner of the home should be wasted. That said, the walls of your bedroom can also serve a purpose as displays. In addition to serving aesthetic purposes, they will help you put some order in the room, what more could you ask for?

To taste the colours, the saying goes and we will not be the ones to argue against it. Through them we can express thousands of sensations and feelings so if you are thinking about choosing the tone of your bedroom walls, our advice is that you choose the one that best represents love for you and your partner.

Over time, couples reach such a rhythm and synchronicity that they even share particular tastes, such as preferences for a certain material. If so, don't think twice, give free rein to your creativity and incorporate it into the design of your bedroom walls.
If you want to know more proposals for the walls of your room, be sure to read our idea book:15 Best Colours For The Bedroom Walls Of Your Modern Home.

We have already told you about the idea of using mirrors on the head wall, and also about having a part of the wall padded. But what if we combined these two ideas into one? Framing the headboard area with a mirror and leather padding can be a perfect combination of comfort and elegance. The mirrors will give depth to the room, and we can use them to see ourselves when getting ready. We combine aesthetics and functionality in a single element. We love!

We may be accustomed to conceiving walls as the only dividing element in homes, but the truth is that we are wrong. When it comes to distributing a space, we can do it not only with partitions but we can also do it by introducing other elements, such as lattices. It is a perfect method for dividing spaces without the harshness of a partition, and it allows us to make the rooms we need independent, but also perceive a continuity of space. They can be made of metal, or wood, with different designs, with or without glass… You have infinite options to choose from, and creativity is endless.

We are used to seeing fabrics in furniture, such as sofas, headboards, sofas… And on the walls, we usually see different colours for modern double rooms, in the form of paintings. But the truth is that it is very interesting to be able to use the fabric for the walls themselves. This provides warmth and forms an exquisite envelope for the interior of our bedroom. Although we can create texture with other materials, fabric provides us with a much greater feeling of well-being and comfort than any other material.

title: 9 Great Examples of Extraordinary Facades
author: Denise Schopen
article_paragraphs: Have you already thought about the facade design of your house? The facade of a house plays a decisive role—if notthedecisive role—in terms of the architectural design of a property. By choosing the facade—in terms of colour and building material—you can determine the style of your home. You always have the choice: Do you want an inconspicuous or a more eye-catching facade design? Have you ever thought about a black, dark grey or even light yellow or red facade? If you don't yet know which colour to choose, you should take a look at the following impressive examples of facades from ourarchitects.You will be amazed at how beautiful different facades look! Whether it is a log cabin, bungalow, single-family house or wooden house—they can all benefit from a new facade. If you are still looking for ideas for a single-family house, you will find plenty of inspiration here: You will like these greatsingle-family houses!

A greyfacadealways looks modern and appealing. In addition, the grey colour is generally very resistant to dirt. This means that if you have a grey facade, you can enjoy a facade that always looks clean and well-maintained.

This stepless, smooth roof fascinates architects and inspires modern-minded builders. Thisdesignidea looks particularly beautiful with a symmetrical covering made of large slate panels. These panels make it possible for the facade and roof to be built as a monolith out of one material and completely smooth. The result is a modern building with a traditional look.

The house, which dates back to 1935, shines with a new façade in light green. The colour matches the shutters and the fence of the house perfectly. This creates a great unity of house, entrance area, fence and front garden. The red roof provides a very attractive contrast to the light green house.

The external appearance of thishousesuggests a flat roof on the street side. A pent roof is visible on the back. By choosing the same material for the roof and wall coverings, the wall and roof elements visually merge into one another. The external walls slide over the black residential structure as a white shell. This house fits wonderfully into the green surroundings.

The starting point for this house was a cube. The cube shape was hollowed out inside to create a spatial sculpture that uses the available space precisely. The wooden facade creates a modern ambience and a cool look for the house. The natural materials mean that the house blends perfectly with nature.
A red facade creates a particularly beautiful overall picture for detached single- or two-family houses.
An old building looks particularly harmonious due to its yellow facade. The windows form a great contrast to the yellow design of the exterior wall.
Grey and white harmonize particularly well with each other. This makes every facade look twice as appealing.
The colours white and yellow also complement each other perfectly – whether in theinterior designor the design of the facade.

title: Artistic two toned living room walls that are the trend now
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: Want a bold and unique living room that surprises and delights visitors? Instead of looking for luxurious furniture or expensive paintings choose to surprise them with two tone walls in the living room. Walls with two color tones can add space and dimension to a room if done well without compromising on budget. You can choose to add two neutrals or a bold with a neutral on the same wall or to adjoining walls to get the right effect. You can also add elements like bricks, wood and glass to get the two-toned effect that matches with the overall décor style of the house. Here are some interesting combinations to pique your interest.

To add a touch of rustic splendor and add dimension to the the rectangular living room the decorator added red bricks on the TV wall. The overall neutral color palette of the room provides perfect setting for stylish furniture of this suburban home.

In thisclassic style living roomthe interior decorator has created bold and inviting look with grey panels which divide it from dining area. The wall forms a charming background for furniture while maintaining classic partnership with neutral walls on both sides. The bold but solid combination creates an atmosphere of soothing calm as patterns have been kept at minimum for impact.
The soft tones of this boho living room pink tinged furniture and walls get a unique touch with a dark and bold cork wall in black.
The wall paper in this living room forms a joyful partnership with painted walls to create suitable background for lush furniture that invites you to just relax.

There are no rules stating that two toned wall effect should only be done with paint, here tinted glass has been used along with wall paper to give a new modern touch to the living room. Light beige sofa and chaise lounge have been decorated with a mix of neutral and colorful cushions that make a steady partnership with sedate stone top table which adds grace to the room.
The wall colors and design textures form a perfect backdrop forlayered lightingthat fills the room and highlights the décor.  This combination is what we call effortless and chic.

To open up this slightly closeted living room area the designers used a combination of light furniture, subtle lighting, soft textures and soothing colors to make it lively.  False ceiling with hidden lights adds to the enchantment of this room.

The contemporary living room with to tone walls is a modern fusion of modern and contemporary elements. The wall colors bringmodern flair to this living room's design scheme of stylish furniture and lighting elements.

One word when you behold this is WOW! The color combination here is dramatic and boldly brazen which makes it an unusual choice. The combination with monochrome black and white tiles along with grey floor mats adds to the picture as do the sofas that work in tandem with wall tones. The dark and light colors here balance each other in a sophisticated combination.
Now that the living room is sorted let us explorewhich color is best for the bedroom.

title: The Best Interior Design Hacks For Round Walls
author: Denise Schopen
article_paragraphs: Round walls or curved walls often present us with the challenge of choosing the right furniture: it is a special type ofarchitecture.If you have walls in your apartment or house that are not rectangular but round, it can be difficult to find the right sofa, table or decoration for the wall. Whether it is a bedroom, dining room, kitchen or bathroom: in this article, we would like to present you with a few ideas for unusual wall shapes. In this way, you can decorate your apartment or house in style even if you have a round wall.
So, let’s get started right away and look at the best interior design hacks from ourinterior designers.

A particularly harmonious interior design is one in which you use round furniture. Choose armchairs, tables and other furniture that have rounded corners. The furniture does not have to be circular in this context: pleasantly curved shapes also look very nice in combination with a roundwall.

Here you can see another piece of furniture that is also perfect for designing rooms with round walls. This chair with a round seat and round side table fits perfectly with the design of round walls. By the way, the chair always looks cool—regardless of whether you have a curved wall or not!
You might like to take a tour of this idea book:An Overview of The Best Interior Design Projects by Li A'alaf Architect, Selangor.

If you have a round or curved wall in yourliving room,you should not place the furniture directly against the wall, but rather a little away from it. This way, it doesn't seem as if the furniture has to fit perfectly against the wall and a nice, relaxed atmosphere is created in your living room.

If you use round decorative elements, for example in the form of lights, you will create a more harmonious ambience in your room. The shape of the round wall is picked up nicely in this way. Round vases or other designer pieces are also possible.
Are you wondering how to make use of benches as a decorative element in your home? This article,9 Practical Ways to Use Benches in Home Decoration,will serve as a guide.

If you have a special wall shape, you can also stage the wall as a work of art and design it attractively. By choosing colour, structure and other designs, you can create a creative wall that works on its own and doesn'tneedany furniture in the immediate vicinity.

Round stairs go particularly well with round walls. This way, the space is used optimally and the design of the wall is skilfully picked up. There are numerous different designs of round spiral staircases: wooden staircases, glass staircases, narrow staircases, spacious staircases, etc.
Decorative Stairs: 12 Stunning Designs To Wow Guests.
Here you can see a spacious glass spiral staircase that fits beautifully into the design. Round shapes are particularly well emphasized in this way.

It does have to be made individually depending on the curve of your wall, but it's worth it! A kitchen with curves attracts attention! The curved shapes also adapt perfectly to round walls and thus create a great overall look. A carpenter orkitchen plannerwill be able to advise you!

title: Unconventional garden fences that are excellent alternatives to standard ones!!
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: To maintain privacy and also for marking their property people tend to create fences made of barbed wire, stone, bricks and wood. There are several alternatives that one can use for fences depending on budget and property size which can look amazing and also be environmentally friendly. If you want an alternative to traditional garden fences then take the help oflandscape architectsor try out any of these DIY ideas shared by our experts here.

Plenty of hedge varieties are available that you can use to mark the property and maintain privacy which can look both functional and attractive. You can use plain leafy varieties or flowering bushes  like bougainvillea and others to add color and beauty. All these hedge varieties require care and maintenance so select your variety carefully before plantation.

If you cannot find natural bamboo plants to grow around the yard then use these dried bamboo sticks as a physical barrier. These are quite cheap, easy to install and do not require much maintenance. The best part of dried bamboo is that they blend into local vegetation and do not stand out like a metal fence.

People set up fences just to avoid curious glances of neighbors and these boxwood planters provide just the ideal kind of privacy. With the help of an experienced gardener you can set up these boxwood hedges around yourgardenor also place them in planters on the yard's edge to maintain privacy.
Instead of standard metal sheets or concrete wall why not make a combination of both like here wherein metal is balanced with concrete to give a trendy feel to the backyard garden.

Brushwood is one of the most popular and eco-friendly choice for people that do not want to install traditional fences. Due their color and structure they blend in easily into the garden and look like local bushes. Here the barrier has been doubled with flower bushes along with brushwood so the boundary is obvious without being overtly obtrusive.

The large garden spread across the steep slope here has been given a stylish and modern makeover with stone and metal fencing. The boundary wall is further protected by terraced plantation and hedges along the edge making the entire arrangement look attractive.
Here are some morecheap and effective garden fence ideasfor your reference.

title: Fall 2020 Home Decor Trends
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: Interior decoration trends change as seasons changes and you may not have to do major overhauls to meet current season trends as few key inputs and removals can set the right mood for fall. While summer brings in bright sunny colors with cheerful hues, fall and winter usually season are signified by earthy tones and rich textures that evoke warmth. Top decoration experts feel that this year lighting, fabrics and several other details will play an active role in setting trends for fall. Find these ideas here along with some of our inputs that can help you become the fall trendsetter in your neighborhood.
Classic indigo blue will play a big part during this fall season specifically with white and multiple shades of navy.

With winter on the horizon every home needs cozy seating facilities. In thismodern living roomthe deep beige sofa is supported with cozy cushions while semi circular mini sofa chairs form a perfect twosome partnership.

Layeredlightingin this open floor region dramatically separates the public and private regions of the house highlighting each space. When the dining or kitchen regions are not being used just turn off the overhead lights and just turn on the chandelier in the living room to get the dreamy effect.

In these stressful times when human interaction has reduced and people are confined to home it is best to fill the surroundings with soothing elements that offer calming effect. Indoor plants and seasonal flower arrangements in every part of the house provide an atmosphere of excitement and happiness.

Exposed bricks in different parts of the house are a design trend that will never go out of fashion and this fall they are back pushing tiles and wallpaper to the backseat. Unfinished walls with just simple whitewash give a stylish finish to industrial style bedroom like here as they provide raw touch to minimalist interiors.

Rattan furniture which was limited to gardens and patios are now finding their own space indoors in Fall 2020 Home Decor Trend. Rattan sofas, settees, poufs and even stools and center tables are available in woven rattan at all decor retailers of repute. Decorators say that if buyers are not able to buy rattan pieces of their choice in store they can use reclaimed rattan furniture lying around in the garage.
Let us now explorebathroom trends of 2020.

title: 20 Wardrobe Ideas For A Small Bedroom
author: Xenia Atanasovski
article_paragraphs: A smallbedroomis not uncommon. We often consciously choose the smallest room in the apartment as our bed chamber because this is our retreat where we relax and sleep. For many people, the wardrobe belongs in the bedroom, but if the room is already small, the wardrobe should also ideally adapt to the circumstances. Below you can see 20 examples of wardrobes in small bedrooms.
Here's another similar idea book that talks about small bedrooms:13 Smart Ways To Fit Bed In Small Bedrooms.
You get the maximum amount of space with an integrated wardrobe. Depending on the length and height, any amount of clothing can be stored.
Niches are perfect as a wardrobe. On top of that, you have used your space as efficiently as possible.
Often the full height of the room is not used. As this example proves, tall cabinets are an ideal solution for storing all your things.
To make optimal use of the bedroom space in the attic, the wardrobe should adapt to the sloping ceiling. Clothes rails can also be installed on low walls, as this example shows.
There are also slants in this example. Here the wardrobe was adapted to the wall side, so that it doesn't have to go too deep, but the height also determines the spacious space.

Wardrobes with sliding doors have a particularly big advantage: on the one hand, no radius into theinteriorof the room is required when opening a wardrobe door and, on the other hand, these wardrobes are already available in all possible variations and sizes.
Regardless of whether they have corners or curves—wardrobes can be perfectly adapted to the conditions of the room, as this example proves.
Small rooms are the mother of invention, as this example proves. As a room divider, this wardrobe cuts a very good figure and still fulfils its purpose.
Open cupboards are also suitable for small rooms. We are increasingly seeing cabinets without panelling. This gives the room an open look and does not seem restrictive.

This room is very small but fulfils all basic purposes thanks to its integrated cupboards. This proves once again that you don't always need a large space to be able to accommodate everything important.
Here, too, some niches were ideally used. At this point, it's worth taking the measurements and cutting the cabinet accordingly.
Sliding doors are also very popular here. As already mentioned, they save space and the reflection creates an optical enlargement.
A combined wardrobe fulfils all the functions that are perfect for a small room. Here you have a cupboard with an integrated bookshelf, which is on top of that.
Colours make a big difference when it comes to visually enlarging rooms. A friendly green was used here, which further enhanced the room.
Also, read this idea book that discusses the15 best colours for bedroom walls.

This example once again shows that the height of a cupboard makes a big difference in terms of how the space is used. Tall wardrobes that do not go into depth are particularly suitable for narrow rooms. Nevertheless, there is space for various items of clothing here.

Especially when you don't have enough space in your wardrobe, you have the option of hanging up your clothes. A chic curtain is another eye-catcher here. Clothes racks are also sufficient, as long as the quantity is right.
When the space is limited to just one room, creativity is required. As you can see here, the cabinet also serves as a stylish room divider.

Freestanding cloth racks are also very flexible in their placement. This means corners can be optimally utilized and space saved. If you are missing drawers, they are already available in the smallest shapes and formats. This way, everything can be accommodated despite the lack of space.
For the romantics among us, vintage cabinets are particularly popular. Their small size in particular fits perfectly into small bedrooms and exudes pure cosiness.
In this small bedroom, the red wardrobe is an absolute eye-catcher. In general, bold colours distract from other features, such as small sizes.
Now that you've gotten to the end of this wonderful idea book, here's one last article we suggest that you read:15 Surprising Small Room Design Ideas.

title: Which House Matches Your Zodiac Sign?
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: Purist Bauhaus style or romantic cottage? A littlehousein the countryside or a designer villa in the city? According to astrologers, our very personal idea of the perfect dream house also has something to do with ourstar sign.We are curious to see whether it applies to you.

People born under the sign of Taurus are considered authentic connoisseurs who like to surround themselves with beautiful things, take care of others and draw strength from nature. The perfect house for them is therefore in a green area, is big enough to welcome lots of friends and must also meet the taste of its residents in aesthetic terms.

Aries are said to be spontaneous, strong-willed and passionate, real doers with lots of energy and drive. Their home needs to reflect and support all of these characteristics. So the ideal is plenty of space both inside and out, combined with a clean edge and little to no ornate details.

The zodiac sign Sagittarius is often associated with a thirst for adventure, a desire for freedom and flexibility. Sagittarians are usually on the move a lot, looking for new experiences. They would prefer to take their home with them—perhaps on wheels or in the form of a houseboat.

Geminis are generally very open and receptive to new things and are also communicative, innovative and curious in a positive sense. They like to have an overview and don't want to miss anything. Their perfect home is spacious, open and not too secluded, with large windows and a fantastic view.

Scorpios have their own opinions, a strong will and a clear view of their goals. But because they don't reveal everything straight away, they often seem mystical and mysterious to those around them. The tendency not to open up to everyone straight away is also reflected in their ideal home, which should protect their privacy and ward off prying eyes.

Sensitive and emotional, but also assertive and passionate—these adjectives apply to many Cancers. Their homely side likes it cosy and comfortable, not too hectic and nice and relaxed. That's why they usually love more traditional houses, but with a modern touch, without fast-moving trends and big frills.

Most Leos don't believe in understatement. They are self-confident, proud and real leaders—and like to show this to the outside world. That's why their house must not be run-of-the-mill but must have that certain something that attracts attention and comes across as distinctive.

Analytical, disciplined and structured—these are the most striking characteristics of Virgo, who always keeps an eye on the little things and details and always knows how to get the best out of a situation. Ideally, their home combines clarity, beauty and functionality and can therefore be inspired by the Bauhaus style.

Libras are considered creative and open-minded, charming and diplomatic, and always strive for balance—including when choosing their house, which should represent the perfect balance between trend and tradition, between transparency and security.

Capricorns usually achieve what they set their minds to because they are determined, strong-willed, persistent and ambitious. They like their home to be safe, practical and stable, with a traditional, classic touch, but not old-fashioned or kitschy.

Aquarius needs his freedom and loves the extraordinary. This star sign just can't be too cramped—literally and figuratively. The ideal Aquarius house has large windows, open spaces and agardenor a spacious roof terrace.

Pisces are often very sensitive, compassionate and in need of harmony and are also characterized by their tolerance and helpfulness. This zodiac sign cannot cope with too much hustle and bustle around them and likes to retreat into their home, which gives them security and safety.

title: Luxury in the Bathroom: Tips and Trends for an Exclusive Space
author: Mara Silverio—homify
article_paragraphs: In a reality where everyday life increasingly demands that we find time to relax and rest, the bathroom has become more than a functional space. Today, it is a personal sanctuary, a refuge where luxury meets practicality. This article talks about luxury bathrooms, to explore everything from the latest design elements to the smart technologies that transform this intimate space.
Discover how every detail, from the chosen materials to the meticulously planned lighting, can create a luxurybathroomthat transcends mere functionality, becoming a personal expression of refinement.

For a touch of luxury, stay up to date with the latest trends in bathroom design. Choose elements that are not only visually appealing but also functional. High-quality tiles, unique accessories and sophisticated lighting can redefine a room, providing a design that transcends the ordinary.

The choice of materials is crucial to creating a luxury bathroom. Marble, granite and noble metals give a feeling of opulence. By discussing the advantages and disadvantages of each material, you can make informed decisions, ensuring that your bathroom is not only beautiful but also durable.

Integrating smart technology into your bathroom not only simplifies everyday tasks but also adds a touch of modernity. Home automation systems (smart home), lighting control and smart mirrors transform the space into a futuristic environment, combining functionality with sophistication.

The organization is extremely essential for a luxurious bathroom. High-quality storage solutions like built-in cabinets and stylish shelves not only maximize space but also add a touch of style to functionality.

Explore hot tub models, therapeutic showers, and steam systems to create aspa-likeenvironment at home. By highlighting custom designs and installation options, transform your daily swim into an experience of indulgence and relaxation.

Lighting plays a crucial role in creating a luxurious atmosphere. Opt for custom options like recessed LED lights and indirect lighting to highlight every detail. The right light can transform the bathroom into a sanctuary of tranquillity.

Consider sustainable options for conscious luxury. Choose ecological products, invest in energy-efficient systems and explore sustainable construction practices for a bathroom that combines elegance and environmental responsibility.
Personalization and Exclusivity: The Personal Brand in the Bathroom

The true essence of luxury lies in personalization. Add unique elements like custom art pieces, one-of-a-kind furniture and custom-made accessories to create a luxurious bathroom that is an authentic expression of your style.
Explore the inclusion ofspaelements such as saunas, hot tubs and rest areas for a calming and rejuvenating atmosphere,transforming your bathroominto a personal refuge.
Care and Maintenance of Luxury Products: Preserving Excellence
Maintain the beauty of your luxury bathroom with guidance on proper maintenance. Discover cleaning products and methods that preserve quality over time, ensuring your luxury space remains spotless.

In every choice, from design to maintenance, your bathroom becomes an extension of your lifestyle. By following these tips, you'll be on your way to transforming your intimate space into a luxurious sanctuary. Celebrate elegance, functionality and individuality as you create a bathroom that is not just a place of hygiene, but a true reflection of your refined taste.
You can also check out this article:11 luxury walk-in shower wall designs to inspire you.

title: 10 Fresh Ideas to Add Urban Jungle Style in the Home Décor and live Greener
author: LEENA JHA HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: Creating an urban garden amidst the concrete jungle is an art. The interesting fact is that the urban jungle doesn't mean creating a jungle in urban homes. It just means including the jungle theme through prints, patterns, decorative pieces, artificial turfs, indoor gardens, ceramics and artefacts, ornamental plants, etc. Anything that reminds you of the jungle and fills your home décor with the fresh vibe of greenery is a part of the urban jungle style in your home décor. It could be jungle theme wallpaper, fabrics with flora and fauna prints on it, the vertical garden, framed pictures depicting greenery, decorative plants and artificial flowers, accessories… the list could be as exhaustive as your imagination. Let's walk through the urban jungle created by ourdesignersjust for you that will surely inspire you to add the urban jungle into yourhome décor.
Call it avertical gardenor name it urban jungle; it’s the most popular way to add green to the home décor, bringing freshness and positivity into the home.
A few here and few there, the plants in beautiful ceramic planters create a subtle urban jungle that can be moved to change the jungle setting in the home décor.
A green carpet on the balcony floor is a great way to add greenery to the urban home décor. The wooden furniture is a clever addition when craeteing deliberately creating an urban jungle.
