A fountain with plants, natural or artificial, looks beautiful in the home décor. The sound of water, along with green elements, creates a stunning urban jungle.
Urban jungle created through the walls' pictures of cactus and leaves, smartly adds the green elements in the home décor, making the urban jungle.

Unlike the jungle in the open, the symmetrically arranged manicured plants in the planters define the windowpane boundary. In urban homes where space is limited and sunlight scarce, this is a smart way to create a jungle.
Show your animals and jungle love through the cushion covers andwallpaperadorning the wall. Animal pictures remind of the jungle and so the urban jungle in the home décor.

The colossal glass windows with a clear view of the garden outside bring the greenery inside flawlessly. The soothing shade of green seen from the windows brings the jungle's flavour to the urban home.

A single sofa with a jungle print cover on it is sufficient to add the jungle's soothing charm to the urban home. Even the natural texture of wooden coffee tables takes you to the jungle setup with its presence in the home's interior.

The addition of natural elements in the homes décor brings in the divine feeling of surrounded by nature. Create a set of the urban jungle through a stone cladding wall, a paved indoor garden, bamboo sticks decorating the garden and a rattan recliner to enjoy the jungle's view.
Create an indoor garden and bask in natural elegance:8 ways to make your indoor garden thrive!

title: 10 Feng Shui tips to banish bad energy from your home
author: Sabine Neumann
article_paragraphs: Energies play an important role in Feng Shui teachings. Everything is designed to allow chi, the positive energy, to flow freely and have a positive impact on the lives of those living in the house. However, negative energies should not be given a chance to spread in the house. Today we have brought you ten tips that can help protect yourself against bad energy. There's a lot you can do to stimulate the harmonious flow of chi—from a tidy home to fresh air, houseplants and the right accessories to optimal furniture positioning. Are you wondering how you can remove negative energy in Feng Shui by cleaning your house or what does salt have to do with the whole topic? Then you should read on.

Do you want to cleanse your rooms of negative energy? Most of you are probably familiar with Feng Shui in this context. But many people are not aware of what exactly is important if you want to get rid of negative energy and how you can achieve an impressive improvement in the quality of your living with small changes and tips. For this reason, today we have put together ten great and effective Feng Shui ideas for you that cost little or nothing and are very easy to implement. For example, find out how you can smoke out negative energy. Smoking with sage is a particularly popular method. House cleaning also plays an important role in Feng Shui. So make sure that your apartment is always clean and tidy. You will see that you will feel much more comfortable.

By the way, for anyone who wants even more inspiration, we have put togethera home cleaning service—A guide to hiring excellent professionals.This is a great way to start getting rid of negative energy in your house.

The cracked vase, the chair with the loose back, the cupboard with the worn-out door: in Feng Shui, there are no greater energy robbers than broken objects. So you should get rid of anything defective or damaged. This has a liberating effect—not only on you but also on the chi, which can flow freely again. By the way, repairing doesn't always help. Once a plate or vase has a crack, it is not enough to repair it. The breaking point will always attract negative energies.

Bad air disrupts our concentration and well-being and also suffocates any positive energy. That's why it's important to ventilate well regularly and thus create a pleasant, fresh indoor climate. If the air can circulate freely, so can the chi.

The ultimate tip fromexperts:The more cluttered your home is, the harder it is for the energy to flow there. In Feng Shui, junk is nothing but blocked energy and must be removed accordingly. Regularly and consistently clear out everything that you don't actually need and free yourself from unnecessary ballast, both physically and mentally.

Houseplants filter the air in the room, regulate humidity and are even able to break down environmental toxins. They can also reduce stress and have a calming effect on our psyche. In Feng Shui they also fulfill another task: they increase the chi in closed rooms. This means: With the right plants you can protect yourself against bad energy. Spider plants, aloe, cyclamen, orchids and bamboo are particularly helpful.
A plant like this immediately creates a beautiful atmosphere in your home. Try it out and benefit from the positive effects of the plant.

Salt plays an important role in Feng Shui because it not only has a therapeutic and antibacterial effect on food and medicine but also helps us to improve the indoor climate in the home. It binds dust, allergens and odours through the humidity and neutralizes bad energies. In addition to the classic form, salt can also be brought into the room using salt lamps, washes and accessories made of salt.

Mirrors are particularly important in Feng Shui teaching because they not only create a more spacious feeling but also activate the chi and thus improve the flow of energy. However, there are a few things to keep in mind when hanging: Distorting mirrors should be avoided, the optimal position is opposite doors and entrances, and it is better to avoid mirrors in the bedroom as they quickly cause unrest.

We stay in the bedroom and focus on the optimal position for the bed. According to Feng Shui, the installation location not only influences the aesthetics of the room but also the quality of our sleep. The headboard should be against a solid wall that conveys security. It must point neither towards the window nor the door. In general, the bed should not be too close to the window or door.

You should pay particular attention to the entrance area because it is the gateway into the house and the lives of its residents and as such is extremely important for the flow of energy. The front door should convey stability and security, the hallway should be sufficiently lit and subtly show the way into the apartment. The room effect should be light, bright, airy and friendly. So it's better to avoid aggressive colors and shapes.

Roomscents have a great effect on our subconscious and well-being. If you use the right scents, you support the flow of chi and can protect yourself against bad energies. For example, citrus scents have an invigorating and refreshing effect and floral scents have a relaxing and calming effect. Tree scents such as sandalwood and myrrh have a regenerating and balancing effect, while earthy vanilla and honey notes can have a sensual and erotic effect.

Cleanliness is the be-all and end-all of Feng Shui. Chi cannot flow properly between dust and dirt. Therefore, you can get rid of bad energy according to Feng Shui with regular house cleaning. This includes vacuuming and mopping, tidying up, taking out trash, cleaning windows, and eliminating anything that might disrupt chi.

title: The Best Shower Enclosures: 11 Tips for The Right Choice
author: Anne Krusche—HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: Nowadays, we rarely see traditional shower curtains. Even curtains that were originally made for the bathtub are not a popular decoration in modernbathrooms.Not to mention that they are not designed to prevent water from escaping from the shower.Expertsalso say that nowadays, showers are being used more and more, and bathtubs are being used less. This has led to the emergence of numerous options and designs that are available to us in the shower enclosure market. No matter which shower enclosure you choose, it is important for bathroom comfort. After all, it insulates the shower area and prevents unpleasant water splashes that can even lead to accidents in the bathroom.

But first, the question is: what type of shower enclosures are best? Of course, this depends entirely on the shower and the bathroom that the enclosure should fit into. It is advisable to take into account the type of shower we have (or want to install), the material of the walls, the faucet and much more. At the same time, the shower is part of the entire bathroom, so we should also think about how to create harmony between the two. Then, we should learn about the options available and think carefully about what characteristics the shower enclosure should have to choose the perfect model.
Before you decide on a particular shower enclosure, you should know the options you have to choose from.

There are shower enclosures made of various materials, such as glass or acrylic. But you should also think about how tight they are. Should the shower be sealed or not and do you want it to be completely closed? There are also various openings available: for example, the shower can be open on one side or have a sliding or folding door. Of course, there are also many variations in terms of design, as the materials can have different surfaces.
To choose a suitable shower enclosure, we must first consider what features it should have. To do this, we must think about who will be using the shower area; both age and lifestyle play a role here.

It is best to decide beforehand whether safety, lightness, speed, ease of maintenance, ease of access, appearance or other properties are important to you. This will help you choose the right shower enclosure.

Another point is the design of the bathroom and shower area itself in which we want to integrate the partition. The key factor here is the shape of the shower to which the partition must be adapted. But this is not the only factor we must take into account. Of course, we should also know the exact dimensions.
Sliding doors are the most commonly used shower enclosure because they can be easily adapted to different shapes and sizes of showers and do not require any additional space to open.
Partitions with sliding doors are recommended in small showers with limited access space, as they take up hardly any space and thus make access to the shower easier.

Traditionally, partitions with sliding doors were not particularly aesthetically pleasing, as many had built-in aluminium profiles, which made cleaning particularly difficult. Today, partitions have evolved greatly in terms of design and we can find partitions where you can even easily remove the doors yourself without them losing their watertightness later on.

One of the advantages of double doors is certainly their appearance, which always looks stylish. However, you should make sure that the materials are easy to clean. The doors also guarantee easy entry and exit from the shower, as they do not require a lower guide. Double doors usually work with hinges that allow the doors to be folded to either side.

A major disadvantage is the extra space required to open them. Therefore, the use of hinged doors is often limited to larger bathrooms. However, you can also opt for a door that takes up less space and still offers a clean and modern look.

As we have already seen, folding doors are not the best option for everyshower.For example, it is not recommended if we only have a small bathroom. In this case, we should not choose a model that takes up extra space for opening and potentially makes the room seem even smaller.
For small rooms, fixed shower walls made of glass or acrylic are often an excellent solution.

Fixed walls are also used when the shower has a special shape, for example, an additional element that needs to be taken into account. In this example, we can see that only part of the shower could be fitted with a glass wall. In this case, simply installing a sliding or folding door would have been almost impossible.
Glass shower enclosures are usually made of tempered glass, which ensures safety and stability against breakage.

These shower enclosures made of solid glass that reach up to the ceiling can almost completely do without a complex casing. The anchoring is done to the floor and ceiling using small metal profiles, which ensures watertightness. This design is particularly recommended if you want a modern look with clean lines and a minimalist aesthetic.

The glass panels can have different surfaces. They can be transparent or made of translucent glass. There are different degrees of opacity, for example, satin matt using screen printing, or translucent surfaces combined with transparent areas, although the latter has become less common in recent years.
We also have the option of choosing a mirrored surface or allowing a certain degree of reflection. The latter option is ideal for small bathrooms as the effect can make them appear larger.

As we have already seen, the increased use of shower enclosures has brought about great developments, both in technical and aesthetic terms. Great progress has also been made in improving the behaviour of materials concerning humidity and the chemicals with which the enclosures come into contact daily. For example, materials with optimal protection against humidity are increasingly being used, and glass with anti-limescale protection or self-cleaning treatments are being optimised.

In terms of appearance, the partitions can be produced in different colours and even allow the use of adhesive images, screen printing or vinyl. Therefore, the current models adapt perfectly to your wishes and ideas.

title: A Modern Home with Rustic Charm Coexisting Peacefully Amidst the Nature
author: LEENA JHA HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: With an eye on the future, the professionalArchitectsofN O T ARCHITECTURE SDN BHD, in Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia, has done a fantastic job in house renovation. It was a dream for the house owner to get closer to nature and open up the enclosed space, creating a spacious home for the growing family. The designers made a significant renovation by opening up the walls by stacking up the bricks to make way for air and light, stealing space for a courtyard, and harnessing the rustic charm of concrete and bricks. The house is a harmonious amalgamation of modern and minimalism, strength, and intricacy that joins to create a cozy, comfortable family home.

The combination of red brick blocks, the sturdy concrete walls, and the lightweight blocks build up a majestic and welcoming façade of thehouse. The bricks are placed perpendicularly to each other so that there are gaps for air and natural light to seep but obstruct the direct view of the neighbours and passersby’s. Strategically placed garden lights wash the walls in a delicate glow.
The openness of the red brick wall gets carried into the interior of the home. The deliberately placed bricks with openings allow the flow of light and air but protect the house's privacy.
Double height glassdoorsconnect the living room with the courtyard and fill it with nature's freshness. The funky cushion covers thrown on the sofa brings a youthful vibe into the living space.

An openinternal courtyardwith an iron door on the terrace protects the house from intruders but let the freshness of nature and natural light flood the house. While revamping the home, the tree has been saved, which provides the colour and shade.

The modern bathroom is designed to feel rustic, with concrete on the sink counter, the wall, and concrete slabs as the bathroom tile. The mirror hanging from iron doors covering the ceiling's opening adds to the bathroom's industrial feel. The sun window fills the space with natural light and fresh air. It's modern, minimalist, and rustic in concrete and industrial in iron.

A wooden deck, small garden, garden furniture, and natural light flooding the cosy internal courtyard from above; it’s a perfect romantic corner for morning tea or late evening relaxation with a piece of nature amidst the concrete.

Wooden wall with niches on it, a corner with chalkboard wall paint in black and white, the concrete floor covered with rug builds up a spacious play area for the house's children. The open plan and the philosophy of ‘less is more’ with the generous use of natural elements, natural materials, and conscious changes to bring in the natural light inside makes it a fantastic home décor.

Double height living room with high glazed glass fills the living space with natural light in the day and the shine of artificial light from the courtyard creating a stunning décor. The Illuminating colour of the sofa and the concrete floor makes the living room trendy in the Pantone colour of the year 2021.
Check out these fantastic ideas to include Pantone colour of the year 2021:Pantone Color of the Year 2021: 35 Ways to Bring the Elegance of Illuminating and Ultimate Gray in your Home

title: 20 house facades you should see right now (to get the most inspiration!)
author: Elisabete Figueiredo—HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: Being able to count on a rendering or 3D model of the design of our future house gives us a clear idea of how it will be once built, without the need to lay a single brick. In these visualizations we can see the final product in detail, with the possibility of making modifications and changes according to our desires and conveniences, duly advised by a professional specialist in the field, thus ensuring that our home looks exactly as we always dreamed. In today's article, we show you 20 house facades, in 3D models, that will surely inspire you to design your project. Come and discover them on homify!
Combining textures and colours, such as stone, metal and different shades of colour, makes the facade of the house much more interesting.

Wood is a very attractive material, but there is no need to overuse it in the project. A few details here and there will make your home look wonderful, especially if you want to achieve a modern and contemporary design.
Smooth finishes are very attractive as they are icons of modern design. Also note the hierarchy of the wood element in the main entrance, which makes the door appear to be double in height.
Some flowering plants, or some vegetation, can be placed flanking the access paths to the main entrance, demarcating and framing it, which looks especially good in houses with a contemporary design.
This facade is special for small, two-story houses, with compact facades that can have a great visual impact.
Integrating vegetation on balconies, sidewalks and other parts of the facade gives thehousea much more interesting appearance and better integrates the construction into the surrounding environment.

A large vertical component can help differentiate the various sections of the residence'sarchitecturalcomposition and breaks the monotony of a design that extends horizontally, with an elongated shape, providing greater stability to the proposal.
The entire architectural language used in the ironwork of this facade is the same, giving cohesion and uniformity to the entire project, and making the facade much more attractive and sensible.
This facade works a bit like a curtain, as the balcony that opens at the top serves both to appreciate the surrounding landscape and to integrate the landscape into the interior of the house.

A complex and unique design for the railings that will protect the house or garage will make them the focal point of the design, accentuating and complementing the rest of the architectural composition of the house.

Roofs or cladding panels can give a much more interesting and attractive tone to the facade of the house, especially if you play with the different levels to create a floating effect and greater height, especially if it is a single-storey house.

The volume of compositions on facades always tends towards balance, static or movement. The latter is achieved by proposing a volume that stands out from the others at one end, like the one seen in the image, over the main entrance of the house.

Several horizontal elements create a beautiful visual effect that gives great personality to this facade, adding to the excellent combination of textures and colours that the different finishes on the walls of the residence provide.
A volume with a contrasting texture, like the volcanic rock cladding of this house, highlighted against the prevailing white, gives a modern and contemporary style to this simple facade.
There is nothing more modern than using white, neutral and light tones to add more light to a facade. If we add to this a very green garden in front, we ensure a winning combination.
In this photo, at the end of the balcony, a plant barrier was proposed, perfectly combining with the warmth of the wood that covers one of the walls of the main facade of this beautiful residence.

This facade is sober and simple, but very pleasing to the eye, thanks to the combination of tones used in the proposed painting, which combines perfectly with the exposed brick elements and the wooden entrance door.

A vertical and perpendicular element to the rest of the house can serve as a plane that intersects it and gives a differentiating touch to the visual composition of the facade, delimiting areas and balancing the overall design of the house.

Also remember that you can combine styles, as in the image proposed, where a house with a gable roof is still modern and contemporary, but simultaneously gives a nostalgic feeling, thanks to the windows and tiles covered in dark grey.

Houses with one floor become much more familiar and welcoming, as shown by this project for a house with a simple facade, where the garage slab appears to be a single piece that runs through the entire building and creates the roof structure.
To find out how to achieve the effects of these facades, and many others, be sure to also read the article17 modern and minimalist home designs to inspire you

title: Interior design trends 2021
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: Design trends change every year and in interior decor it is not limited to just colors, textures, materials and budget as now environmental sustainability also plays a major role in influencing decisions of homeowners and decorators. So let us explore which trends are likely to be continued from this year to the next and which ones are likely to replaced.

The challenges this year have been unprecedented and none have remained untouched so it is likely that the next year we will try to make things cheerful with bright motifs, simple details and sustainable natural materials.

The trend of dark wood for furniture and walls which was more of a classic era fad has slowly given way to light toned wood. In this lovelyminimalist living rooma charming feature wall has been created out of timber cladding to divide the hall and kitchen bringing a sense of warm serenity into the area.  The wall cladding is part of a sleek upturn that turns into a bar counter while it provides visual lift to the kitchen ceiling with the light tone.

The focus now will be on maximum utilization of space to create rooms that are open and make a statement with placement of items in a holistic manner. Here a carpet with distressed design that makes the room look absolutely stunning with the neutral toned furniture and unusual ceiling light arrangement.

Have you heard of the grand millennial trend? This trend is focused on reviving traditional colors and motifs to replace the existing white and neutral colors.Interior decoratorsand house-owners are bringing out colorful antiques, wicker furniture and old chintz covered sofas to add life to homes. Here is a glimpse of grand millennial style trend with beautiful carved furniture and colorful details on the walls.

The trend of setting up statement pieces in the middle or end of a room is catching on and is likely to stay till next year. This will elevate room decor to a higher level in a simple way and keepspaces clear of heavy stuff. In this room too the uniquely designed center table is the statement piece here.

Experts feel that the ongoing pandemic and hardships that came with it has witnessed a renewed interest and appreciation of DIY projects and natural fabrics.  Instead of artificial materials people are moving to natural fabrics and materials that are easily recyclable.We feel that there will be growing demand for natural fabrics like cotton, linen and wool along with natural materials like wood, stone and bricks.

As we said before people are going to bring on colors with enthusiasm this year and it will be more visible in furnishings and fabrics than on backgrounds. Here a neutral themed home has received abreath of new life with deep velvet sofas, golden hued curtains and colorful table mats.
Navy blue will the new black in 2021 and will play an active role in all rooms. Here the blue tone is used to enhance the library and give it an elegant and contemporary finish.
Graphic art is a popular trend among the millennial generation and this is showcased in this trendy bedroom wall that gives a stylish edge to overall room environment.
Want to explore some more interior decor trends? Why not browse throughLiving room decor trends of 2020

title: 8 Compelling reasons to adopt large windows
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: Planning to make a house? Why not consider large windows that offer beautiful vistas of the world outside and also let in fresh air during hot summers? With the wide variety of styles and sizes of windows available in the market along with attractive window dressing options choosing large windows today is an advantage. While they make rooms feel large, these windows also add beauty and charm to the building. Floor to ceiling windows are quite popular nowadays between rooms as they allow natural light from outer rooms to the interior sections of the house. Let us see from these designs created by ourinterior architectsthat display the advantages of large windows.

With greenery fast disappearing around us having a vision like this is a real blessing. Large windows like these bring nature indoors so both children and adults can have a close connection with nature. The expansive windows here are the focal point of this room that allow the residents to  capitalize on the surrounding landscape's view.

Large windows spread across the wall create a soothing ambience to enjoy periods of leisure with or without company. Irrespective of the weather outside you can always relax near a large window like here. The living room feels expansive and spacious with windows that always let in fresh air and light at all hours of the day.

Sunlight is essential to maintain health and when it moves into every part of the house goodness is guaranteed. During the days of heavy monsoons when everything inside begins to show signs of mildewlarge windowscan allow sunlight to stream in and take off the bad odor of musty clothes and damp furniture.  Here this large window along the balcony is the best solution when you like to have open spaces without the threat of burglar attacks.

Want privacy in the bedroom but not compromise with requirement of fresh air? Why not adopt this marvelous window seat idea which is large enough but the glazed glass protects from outside view. Technology today can help you choose the right size of window and types of glass to enjoy the best of both worlds.

The smart combination of small and large windows here leading out to tiny garden allow fresh air to enter and fill the home with sweet aroma of flowers. The strategic location enables air circulation across the house and improve interior air quality. So the emphasis should be on not only fitting in the right window sizes but also selecting the ideal location for them.

In an open floor house like this wherein both dining area and kitchen are in close proximity it is essential to have large windows close by to keep away smell of food from the dining area.  Large floor to ceiling windows like here provide clear view of outdoors that creates illusion that people in the dining area are sitting in another room.

Well-positioned kitchen windows can contribute to circulation of fresh air in the kitchen across the day.  Utilizing large window design can help keep the kitchen surroundings look bright and fresh and also make the region energy efficient as there will be lesser use of artificial lighting during the day.

The bathroom has been cleverly designed here to allow sunlight without compromising on privacy and it almost blurs the division between the bathroom and the small garden outside. The large window keeps the region free of moisture and dampness even in wet weather.
Do explore some moreamazing external window designs.

title: 16 leather chairs and armchairs that will take your decor to a next level
author: Press profile homify
article_paragraphs: Leather chairs are timeless and stylish — they're an obvious choice for an upscale look. But there are more benefits to leather furniture. If you want your armchair to get even more comfortable as it ages, then leather is a great choice. It's made to become more supple as it's worn in over time, and it's durable enough to resist fading. Leather is also usually of exceptional quality and won't easily peel or crack like other materials might. It's also easy to clean with just a few wipes, and it's long-lasting so you won't need to replace your chairs for a while.
If you think the benefits warrant a higher cost, consider leather chairs or armchairs. While you may have to put more money in initially, leather is an investment worth making.

These grey leather chairs fit in nicely in this dining room. With a neutral like grey, you can easily add more colour to the room or keep it minimal and decorate only during the holidays. The cutout on the back of the chairs add an interesting detail but they'll still be comfortable because of the high back.

These funky slightly low-back chairs match the unique look of this room. Opting for neutrals like brown can be a good choice if you want other areas of the room to shine, like the walls, a piece of artwork, a rug, or a coffee table.

These dark brown glossy chairs look great in this dining room. With a regal silhouette, these chairs are simple but add dimension to the room. Plus, leather chairs are comfortable enough to survive a long meal, even in this long hall.
These dark leather chairs add dimension to the room — don't be afraid to choose darker colours when it comes to leather. While lighter leathers can be pretty, darker leathers look rich and luxurious.
If you want to forgo a usual leather chair in favor of something different, try adding a leather bench to your living room. It's a good option for guests or putting your feet up after a long day.
Leather doesn't have to mean glossy — suede chairs a nice option if you like a softer material. Suede is also more casual, and would look lovely in a western-themed home.
For tired arms, pick out a chair with oversized arms. This glossy brown leather armchair screams luxury and urban. Perfect for placing by a large window.
This classic armchair shape looks marvelous in leather — if you're an introvert, you won't want to leave this spot all day, especially because that leather is so comfy!
A wingback chair is a fun choice if you like a lot of support. Whether at your desk or in your living room, this leather chair will be plenty comfortable.
This armchair has barely there arms that won't get in your way (if bulky armchairs aren't your thing!).
What could be more relaxing than a leather recliner? Featuring soft, supple leather, arms for resting, and a footrest, this chair will de-stress you no matter what you're going through.
When you need to get moving, find a chair that can get you there. This leather rolling chair would be a fantastic option for an office.
Another classic look, this black leather chair looks effortlessly stylish in this living room. We'd love to sit and read a book there.
Leather chairs are the ideal complement to a library or bookcase — there's simply no comfier place to sit and read a good book.
Leather can translate to the kitchen. Getting leather highchairs can be a good option for you if you like to entertain guests or want to upgrade your old stools.
Consider leather for your living room furniture if you want durability, a stylish look, and a piece that you can use again and again.

title: 15 Modern Colors for your Chic and Contemporary Bathroom
author: LEENA JHA HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: When it comes to bathroom décor, it's the bathroom color scheme that makes or breaks the space's look and feel. The modern homeowners emphasize a chic and comfortable bathroom to relax and rejuvenate in privacy. Whether you prefer to cover the bathroom walls with tiles or decide to pick up the brush and paint it, the wall color sets the ambiance. The professionalBathroom designersare continually experimenting with creating the perfect color scheme. Step out of the comfort zone of predictable style. Check out these modern color styles to adorn your contemporary bathroom walls.
The natural tone of stone on the walls polishes off the sophisticated look. It gets complemented by the grey color on the ceiling and concretefloor, creating a soothing ambiance.

What's pastel in the naturallighttransforms its color like a chameleon in artificial light. The hidden light source's strategic position paints the bathroom wall in coral color while the rest of the area not lighted remains in pastel.
Add a lot of funk in the bathroom with lines of wooden shade on the walls. The greens of the artificial plants on the wall further paint the wall to make it attention-grabbing for its funkiness.
The dark fantasy of chocolate creates a rich décor making it a luxury bathroom. Match the bathroom cabinet to uplift the luxurious elegance of the décor.
Brew up the storm in themodern bathroomwith stormy blue on a portion of the wall. Balance it off with the calmness of creamy white and bask in the contemporary vibe of the space.
The boldness of black, combined with the calmness of off-white and natural earthy tone, makes the atmosphere formal and intimate.
The unmatchable luxury of golden hue spread across the bathroom wall brings a sophisticated feel and pleasant warmth. The yellow light will further enhance the shine and make it glow.
The pure and pristine white color fills the room with a peaceful vibe and makes the space look bright and beautiful. It’s a perfect color for thesmall bathroom.
The open brick wall in the natural color of brick looks chic and contemporary. If you are looking for budget ideas for a bathroom wall, then this one is for you.

The modern color of grey is quite popular when it comes to the bathroom wall color. Follow the trend and cover the bathroom walls in the dark shade of grey and enjoy the elegance it brings into the décor.
Let the bathroom beam in a cheerful color of blue. The color blue has a calming effect on the mind and soul. It makes the bathroom feel like a spa.
The blush of beige gets a boost with the dark brown on the adjacent wall. The two colors on the bathroom wall create a stunning style in the enclosed space.
The earthy tone of taupe merges with the shine of blue, adding modern elegance to the bathroom.
The soothing calmness of purple is contagious. Paint the wall in purple and feel the cool and calm energy filling the space.

Different textures and three different shades of the same color bring in a rustic style in modern décor. The best thing about it is that the low maintenance will prove to be convenient for the bathroom.
Check out this ideabook for more bathroom wall ideas:
Ideas for your bathroom walls

title: Grilles for Doors and Windows: 20 Fantastically Beautiful Designs
author: Anne Krusche—HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: Creating a safe home is one of the most important factors to consider when planning a house. Installing shutters is a popular option, but when we think about ground-floor security, it takes more than that. Nowadays, there are a variety of grilles that not only provide more security but also decorate our homes with their design. We have brought you 20 fabulous examples to help you choose the perfect protection for doors andwindows!

Beautiful and with a charming flair: Our first example is double glazing with internal grilles. The delicate, light design of the grilles further underlines the style of the house and guarantees greater security.
Robust, stable and durable: The decorative iron grille not only offers more security for the front door but also beautifies the entrance area.
The steel grid that we see in this example is characterized by a straight, minimalist design and creates an open, airy feeling of space.
To match this impressive entrance area, the grilles were decorated with delicate, decorative objects reminiscent of abstract flowers.
Despite the grille, the house's floor-to-ceiling windows provide an open and bright appearance that beautifully connects the indoor and outdoor areas.
Here we see an aluminium sliding door with a grid structure that visually separates the bathroom from the rest of the living space, but allows enough views to maintain the open feeling of space.
Learn how to your door problems yourself!

This lattice construction looks traditional and modern and makes the entrance look particularly charming. A wooden lattice was installed to match the front door and complemented by additional glass inserts.
Another way to provide your home with more protection is to install a grille in front of the window.
It looks particularly harmonious when the grilles reflect the style of the house, as we can see in this example. Here the grille in front of the window becomes a decorative highlight.
In this case, the white front door was fitted with glass inserts, which became an individual eye-catcher thanks to ornaments.
Away from the traditional grilles for windows and doors, there are now wonderful designs that decorate the outdoor area. Here, delicate, flowing lines have been used to create a unique door grille.
A very special design is this window protection, which is reminiscent of a plant and beautifies the entire facade with its modern design.
The geometric pattern of this lattice is a central eye-catcher and additionally decorates the terrace. In addition, the seating area is protected at the sides by sliding glass doors.
For this artistically designed window, diagonally arranged, overlapping bars were created, which offer a high level of protection while maintaining the decorative character of the window.
Double protection for the windows: In this example, double glazing was combined with internal grilles and shutters made of light wood.
The window grille becomes an eye-catcher when you paint it in bright colours. In this case, the yellow fits wonderfully into the tropical surroundings.
For houses in a minimalist style, grids with straight lines and no decoration are best suited.
Who says a grille always has to be installed outside? Here we see an example of how wonderfully it can be placed inside too.
Grilles are now available in a wide variety of shapes and sizes, so there is a design to suit every window.
Our last example also shows howdecorativea window grille can be. In addition to protection and security, it gives the exterior a very special character.

title: Decorate Like a Pro: 15 Insider Tips That Interior Experts Swear By!
author: Anne Krusche—HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: We all love to find out about new trends and tips in architecture and living. Whether inmagazines,blogs or the catalogue of your favourite brand—there are countless ways to keep up to date. But we don't always have the time for that. In that case, we want a simple and short overview of the most important tips andtricksthat we can use at home when furnishing and decorating without much effort. For all of you who feel the same way, we have put together the best insider tips from professionalinterior designers and decorators:You should know these 15 tricks!

Even if you generally prefer the classic style and combine your sofa set with matching cushions, it might be the right time to be a little more daring. Many of the experts recommend a mix of different colours, materials and patterns. If you are unsure, start with the cushions and choose an accent colour. Tip: Velvet is one of the top trends this season and is perfect for an unusual cushion cover.

Many people choose low beds, but it has been proven that a higher headboard can visually enlarge thebedroom.Of course, this is just an illusion, but it is an easy way to change the look of a room without having to renovate everything.
Light colours on the walls are another way to make a room appear larger. You can choose the classic white or neutral tones like beige or grey.

A studio or one-room apartment offers numerous advantages and, with a little creativity, can be turned into a true dream home. From functional sliding doors to modern shelves as room dividers, there are numerous ways to create a unique home in a small space.

It may seem easier to use a regular bath mat, as these have a plastic backing that is designed for wet floors. However, if you want a high-quality look, you might as well lay down a stylish rug. If it gets wet, just dry it on the radiator.
9 Bathroom Ornaments to give it a Stylish Edge.

The hallway is much more than just a transition into the main living area of the house. It is the first thing our guests see and represents our entire interior. Give your hallway a personal touch by adding a special wallpaper or an unusual picture.

One of the most important rooms in the house is the bedroom. This is where we relax and recharge our batteries. To feel good, however, we need more than just a comfortable bed and beautiful furnishings. The right light also plays a big role. That's why interior experts would never do without a pair of chic table lamps next to the bed!

Although extravagant colours and patterns have their appeal, you should think carefully about whether they are the right choice. They can make a room appear smaller, while classic colours look elegant and stylish without changing the living area.

While many people tend to fold their blankets carefully so that they look tidy, experts recommend throwing them loosely over the sofa or an armchair. This is how your blankets come into their own and decorate the room.
We admit that we didn't know it made such a big difference: the mirror opposite the door makes our rooms seem smaller. However, if you put it opposite a blank wall, it creates an optical enlargement.

We all know them: small, tiny niches in the house that make it difficult for us to find suitable decoration. The living experts' tip: instead of placing small decorative elements, choose a house plant that brings a piece of nature and a lot of freshness into the house!

Is your patio door a bit old? Then install a modern folding door, which is particularly popular at the moment. Another advantage: They connect the inside and outside areas of the house so that you can enjoy thegardeneven when you are inside the house.

To avoid having to spend hours looking for that blouse that you saw somewhere a few days ago and that has magically disappeared, it's worth organizing your wardrobe carefully. It's best to add good lighting with recessed spotlights—that way you'll find the blouse in seconds!

Many of us may secretly dream of white furniture, but we shy away from buying it because we think the care and maintenance are time-consuming and expensive. Experts recommend choosing white leather. You can usually keep it clean with a wet cloth.
We've already seen how mirrors can transform a room. It's especially useful to integrate a large mirror into small rooms. We bet you'll think your room has doubled in size afterwards.

title: 12 Charming kitchen ideas that complement every home
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: Gone are the days when houses were large and every part of it had enough space for proper design and furniture installations. Over time, houses are becoming apartments and large sized kitchens have become a luxury which few can accommodate. To meet the needs of user intensive kitchens that meets demands of cooking and serving,kitchen plannershave developed modular kitchens with the help of technological advancements which are inspired by various tasks that are accomplished here and its storage requirements.

In modular kitchens cabinets made of wood, steel and laminates provide ample space for storage, cooking and serving. In this idea book, we have described 12 exclusive kitchen design ideas which were created to suit the atmosphere of the house and space available to complement their surroundings.

This contemporarymodern kitchenhas been designed from the top down so that it becomes a complete inspiration in itself. The kitchen has a collection of elegant shelves to fit in all requisite   appliances, and inspires users to experiment with some new dishes every day.

The selection of appropriate decor that blends with the overall theme of the kitchen adds to the charm of the place. The simple, elegant appliances that have been chosen do not occupy much space while the combination of black, orange and steel colors has brought a lot to grace in this stylish kitchen.

Neutral colors and right mix of storage systems make this monochrome kitchen a delight to work in. Kitchen planners must ensure that all drawers and cabinets in the workspace have internal separators and kitchen organizers so that users can decorate various items according to categories and do not need to hunt for essential utensils, gadgets, cutlery or others.

The grandeur of an all white Scandinavian kitchen cannot be more emphasized than here. Besides giving a chic feminine touch to this exquisite modular kitchen the white ensemble pieces make this a wonderful are to work in. The white color palette and shaker style cabinets makes kitchen look expansive and spacious.

Adding a kitchen island does not imply wastage of space here is how it can make good use of empty space. The cooking stove is away from the open window so a chimney has been installed to remove fumes and smoke during cooking. Large pull out drawers neatly fitted below the counters and to the walls with multiple sized shelves are smart storage solutions to keep everything out  of sight and maintain clutter free kitchen.

This inspiring design shows how effective use of space can make every kitchen functional. The combination of built in kitchen implements along with wooden cabinets across the wall ensures that every inch is used effectively. A combination of charming drop down lamps, white counter and wooden cabinets make this open style built-in kitchen truly extraordinary.

Multiple counter work areas should be created in the kitchen so that two or three people can easily work together at one time. This L-shaped kitchen is designed to provide enough space to work so that cooking for a big family is easy and more than two people can work comfortably. Since the center of this kitchen is built on the ideology that the family who sits and dines together remains engaged, the designer has given wings to his creativity to create this magnificent kitchen.

Designed on the lines of a traditional this enchanting modular kitchen is built with wood, glass and combination of three colors. Thoughtful use of gray and dark colors for window frames is extremely complex and creates a perfect harmony with other elements. With the thoughtful combination of glass cabinets adorning the organized wall one can just marvel at the mastery of the kitchen planner.

Some of the traditional elements of classical style kitchen have been retained to give an attractive touch to this smart kitchen. Its high chairs with traditional chesterfield design, white glass fronted cabinets with lights within and marble counters give it a unique charm. Wide windows on both sides keep this beautiful kitchen full of natural light and clean air throughout the day.

Beautiful dark cabinets against white wall and tiles make this cozy kitchen a wonderfully friendly area in which all the family cook and enjoy the delicious dishes together with love and togetherness. To keep the modern kitchen well lit and bright small lights are placed under the cabinets so the work counter is illuminated.

For small kitchens, the vertical structure is the only logical option as one can have a kitchen sink  with a cooking stove on one side, and a large storage cabinet on the other side stands as the work station and prep area. To keep the illusion of spaciousness inside the kitchen, keep it free of clutter so that less time is needed to organize.

Cabinets, counters and islands in stunning white above the sparkling marble floors remind us of large Scandinavian-style modern kitchen. Immersive lighting, in built kitchen implements and open design that effortlessly connects this region to other sections of the house makes it a kitchen worth copying.
Whether you want to renovate a kitchen or create an entirely new one here are some essentials thatyou need to know about 2020's contemporary kitchen designs.

title: 13 Smart Ways to fit Bed in Small Bedrooms
author: LEENA JHA HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: A bedroom without a bed is not what it is supposed to be. So whether the bedroom is small or tiny with no moving space, we still have to fit the bed into it for functional purposes and complete the décor. The moderninterior designers and decoratorsunderstand the challenges the small bedrooms can throw. They have smart ideas to fit in the bed in small spaces without making it look cramped. Let's benefit from the professionals' pearls of wisdom and fit in an essential piece of bedroom furniture into our small bedroom.

Push the bed towards the wall, thus using two walls for the bed instead of one wall. You still will have two sides open to jump in. You can have only one nightstand in this set-up. But then you can design that one nightstand to serve you better.

It’s the designer’s trick to place the bed in the middle keeping the three sides free to move. Make sure that the walls are clear of any décor and the ceiling high. The bed will effortlessly fit in the small space without making it feel cramped.

Large windows flushing the room with ample natural light will trick the mind, and the bed fitted in the small space will no longer be an issue. Design the bed's headboards with embedded nightstand and study-table, and it will be a perfectly designedsmall bedroom.
The bedroom cabinet, open shelves, storage as the headboard along the walls, and a small bed with a comfortable mattress in between; this bedroom furniture style is perfect for thechildren’s room.

A smart bed crafted with a partition cum nightstand and a woodenheadboardalong the wall. A hanging lamp drops down right on top of the bed. The beauty of this bed is that it’s a complete bed for the tiny space.
Get creative with the flooring and build a floor within the floor to create more space to fit in the bed in your small bedroom. Get some idea from here.
Get rid of the in-built nightstand, and if you need one, replace it with a movable one. A simple portable stool will not take on any space, allowing you to fit in the bed even in a small space.

Shiny sliding doors of the cabinet and the large mirror on the door create an illusion of spaciousness and take away the attention from the room's size. Use the wall above the headboard to build up storage space.
A simple bed in minimalist décor creates magic and a boon for a smallbedroom. Also, place the bed in the middle keeping the three sides open for fluidity and comfortable movement around the room.

Customize the bed in your small bedroom and enjoy the elegance and comfort of the space it provides. With an elevated platform, mattress on it serving as a bed, a wooden board stretching to be nightstand/ study table, and simple décor, this minimalist style brings youthful charm into the small bedroom.
The pastel shade upholstered bed brings in minimalist luxury even in the small bedroom. With a floating nightstand and wall-mounted open shelves, the room feels breezy and spacious.
Be bold and play with the dark shade in the small bedroom and then choose a simple yet elegant floating bed and nightstand to finish the décor.

Explore the length of the bedroom and place the beds adjacent to one another. It will even allow you to place two beds in the space for one. Give your bed a second job, which can be pulled out to make more beds when needed.
Check out this ideabook to know the do's and don't of the small bedroom:The do’s and don’ts for small and sophisticated bedrooms

title: 11 Illuminating Ways to Bring in the Natural Light into your Home
author: LEENA JHA HOMIFY
article_paragraphs: The warmth of natural light filling the house interior can cheer up the décor, change the mood, enhance the color and elegance of the décor, and it also comes with the health benefit. No matter what artificial lighting you choose for the house, it's the natural light that matters the most since we spent most of the waking hours with the sun shining bright. The professionalarchitectsplan the house consciously, trying to bring ample natural light and reap its benefit. Let's scroll down the ideabook and get fresh ideas to flush your home with sufficient natural light and bask in the sunshine. Have a look!
Let the wooden roof end with the sunroof filling the room from the light from above. Extend the sunroof to the glasswindow, making way for more natural light inside your home.
Go bold with the windows and brighten up the home with natural light rushing through it. Think about choosing the French windows made of glass for an unobstructed flow of light.

Replace the brick and concrete walls with a toughened glass wall, especially those facing thegarden, courtyard, or balcony. The large glass walls will energies the house with the freshness of natural light all through the day.
Install clear glass on windows and doors instead of frosted or colored glass. It will allow more natural light to enter the home and keep the house well lit by daylight.
Brighten up thestairwayswith a glass screen moving with it. The massive floor to ceiling toughened glass creates a bright and spacious home interior that also look modern.
Three-way glass windows will bring sufficient natural light inside the home. Go easy with window treatment, and if at all covering it, cover it with delicate drapes.
Don’t block the view or light when designing the room connecting the garden. Choose the picture glass windows and complement them with glass doors for a clearer view and natural light.

A glasshouse amidst nature is a perfect way to flush the home in natural light. The natural light seeping through the glass will connect inside outside from where you can enjoy the sun and view with family and friends.

Venetian blinds, heavy curtains, or thick fabric will block the natural light even if you have large glass windows. Opt for light and delicate fabrics to dress up the window and enjoy the feel of natural light.
Large windows opening up to the open space are an excellent way to bring in the natural light. Create a window seat near the window to bask in the sun while relaxing with your favorite books.

Lit up the enclosed bathroom and drench it with natural light by going for the wall to wall and floor to ceiling glass windows, replacing the wall, and then choosing all glass doors to separate the wet area from the dry.
Make your home stunning with these sliding doors:17 Stunning Sliding Doors to make your Modern Home more Stylish

title: Repairing Wooden Stairs Made Easy—Here's How!
author: Sabrina Werner
article_paragraphs: Stairsare often the number one accident site. While peeling paint and squeaky steps indicate a need for renovation, a rotten staircase or a step with a broken edge is a real accident hazard. But how do you know if a staircase needs to be repaired and what can you do if the steps need to be refurbished?

When it is time to repair a wooden staircase depends on the appearance, but also on safety. While old wooden staircases tend to squeak and their paint looks worn, this does not necessarily mean they are a source of danger. Staircases with clearly worn-out steps, a wobbly railing and rotten wood, on the other hand, urgently need to be repaired so that they meet safety requirements again.

If the paint on the steps and railings looks worn out and is already crumbling, the stairs can be made to shine like new again with little effort. Before the stairs can be repainted, however, the old paint must be removed. Depending on the type and design of the stairs, this is not so easy. Especially if the stairs have a beautiful railing with turned elements, the old paint must be removed carefully so as not to damage the wood. Removal with a hot air dryer is particularly suitable if the stairs have several layers of paint. The method is particularly cost-effective because no expensive paint strippers need to be purchased and, if used correctly, paint removal with a hot air dryer is extremely effective. Users should wear a mask to avoid inhaling toxic fumes and the wood must not be burned with the hot air dryer. You can usually tell that the paint is hot enough to be carefully removed with a spatula by the formation of bubbles on the surface of the paint. The more ornate the stairs or bannisters are, the more important it is to use tools of the right size. Under no circumstances should the paint be removed with force. After removing the paint with a hot air dryer, the wood can be filled, sanded and repainted as required. A combination of natural-coloured wood with a coloured painted bannister looks stylish, especially if the steps are still intact.

Scratches, dents and pressure marks on the steps look unsightly but are not a safety risk and can usually be removed without much effort. Scratches and small dents can be repaired with wax. The easiest way for the hobbyist to do this is to use a ready-made repair kit. In addition to wax in various colours, this usually also contains sandpaper and a spatula. This method is suitable for both solid wood and imitations such as laminate. Before the scratches can be repaired with wax, surface treatments must be removed with sandpaper. Splinters and crumbling material are removed and the edges are sanded smooth. The wax is then warmed up and worked into the scratches or dents. To ensure that the surface is smooth, a cotton cloth is placed on the waxed area and ironed over. Once the wax is cold and hardened, the area can be finely sanded and sealed.

Broken corners not only look unsightly, but they can also cause injuries. If small splinters stick out from them, you can pull them into your skin when climbing stairs, and if the broken corners are too big, they can cause falls. If the corners have broken out so far that the steps are different depths, the step must be completely replaced. If several steps are badly damaged, one option is to build over the steps. The new steps are cut to the millimetre and the old steps are built over with the new material. The old core of the staircase can be retained and the entire staircase does not have to be ripped out. If you are planning to have your staircase built over, it is best to get advice from one of our experts beforehand.

If the corners are only slightly damaged, they can be repaired using simple means. To do this, splinters and broken areas are sanded down and adjusted to the edge of the stairs. The step is then resealed—with wood varnish for example in the case of wooden stairs—and shines with new splendor.

If the steps of the wooden staircase are very damaged, you should consider whether it is worth replacing them individually or whether it might be appropriate to replace the entire staircase. This depends on how complicated the replacement would be. If the staircase is only attached to the wall, it can usually be easily dismantled and a new staircase installed. However, if replacing the staircase would involve major demolition, it is worth repairing the broken steps. Broken steps are best rebuilt. This is best done by aprofessional.However, laying new steps is also quite easy if they are covered with suitable wooden panels. If it is possible to dismantle individual steps because they can be unscrewed individually, replacing the entire step is the simplest and cleanest solution.

Wood works. It expands when exposed to moisture and contracts when it is dry. This is also reflected in wooden stairs that creak and squeak. If the creaking of the stairs is due to shrinkage of the wood, this is usually remedied by using small wooden wedges that are pushed into the resulting cracks. If the steps are bent and creak as a result, they are reinforced from below. Both methods are quite common, but can only eliminate the cause of the creaking if the construction is not faulty.

Stairs are often the focus of accidents. They don't even have to be damaged for this to happen. Even intact stairs can cause accidents if, for example, the steps are difficult to see or the step length does not match the size of the steps. Stairwells and stairs in the home should generally be well lit and the edges of the steps should be easy to see. The stairs are not the right place for flower pots or other decorations. They should generally be free of obstacles and allow people to pass them without being disturbed. In terms of the tread, the steps should ideally be between 26 and 32 centimetres deep and have a step height of at least 14 and a maximum of 19 centimetres. The safest option is a railing that offers a secure hold when using the wooden stairs. The steps themselves should be completely intact. Worn, smooth steps, a broken light bulb in the hallway lighting and greasy or loose handrails on the stair bannister can lead to accidents and should be repaired as quickly as possible.
If you want to know which staircase suits your home best, then read12 stunning staircase designs to wow guests.
