title: 7 amazing benefits of interior courtyards
author: Justwords
article_paragraphs: Architecturally, courtyards make perfect sense. They give the residents of a home a private outdoor space, which is secure and usable throughout the day. With its natural ventilation, acourtyardhelps the house stay appropriately warm or cool without the need for heaters and air conditioners.

In a warm climate, a courtyard can bring down the house’s temperature, saving on energy bills. Several courtyards also include natural cooling elements as a part of their design like a fountain, a basin, an artificial waterfall, thick external walls and double-glazed windows.

Interior courtyards are very much in vogue today for the above reasons. They provide an aesthetic means of spending time with nature in the midst of a busy schedule. And the best part is that courtyards work with any style of home – modern or traditional.

So from growing an indoor garden to creating a serene corner in a crash and burn busy lifestyle, interior courtyards can do so much to enrich your life. Here are some more advantages you can enjoy with efficient courtyard design.

An interior courtyard centrally sits under the open sky, flooding the space around it with daylight. Every room that opens into the courtyard gets
its dose of sunlight during the day, helping you with energy savings.

The
benefits of being exposed to this optimum quantity of sunlight are well known, and
even during a daily workday, you’ll benefit by simply having your morning tea
in a natural refreshing environment. For courtyards that are located in the
front or back of the house, the adjacent room can be the kitchen or living room,
which is most often used during the day.

Centrally located courtyards in urban setups may be surrounded by
high walls restricting the entry of light. In such cases, you can use exterior
reflectors on your windows anddoors.

A courtyard can be enclosed as well, like the one here, which stretches along the wall that is common to the living room and dining area.Skylights overheadflood the room with natural light, replicating the experience of an authentic outdoor courtyard but with the comfort of airconditioning. The zen design theme enhances the ambience and spreads serenity throughout the area.

For centuries,interiorcourtyards have been created to aid the purpose of natural ventilation. Ventilation itself serves many purposes. It provides fresh air, improves oxygen supply and dilutes odours. When planning courtyard architecture, keep room for cross ventilation, which offers the maximum cooling effect.

Courtyard ventilation also has passive cooling effects during the night, which brings the overall temperature of the place down. In addition to this, a courtyard filled with plants and a garden area helps keep the house cool even in scorching and arid climates.

A courtyard acts as a space separator within the home. An indoor courtyard between the living room and bedrooms, can work to increase the privacy between these areas, not letting casual visitors walk in unwittingly. It provides a break in the décor too, with each section gaining a new personality that goes only with the central flow.
A courtyard between thekitchenand living room is a perfect place for entertaining guests as well as unwinding after the day’s work.

A courtyard can also be a connector of spaces within the home, providing accessibility to different parts with ease. If you have a
courtyard in the front or at the back of your house, it not only acts as an
entrance or exit point, but can connect to more than one room depending on your
courtyard architecture.

A centrally located courtyard, on the other hand, can provide
access to multiple rooms in the house, making movement easier. Take a cue from this stylish courtyard rendered byBalance Property Ltd., interior architects in London.

This courtyard design incorporated an open area in the centre of an office, offering the perfect haven for relaxing in the middle of a busy day at work. The design ensures that the tree can be viewed from the differentlevelsof the building. Moreover, it optimises the natural light in the building to create a cheerful and comfortable work environment.

With a courtyard, you have the option to enjoy the refreshing joy of being amidst greenery without having to look for it in far flung jungle
reserves and nature resorts. Simply head to your courtyard to rejuvenate your
eyes with the sight of green—it's beneficial for health.

The great part of having a courtyard is that you can enjoy what different
seasons bring in. From blossoming flowers under the summer sun to the hundred
hues of green during the rains, to the select blossoms of winter, you can enjoy
it all without stepping out from your home.

If you love and enjoy your connection with nature, you can take it a step further in your courtyard. You can not only plant decorative plants, but also
use a small area for vegetable and herb farming. Your own little patch of
organic farming can find a wonderful place in your courtyard where sunlight and
cool breezes will keep it company. When you start with courtyard planning for
edibles, always go for ones with a quick turnaround time—between 60-90 days, like
leafy greens—which can be harvested before the change of season. Also, choose
to plant these in a pot than directly in the soil, so that you can move them around
in case of an unexpected downpour.

There are different types of lawn grass that can be replicated in
patches in your courtyard that can envelope your feet in morning dew. Choose
the local soft variety that doesn’t attract insects, and is fairly resistant to
climatic changes. Or if you don’t have the time to grow or maintainplants,
then deck the place with pebbles, rocks, and pieces of wood for an organic feel.

A courtyard with beautiful and comfy seating area, flowing curtains, plush rugs and quirky coffee tables can be an ideal spot for quiet reflection, meditation,
reading books, or enjoying a cosy chat. It can be a place to unwind, entertain,
connect with nature and enjoy the simple pleasures in life.

With some courtyard planning, you should be able to gift
yourself a meaningful space! For more inspiration, check out these8 amazing solutions to make your garden more private!

title: 10 Trendy bathroom designs for modern homes
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: We spend a majority of time planning about interiors of our home and do not hesitate to invest there, but when it comes to the bathrooms budget considerations come into play and its decor is ignored. Whether it is small or largebathroom designershave the experience to plan and design bathrooms that compliment the overall picture of every home. They can create functional and storage-friendly bathrooms that are tailored to the needs of every home according to the budget and space available for designing.

An essential thing to keep in mind while designing bathroom is to ensure that there is sufficient sunlight and fresh air in the area. Intelligent bathroom designs not only offer adequate space through schematic design but also make the users feel refreshed and relaxed when they step out. Take a look at these 10 attractive modern bathroom ideas which managed to win hearts because they tick all the boxes related to cleanliness, space, design and style.

The use of glass walls and transparent shower cubicle adds depth to this bathroom, while large white bathtub and walls highlight spaciousness against contrast color of brown floor. The large shelves built for storage under the countertop give this room a sense of spaciousness as tiled mosaic panels along the wall add artistry to the minimalist bathroom.

This medium sized rectangular bathtub and elaborate stone tiles of unique designs have been used to give a regular bathroom a fresh and trendy look. Application of long mirror on the wall behind the washbasin makes this trendy bathroom look more spacious as it reflects brightness of the bulbs above.

Despite being small, this bathroom is a truly magnificent design that looks stylish due to its combination of all white equipment and decor. We have a toilet seat, a bathtub and a washbasin in white with beautiful nesting lamps adorning the ceiling. The light, combined with the walls, creates the illusion of a wide space on light-colored floors of thisScandinavian style bathroom.

A discerning glass shower at the end of the bathroom gives us new designing goals. We are fascinated by this design where the designer cleverly integrated two features into one without wasting an inch of space.

Bathroom vanity is an important feature of every bathroom and it is critical to choose a design that works well with overall layout and decor. In a small rectangular bathroom like this an in-wall floating vanity is a good choice as it leaves visible floor space making the room look bigger. If there are children at home ideally have a vanity with an inset basin like here and a storage section on top to keep essentials.  An attractive and functionalbathroom vanity island works well within this rectangular bathroom space.

Although the simplicity of the Italian style is exceptional, new elements can also be added to modernize it so that the right balance is maintained. Using a color like white in the background gives this trendy bathroom space and style that is emphasized by the black counter and basin area.

Use of multiple textures, colors and materials gives this modern bathroom and edge over others. While sandstone walls and sparkling white sanitary ware retain its modern edge the lovely marble floor and counter give it the luxurious edge. The springy grass growing on its walls add to its unusual layout which the designers wanted to achieve.

The gleaming bathroom looks attractive and the addition of glass barriers at every water outlet keeps the floor dry. To enhance its attractiveness, the beautiful counter has decorative oval washbasin while stone tiles adorn the floor.
The checkered pattern of black and white mosaic tiles has been used to overlook the shortcomings of the small bathrooms in this home, the result is modern and sophisticated.

If you have space to accommodate a bathtub  why not go for a Jacuzzi in sunken style like here so that the space looks a bit wider. In this square bathroom, you can see how much space is available here in spite of two washbasins and other storage details like cupboards built above the bathtub.
If these stylish bathroom designs have convinced you to transform your bathroom here are tips onhow to choose the right bathroom accessories.

title: 12 Modern bathrooms that you will love
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: A modern bathroom is important for every home that already follows stylish and modern decor throughout the rest of the residence. Modern bathroom decor ideas create a spa or hotel-like atmosphere within the home. Several details are required to make a ideal bathroom but it all depends on the space available to design and budget allocated for the project. While a spacious shower area or a large bubble bath creates the perfect atmosphere for relaxation a bathroom should also have inlets for fresh air and sunlight to keep the region dry and free of odor.

Modern bathroom designs can add beauty to your home because having a well appointed and decorated environment is enough, no matter whether the bathroom is big or small. The material used in furniture and floor decoration and bathroom walls can be beautiful and functional, making this place ideal and comfortable. Reflective surfaces of glass, beautiful flower pots and brass taps can also be used to show modernity.

To give your bathroom a new look, you don't have to change the tile or add stone counters and carpenters. Here are 12 ideas that are practically free created by Homify's creativebathroom designersso that your bathroom take on an entirely new look. Choose one or two or try out all 12 and write to us how it looks!

When you have space to spare around the counter area then make the most of it like this charming decoration here. The overhead lighting panel above the wash area and lightly colored glass counter barrier added to the exclusivity of thismodern bathroomthat sparkles with subtle tones.

When planning the shower area it is necessary to keep in mind the overall bathroom size so as not to obstruct the passageway for other activities in the bathroom. Here the stylish shower area is against the wall and close to the windows so the trendy bathroom due to flow of natural air and light and is always clean and dry. The large handles on the sliding doors are easy to use as well as save space.

Designing a stylish storage area in a small bathroom while maintaining all essential details is a tricky job. ButGarra + Punzal Architectshave managed to do exactly that by setting up a storage cabinet under the wash basin and also setting up a spacious storage region close to the ceiling.

There is no law that says that bathroom furniture should only be above the counter or below the counter or on walls because the lighting is better. Place a low hanging lamp for counters or add small stools that are lying idle elsewhere in the house and can add beauty to stylish bathrooms by placing plants etc. on it. An old chair has been artfully renovated here to work as a grooming area and towel rack.

Why not add a bathtub when you have space to set up one in your bathroom? This oval-shaped bathtub against the gorgeous grassy wall gives the bathroom an exquisite look and creates a spa-like atmosphere. This bathroom idea with elegant cabin style stage and ceiling lighting encourage you to spend hours soaking after a long day at work.

Water splashing all over the bathroom is a common problem whenever one takes a shower if the region is not secluded. With this kind of rimless glass design, you can enjoy your own shower cabin, which, despite being part of the attractive bathroom, seems almost invisible!

If you lack budget to build cabinets are are worried that water and warmth in the bathroom will lead to early rot then go for this kind of industrial style storage racks. One of the most common bathroom design ideas now is to set up wall decorations by swapping some from other rooms or to print some favorite online pictures from the internet or find some favorite postcards and decorate it in a antique frame.

If you are a lover of luxury and display that around the house then why stop at the bathroom door? Keeping the decor style of the house in mind designers have created a spa or hotel-like atmosphere with artful design elements. The eclectic combination of pearl, gold and brown color palette make the region look modern and give serious bathroom designing goals.

To keep a small bathroom fresh and airy maintain it as a clutter free zone. Here is a bathroom that is a heady combination of light elements, neutral colors, light pink sandstone tiles and a shower area with a frame-less glass panel that plays a primary role. The trendy cabinet area area is a smart bathroom storage idea that makes effective use of vertical space.

Love the old Victorian style? Our designers here have used an old ornate mirror with character to bring that element of nostalgia into this bathroom. Along with ceiling lights the candle-stand style wall light holders add to the bathroom ambiance. This is what we call a modern day classic style bathroom design idea.

The sandbar design tiles on the walls of this small bathroom make it a very modern and unique place. While the sink and sanitary pot are close to each other the shower area is in a separate part. The use of stone on the counter and white sanitary-ware integrates these spaces visually, so the use of light colors in small spaces is never wrong while the integration of lighting around the counter area is done in a consistent fashion.

The mirror here attracts our attention immediately due to the beautiful blue wall and plants visible in it. Linear placement of showers, sink and chamber pots make this bathroom a functional space. The storage area above the chamber pot and transparent shower area make this bathroom feel spacious.
If you still feel that bathtubs cannot become a part of small bathroom then look at  thesesmall bathrooms with bathtubsto get ideas to set up one for yourself.

title: 12 ways to embrace minimalist interior designs
author: Rita Deo
article_paragraphs: Minimalist design style is characterized by simple and spare decor, clean lines, limited silhouettes and muted color palette based on the logic of “less is more”. Thoughinterior designers and decoratorsusing this style do not shrink away from using vibrant and rich colors they use it skillfully to retain an uncluttered and simple environment that is warm and inviting instead of being cold and sterile. An important part of minimalist design is functional division of decorative objects and furniture in the house in a casual manner so as to retain plenty of natural light and enhance its architectural details. This look can be achieved by investing in minimalist storage details and keeping a tight rein on embellishments and exotic decor items that people tend to accumulate during overseas trips or get as gifts. Here are some easy to implement ideas anyone can use to bring minimalist style of decoration into their homes.

Though some minimalist designers prefer to remain frugal and sparse while designing layouts minimalist decor is not always low budget or about spending less. Common minimalist design trends include adaptation of designer fixtures like designer light fittings, unique electrical equipment and contemporary details to decorate without clutter. Here we see aminimalist living roomidea with interesting combination of floor lamps and drop down lighting arrangements.

Modern adopters of minimalism in interior decoration are people that are tired of ostentatious details and crave elegant simplicity. To achieve this one should avoid non-functional furniture parts and embrace open spaces in the house. Here minimalist interiors are dominated by the spaciousness that welcomes in plenty of natural light and pushes it to every corner of the house.

A minimalist bedroom is a comforting oasis of light colors which are just a few shades different in tones and feature an eclectic combination of furniture and furnishings in similar light color palette to maintain consistence. The bedroom room here is a well edited example decorated with neutral colors that are easy on the eye like cream, white, beige andindustrial style lightingin black.

Use thoughtful assortment of furniture and furnishings to create a balanced living space that is both comfortable and light. Simple pieces that can stand on their own and compliment the other pieces spread across the house and are value for money without looking cheap are the best.

Combination of multiple textures is another minimalist design style that raises simple decor above several notches to extraordinary. Texture here is being offered by using materials wall paper, dining chairs with unique patterns and stylish light fixtures that blend form and function in a functional home item.

if you have a large piece of art then use it as a focus point in a public part of the house either the living room, foyer or corridor end and allow it dominate the region.  Bring life and excitement to austere regions with a splash of colorful painting whilst retaining light furniture simple, modern furniture around the area.

A common minimalist kitchen idea is to keep it as open as possible and fuse it with rest of the house with as little wall barriers as possible.  Sometimes people get carried away with minimalism and layout is made of poor quality materials and features. Instead keep things cheerful and bright in the kitchen by using large windows to let in natural air and light. Enhance the light color palette with bright colored appliances and dishes while staying clear of unwanted clutter in the form of unnecessary prints and designs on cabinets, walls or floor. Limit the kitchen design to simple crafted cabinetry and minimalist storage solutions to keep the region organized and store majority of things out of sight.

Modern minimalist design does not imply complete lack of accessories as then the house would look sadly aseptic. Decorate with collectible accessories for showcase residents' personality and taste in each room to make the home unique. To get it right make tactical use of decor pieces and   routinely swap these aesthetically pleasing accessories every season to create soothing effect. We love the minimalist den design here with light sprinkle of colorful cushions below floating shelves with simple artistic pieces.

If your home is located in a strategic place like atop a hillock or in a multi-storied complex and has  a phenomenal view then exploit it to the maximum by keeping walls to a minimum and using glass.  Keep the views as the focal point across the house and limit furniture. Use focal artwork on the wall or in strategic places and plenty of indoor plants that look startling against the exterior landscape like here.

The study area featured here has blinds that are appealing enough to add a note of sophistication to any kind of layout. As they are partly sheer and are almost from ceiling to floor their fluid lines are in touch with the minimalist decor style of the room with simple wooden furniture and open floating shelves built into the wall.

Straightforward mix of minimalist colors like black and white with a dash of grey gives a charming finish to this mid sized bathroom. We love how the straightforward use of just three hues and interesting coordination of white accessories with straight lines against dark background  brings minimalist touch to the region. Keeping the surfaces free of clutter brings a sense of calm and cleanliness to the space.

An essential part of minimalist style is using natural light and limited materials to create forms that stay embedded in the design. Base architecture should be constructed with style to meet functionality goals and visually unite the entire house. Floors should be on par to create connections between rooms with minimal joint lines like here where the music room and living area gracefully merge.
Scandinavian style is quite similar to minimalist that relies on simplicity of form and lines to emphasize starkness of design. Here areinteresting ideas to nail Scandinavian style.

title: Flaunt Your Home with these 10 Spectacular Small Kitchen Ideas
author: Rita Kumar
article_paragraphs: Having small spaces in your house is never a drawback as long as you know how to make optimum use of the entire ambience. And we should never forget that being compact actually paves the way for that cute yet chic finish!
So today at Homify, we're going to take you to a brief illustrative tour to 10 spectacularsmall kitchenideas that you should definitely not miss this season!
Continue reading to find out more..!

Did you know that adding rich and sassy bright colours to your kitchen cabinets could actually bring out an illuminating space that's too cute to avoid?! If you're still having a doubt, just take a look at our first illustration—a gorgeous kitchen is made to look like a heavenly cooking paradise with a minimal finish brushed on the cabinets. To highlight the look with posh beauty, thekitchen designershave carefully fused rich brown-tinted cabinets with a random pea-green hue. And the lighting is something that adds to the overall gorgeousness of this amazing idea!

Too much clutter and mess in a small kitchen is a big NO! To give life to this concept, ideal and spacious cabinets are crafted on the wall as well as below the counter to catch hold of all the cooking essentials and crockery. This look not only saves some space but adds a bravo of a finish to your compact kitchen!

If you want to bring out an astounding look from your small kitchen, then this concept might be of great help! A rich blue-matte finish to the entire cabinetry row as shown in this illustration is simply marvellous and adds a matte-toned glow to the entire space. Splendid white lights finish the overall look with ultimate gorgeousness!

With this amazing idea in mind, you needn't stand anymore while you stir your delicious soup! A cute table-themed cooking countertop fused with a couple of chairs is a thoughtful idea to take a seat while you cook! Now that's awe-inspiring and functional, isn't it..?!

While your kitchen might be already small, overcrowding the space isn't a great idea. To combat this little worry, make some space for nesting heavy materials and electronics as shown in this illustration. This idea fits the bill of making use of every corner in a neat and sophisticated manner.

The kitchen shown in this illustration is just like a piece of an ice-cream cake..! To bring out that sheer gorgeous finish, the designers have beautifully aligned the look with a chic ply finish. Now that's what you call small yet splendid kitchen blessed with a top-notch professional look!

While everything in this illustration falls in perfect place, there's something that adds to the cuteness of this small kitchen concept. Yes, we're adding some shade on thelighting! Rich yellow lights that are beautifully aligned under the cabinets, on the ceiling, and inside the small glass-cased cupboards are too spectacular and gorgeous to take the eyes off!

Purple is a mind-boggling colour that brings out the best looks when used in interior design. And this tint is not to be missed in your kitchen as well! A matte-purple finish brushed on every bit of your kitchen cabinetry paves the way for that astounding and glossy kitchen you'd dreamed of!

A beautiful combo of blue-toned cabinets makes the way for an astounding when fused with pearl-white walls and blinds. To toss the look with ultimate gorgeousness, shelving some posh ceramic ware is a great and mind-blowing idea!

The aroma of beef steak getting that final toss of red wine in the pan is too amazing, especially if you're standing in a vintage-themed kitchen like the one portrayed in this illustration! A compact kitchen such as this is revived to life with a beautiful classic theme brushed with gorgeous low-hung chandeliers and a dim-lit ambience. Whether it is the aromatic Maplewood furniture or that all-wood finish that sits beautifully on a concrete-paved kitchen, this concept is an irresistible theme for those who love things the vintage way!

title: El Precio Galleria—The Best Design & Fit-out Solutions
author: Rita Kumar
article_paragraphs: Since 2009, there is a team of interior architects who have left no stone unturned when it comes to furbishing houses with the best looks. Yes, we're talking about none other than theEl Precioarchitects! Whether it is design, renovation, or classy interior architecture, this wonderful team is always up and ready with its astounding and unique concepts that are affordable and elegant. Whether you're in need of a modern interior design concept or a lavish rustic finish, El Precio has got you covered with everything your house needs in terms of looks and comfort!
Today at Homify, we're going to feast your eyes with their wonderful gallery that has a few concepts that crown the goodness of interior design concepts. Continue reading..!

We all love that 2-in-1 concept, don't we!? Especially when it comes to flaunting the best looks in abedroomwhile still saving some space round the corner! Hats off to El Precio architects for this wonderful bed + seater concept where there is a classic fusion of a bed beautifully aligned with a posh seater. Doesn't this look remind us of that classic boarding school bedroom?! Well, this concept is a great idea that not only saves a lot of space in the bedroom, but also brings out the essence of modish looks with a vintage touch!

A sofa-bed concept such as the one shown in the living room is a great idea, especially when you have guests in the house. This concept not only saves space, but helps make use of the available space in a neat yet modern manner.

El Precio architects always come up with vibrant and classy concepts and this furniture design is a perfect example of what we're talking about! A gorgeous looking wooden coffee table has a perfect makeover when dining! Yes, this amazing coffee table is also a dining table that makes way for saving some space in a minimalistic house. This idea is a great fit for single families and bachelors!

Sometimes, a single accessory might make a big difference! Well, El Precio's accordion chair concept proves the same here! While the length of this chair might seem too big for a small room, well, you might not be aware of the fact that this single piece of furniture actually saves a lot of space here! And to keep the look clutter-free, this accordion chair concept is seamlessly fused with a wooden cabinetry at the backdrop and few wall decors.

With semi-finished stone-blocked walls that deserve their part of gorgeous looks, El Precio has fused the looks with rustic-style wall art by going for paintings and portrait-style pictures. This is clearly a great concept, especially for those who love the essence of rustic looks!

The Chesterfield sofa is the best piece of loose furniture that brings out the looks of this minimalistic living room. El Precio architects have made a perfect fusion of loose furnishing that goes well with theinterior decor, while keeping the look minimal and chic.

A bar stool concept seamlessly makes way in between the loose furniture, adding to the looks of this modern living room. And the concrete table is a splendid idea that not only looks classy, but also saves some bucks without having to go for costly furniture.

El Precio architects have beautifully aligned this wall, making it more than just a feature wall. The asymmetric-patterned bookshelf is too gorgeous to let go of, especially in a Scandinavian-style living room that is fused with the essence of posh looks and decor!

Like everyone else, El Precio architects know the beauty of art! And in all their interior design concepts, they've never forgotten to fuse the looks with gorgeous artwork. Here, the team has chosen to beautifully fuse the looks of loose wooden furniture and wall paintings. The amalgamation of colours is simply awe-inspiring and fosters the importance of art in home decor!

A foldable chair such as the one shown in the illustration not only looks good, but also helps in saving a lot of space. The finish is clutter-free and too wise, especially for those who love to keep their room minimal and far away from being clumsy!

While table lamps are the classic way of fusing some decor to the study area, a floating table lamp such as this is completely unique and just wow! El Precio architects have chosen to keep the look minimal yet adorable!

A lavish wing chair that peacefully sits towards the corner of the living room is a great idea to crown the looks with something classic and luxurious. We totally appreciate the fact that El Precio architects are totally mindful of adding lavishness to every nook and corner of their project!

title: Classy Materials for Kitchen Countertop
author: Rita Kumar
article_paragraphs: Gone are the days when kitchens were just a traditional destination where your family's best nutritional goodies came from! Anykitchenwithout a proper countertop would not only look cluttered but also a mess. Out of all the appropriate materials that make the best countertops ever, granite and marble sure top the list!
So today at Homify, we're going to help you through the hassle of choosing the best and classy material for your kitchen countertop.
Continue reading to find out more..!

Marble is one of the most functional materials that makes the best choice for your kitchen countertop. Whether it is its durability or looks, a marble countertop is a must-have to flaunt your stylish modular kitchen. To fuse the looks with more elegance, inclusion of wooden cabinets is a great idea to get that chic finish in your cooking paradise!

A color-blocked finish on the wall using the magical orange and white combo is the added beauty of this compact yet elegant kitchen. And speaking of the the granite kitchen island, well, thekitchen designershave wisely utilized the material to crown the space with top-notch looks and a spectacular finish.

A spacious kitchen setup such as the one in this illustration might get that splendid makeover—thanks to the thick marble countertop that comes with a stretch-patterned look on either sides of the kitchen island. The marble-plated effect of this gorgeous countertop completes the look with an astounding touch.

A compact dining space just near the cooking counter makes the way for a fantastic and unique modern kitchen as shown in this illustration. To fuse the finish with a professional and awe-inspiring touch, the designers have beautifully incorporated granite as the core material for the countertop and dining area.

A modern kitchen attired with wooden cabinets and cupboards is a perfect idea to bring out the modern flair in asmall kitchen. And to add a portrait-like finish to this gorgeous kitchen, the designers have amazingly crafted a white-toned granite countertop that beautifully contrasts with the overall materialization.

While a grey-toned speckle-themed granite countertop makes way for a gorgeous finish, the extended use of granite on the wall that bridges the cabinets and the cooking counter is a brilliant idea. To finish the look off to an elegant makeover, the designers have utilized a wise combination of bright white lights and wooden cabinetry!

A spacious kitchen such as the one shown in the illustration deserves utmost attention and materialization. And an added advantage is the rich utilization of dark-toned granite countertop incorporated throughout the cooking counter as well as the kitchen island that also makes the way for a cheerful dining space!
